name: GM Victor Mikhalevski
headline: I'm a very experienced coach with more than 35 years of coaching and great results of my students in Junior World, PanAmerican and European Championships
about: International Grandmaster Victor Mikhalevski, 51, from Israel
playing_experience: I started playing chess at the age of 5 and I am still an active as a player.
teaching_experience: IM from 1993, GM from 1996
other_experience: I teach chess online and offline
best_skills: I like both sharp positions with tactics and initiative, different types of endgames etc. I also compose studies and some of them won prizes in the study competitions.
teaching_methodology: When I start working with a new student I'm trying to find his weak and strong sides, mostly analyzing their games. Then I start working on their weaknesses not forgetting about other aspects of the game.

name: GM Luke McShane
headline: None
about: I'm 40 years old, living in Cambridge, England.  I have been nicknamed  the 'World's Strongest Amateur'.
playing_experience: I earned the Grandmaster title at the age of 16. My peak Fide rating is 2713, and I am proud to have competed against some of the world's best players. In classical chess, I have wins against Carlsen, Kramnik, and Aronian to my name. I have represented England on numerous occasions. In March 2019 I won an individual gold medal on board 2 at the World Team Championships in Astana.
teaching_experience: Every individual deserves a unique approach. I use my experience to figure out what that should be.
teaching_methodology: Every individual deserves a unique approach. I use my experience to figure out what that should be.

name: WGM Maria Malicka
headline: None
about: I am a 20 years old player from Poland with many years of experience. My greatest achievements include winning a silver Olympic medal and the title of women grandmaster. I have been learning from the best Polish trainers for many years, and now I would like to share this knowledge with others.
playing_experience: I have travelled all over the world for the last 10 years, and played in many different countries. Last 2 years I was playing in United States. I have played in most prestigious international tournaments.
teaching_experience: I taught chess at school and in group classes for two years, I have experience in working with children.
best_skills: Since I am an active player, I am constantly dealing with tournament play, preparation and training. From my own experience, I know what to focus on in order to keep improving  and achieve the best results.
teaching_methodology: None

name: FM Sargis Manukyan
headline: For the last 3 years I have worked with students from 30 countries!!! I work in any time zone, come improve your level in chess with me!
about: I am FIDE Master Sargis A. Manukyan 27 years old, from Armenia.
playing_experience: None
teaching_experience: In 2015 I started to give private and group lessons.
best_skills: My lessons cover all aspects of the game:
teaching_methodology: It is crucial to analyze one's own games. I can help you with that, highlighting the typical mistakes you make, why you are making them and how to avoid doing so in the future. We can also play training games and analyzing them afterwards. I am going to teach you key strategic and endgame concepts and help you understand tactics deeply. We are going to look at famous games, as well as games from my own practice.

name: IM Misha Bilous

playing_experience: I have been playing for about 19 years, defeating many International Masters and Grandmasters in international tournaments.
teaching_experience: I have been teaching chess for over 7 years at school and online. I have obtained a bachelor's degree in pedagogy, which helps me find an individual approach to students. Since graduation, my complete focus has been on coaching, immersing myself in the world of chess.
teaching_methodology: I will broaden your game understanding and teach you to think unbiasedly. You will receive a personalized study plan designed for your level and playing style.

name: FM Juan Rottenw√∂hrer
headline: None
about: I am a 23 year old FIDE Master, graduate in applied foreign languages, currently studying a master's degree in Intercultural European Studies in Madrid!
playing_experience: Among the tournaments I have played I would highlight my win in the Madrid rapid 2014 championship and in the III Classical tournament Los Molinos. Also wins over GM Kovchan and GM Georgiev in classical chess, or Ivanchuk and Xiong in online blitz.
teaching_experience: I have had students from all over the world, specially kids, who have very quickly learned to understand the basics of chess and, most importantly, to enjoy it. I have worked for a year in a school in the south of France too.
best_skills: I would say I'm a pretty complete and consistent player.
teaching_methodology: My teaching methodology depends on the level and ambitions of the student. If the player already knows how to play, I first analize my students games to know what their style and repertoire are. Then, when we know which are the strenghts and weaknesses, we work on them. We'll also train the repertoire and learn theory and plans. I also like to study endgames, which are a fundamental part of the game to understand and win more games!

name: FM Daler Vakhidov
headline: None
about: Hey there! My name is Daler and I am 21 years old FIDE Master. I have been been playing chess since I was 5 years old and train daily with my father and brother . I am a very active and dynamic player who has worked with a lot of different coaches and has coached many students as well.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess for over 15 years.
teaching_experience: ‚Ä¢ I have over 3 years of experience working as a professional chess coach with students from all over the world, including the USA, Switzerland, Denmark, Germany, England, Singapore, and more.
other_experience: During typical lesson we would consider all aspects of chess:
teaching_methodology: Before the first lesson, I will identify your level of chess and come up with a long term training plan. I will assign you homework weekly. You will be able to send me any questions or games any time and I will be trying to answer them asap. During the lessons, we will be doing many different things, it will mostly depend on your level. For every level there is an appropriate way of teaching. I have an individual training approach to every student that will help you to find the issues in your play and fix them.

name: FM Mark Rubery
headline: None
about: Hi, I am based in Johannesburg  and have been the daily  chess columnist of 'The Star' newspaper for over 25 years -syndicated in other newspapers in Pretoria, Durban and Cape Town.
playing_experience: Played and won numerous  tournaments around the country and three time winner of the Oude Meester Player of the Year.
teaching_experience: For many years privately coached some  of our top junior players.
other_experience: I was co author with Darryl Accone,  of the book 'Chess Summit' Kasparov v Karpov 1986  (I believe Karpov has a copy in his library !) along with 'Springboks in Armenia' which focused on the South African team at the 1996 Olympiad.
best_skills: Able to convey the essence of a position in an easy to digest way
teaching_methodology: Initially an overall assessment of the level of the student through  an examination of their games.

teaching_experience: Courrently i still work as an opening preparator, and as a coach i have 4+ years of experience in general and also i am working with some of the best uprising italian chess talents
other_experience: I commented on chess24 for a while already and i aim to create my very own twitch channel to stream and teach to more people as well
best_skills: Definitely my best skill in chess is opening preparation, i can make targeted preparations or general repertoire coverage, aiming to give you the best lines that suits your style with tons of new ideas.
teaching_methodology: None

name: CM James Coleman
headline: None
about: Hi! I'm James Coleman from England, 47 years old, and have been playing chess since I was 7.
playing_experience: I've competed in many international tournaments around the world and experienced all the highs and lows that go with it. I have now been retired from competitive chess for quite some time in order to focus on coaching.
teaching_experience: As a coach I've worked with people from all ages and backgrounds, online as well as face to face, and I believe the key to improvement is enjoying the game and setting realistic goals. I'm completely self-taught in chess so I know what sort of study methods don't work well, and can help you avoid these pitfalls. So, whether you're simply in a bit of a rut or you want to make serious progress I'm available to help you reach your goals. Feel free to get in touch. Both online, as well as in-person coaching is available. I usually try to respond to messages very quickly, and will usually get back to you within a couple of hours.
other_experience: Just started livestreaming to the chess community, you can follow my twitch channel here:
best_skills: All my lessons are personally tailored to the needs of the student, I don't believe in a 'one size fits all' approach, as everyone has their own strengths and weaknesses. I believe I have a good communication style and enjoy explaining chess concepts in an easy to understand way.
teaching_methodology: Lessons are normally given using online analysis board + Zoom. I will suggest extra work for independent study to cement the work done during lessons, and I am always available to answer questions outside of the scheduled lesson time. I really care about all my students and want them to progress, not only that, I want them to experience the increased enjoyment and pleasure from the game that fresh insights will provide.

teaching_methodology: I adapt my lessons to every single student. Their satisfaction is my goal.

name: FM Talu Mircea
headline: I will improve your game and share with you all the knowledge I've gathered in 15 years of playing chess professionally.
about: My name is Mircea Talu, I'm a 19 year-old Fide Master (FM) with a 2337 ELO rating from Romania. I've represented my country at many international competitions and won multiple medals. I know what it takes to be a top level sportsman and I am confident that my journey has taught me a lot of things that you will greatly benefit from. In order to become a great player, I think it's very important to have someone who has been there and done that guide you. Some of my hobbies include football, computer science, maths, history, video games and formula1.
playing_experience: Silver Medal at the European Youth Rapid Championship
teaching_experience: This is a new beginning for me. I did coach my little brother when we were younger and managed to get him to achieve good results.
other_experience: I am also streaming on twitch and I've commentated some online chess matches in international leagues (Romania vs Serbia, Romania vs Spain etc.) on my channel.
best_skills: During my career, I've had a lot of coaches from different backgrounds and at different points in my life. I think that this helped me understand what I want from a coach and what a coach is supposed to be. In my opinion, a coach is supposed to be:
teaching_methodology: First of all, we will analyze every aspect of your game in order to find your strengths and weaknesses. Then, I will create a personalized program for you, where we will target the areas that I feel have the largest room for improvement. I am a firm believer that each stage of the game is equally important (opening, middlegame and endgame) and we will make sure that you are all set and you know what to do in each one of them. I also think that experience is very important so I will encourage you to play as much chess as possible and analyze your games. Of course, if you have a request or your own agenda, I will follow it and teach you what you desire. My goal is to develop your intuition and 'feel' for the game.

name: FM Mihailo Djokic
headline: None
about: Hello! My name is Mihailo Djokic from Serbia. I am 22 years old and have been playing chess since I was four years old, with serious training starting at the age of twelve. I use these many years of experience as my main tool for helping my students improve. Feel free to message me any time if you are interested.
playing_experience: I started playing chess seriously When I was 14 years old and nowadays I am trying to achieve my best and potential IM or GM title as well.
teaching_experience: I have taught chess for three years and have successfully succeeded with my students. For example, one of my best students, Efi Rosenborg, went from a 1500 rating to almost 2100 in just 6 months of working with me. I have also worked with several players from the US and some have even won over-the-board tournaments in the USCF rating system. I feel immense pride and joy seeing my students make remarkable progress!
other_experience: I played football for 6 years among with chess, also big fan of tennis
best_skills: 1. Opening theory: (Reti, Sicilian Defence, French Defence, Kings Indian, Different gambits,            depending on your style of playing with strategy and tactical ideas)
teaching_methodology: Lesson 1: Analyze two games played against students as white and black, focusing on identifying mistakes, missing tactics, making strategic decisions, and assessing tactical calculations. See if there are better alternatives.

name: IM Dusan Radovanovic
headline: None
about: My name is Dusan Radovanovic and I am an International Master. I‚Äôve been a chess coach for 20 years and I am offering chess lessons to players of all levels. I am especially dedicated to recognition of your chess style and character insisting on the thinking processes and understanding of chess.
playing_experience: I've been competing in European and World Chess Championships, regularly playing Premier National league in Serbia as a domestic player and abroad as a foreign player. Junior Chess Champion of Yugoslavia in 1998-1999.
teaching_experience: I have been coaching Serbian Youth Chess Champions and many players who had significant results on national and international levels.
teaching_methodology: My work with students is based on the long-term personalized Working plan that I create for all the students according to their preferences and chess goals. The Working plan lists the openings that would fit your style and literature which will help you on the way to reach your goals. When working with students I use methodological tools that I learned from the world best coaches. I especially worked on approach to young chess players who need special psychological approach and not only the chess materials.

name: WIM Ana Gavasheli
headline: None
about: I am from Tbilisi, to me it is the most beautiful city on earth! Chess professional more than twenty-five years. Currently learning computer science, intend to become a master here as well. Anyway, these words of Bobby Fischer still work for me -"All I want to do, ever, is play chess."
playing_experience: Woman International Master. Multiple winner of Georgian Youth Chess Championships since 1997. The winner and a prize holder of several international chess tournaments among women.
teaching_experience: The first serious experience of coaching was in 2013-2014, when I was working at a public school as a volunteer chess teacher in high mountainous village of Georgia. I was giving lessons of English language and literature as well. Since then I also have private students.

best_skills: I am able to train you in every field of the game, up to the medium specialist level, but my strongest side is an endgame play.

headline: ‚ÄúEvery chess master was once a beginner.‚Äù ‚Äì Irving Chernev, One of my main goals is to show you how amazing and beautiful this game is!
about: Hi, my name is Marci, I am a 25 year old chess player and coach from Hungary, with 1 IM norm and peak rating of 2340. Apart from chess, I am university student, and professor assistant,  I have acquired my bachelor's degree and now I'm doing my master's studies.
playing_experience: I started playing chess at the age of 6. I achieved the Fide Master title at the age of 15. I won the Hungarian U18 Championship with my team  3 times and individually finished 3rd in the U20 Hungarian Championship. Currently, I am playing in the first class of the Hungarian National Championship and in the Slovakian Extraleague. The strongest opponent I beated OTB was Maxim Chigaev (Grandmaster from Russia rated around 2600 in classical).
teaching_experience: I have 5 years of teaching experience with students from the beginner level up to the 2100 rating level. I worked together with 6 years old girls and 30+ years old dads so age is not a problem for me. I think I am a funny person and I can teach you interesting things about chess and life! I like interactive lessons, so you can expect to be an active participant in the lesson, as in my opinion, it is the fastest way to get to the next level. I was several times leader for my club and my students won the Hungarian U10 team championship, and one of my students won the indivudual U10 championship and another one the U12 championship. Two of my students participated on the European Championship last year.
other_experience: I also have coaches and very good friends from chess, so I often cooperate with my international master and grand master mates and I have up-to-date databases and opening repertoires. During my childhood, I competed not just in chess (athletic, karate, table tennis, ice skating), so I have real-life stories to improve your competitive mindset.
best_skills: I have attacking style in chess, I love extremely sharp positions. I have so many studies and books in pdf and in pgn formats, I was a pro member in chessmood and in chessable. I like working with computers, so if you have any questions about how to use professional chess programs I could help you. If I want to compare myself with other coaches and masters, I think my biggest advantage is I am not just a chess player, but a highly educated university student, so if you have questions not just in chess, maybe I can help you.
teaching_methodology: I adapt my teaching methods based on the student‚Äôs level, objectives and needs.

name: GM Max Illingworth
headline: None
about: Hey there, chess friend!
playing_experience: - Grandmaster (earned the title in December 2015, awarded in 2016)
teaching_experience: My journey helping others with their chess began when I was nine years old. I was coaching my friends and teammates at school, helping them learn from their games so that we could win the Primary School Competitions in our district!
other_experience: I have experienced quite a lot in the first 28 years of my life. Through chess, I have travelled to over 30 countries, and currently live in Rach Gia, Vietnam with my wife and her family. Living in a new country has broadened my horizons and given me the freedom to fully pursue my dreams of helping thousands of chess players play better chess.
best_skills: My most unique advantage as a trainer is that I'm the only chess Grandmaster certified as a High-Performance Coach by the High-Performance Institute - the most prestigious coaching certification in the world. What this means is that I have a unique ability to ask exactly the right coaching questions that allow my students to find the best answer for themselves, leveraging both my coaching ability and my student's deep knowledge of themselves and their situation.
teaching_methodology: In my private coaching (one-on-one), I primarily focus on teaching you better thinking techniques through a Socratic method (asking questions and giving feedback on their answers), so that you can make better decisions in their games and thus, quickly boost your ratings. This also includes showing you how to make the most of your chess practice time, including assigned homework and chess material.

name: FM Maciej Czopor
headline: "You may learn much more from a game you lose than from a game you win. You will have to lose hundreds of games before becoming a good player." ~ Jose Raul Capablanca
about: Hello chess enthusiasts!
playing_experience: I have been playing chess since the age of 8. Throughout my career, I have been very successful in youth competitions, winning Polish Youth Championship 2 times (2014,2018) and coming 2nd 2 times (2016,2022). Thanks to those accomplishments I was able to participate in World and European Youth Championships (2014,16,18,22).
teaching_experience: I believe that calculation, opening preparation and analysis of your games are key bits in today's chess. Therefore our main focus during the lessons will be on improving your calculation skills and tactical awareness. Alongside the lessons, there are number of things that I offer:
best_skills: I've always been drawn to active and dynamic chess, a quality that is vividly reflected in my games. I strongly believe that calculation stands out as the single most crucial skill in chess, and it has been one of my biggest assets. In addition to calculation, a deep understanding of openings is paramount. As a lifelong player of 1.e4 as White, I've obtained extensive opening knowledge across various lines. As black, playing the Sicilian defence has been a defining choice throughout my career where I gained a lot of experience and discovered a lot of interesting ideas.
teaching_methodology: I believe that calculation, opening preparation and analysis of your games are key bits in today's chess. name: CM Niraj Saripalli
headline: None
about: I am Niraj Saripalli from Goa, India . I am 27 years old and my current FIDE rating is 2188. I received the Candidate Master title in 2021 and I am also a FIDE instructor (FI) and I aspire to increase my rating and keep improving my game and achieve greater heights as a player.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess since the age of 7. Participated actively in State and National events throughout. Became State Champion of Goa in the Open category in 2018 to break the jinx as I finished 2nd and 3rd a dozen times. Also I have won the several Fide rating tournaments.
teaching_experience: Have been teaching actively for the past 6 years. Run a chess School Nanir Chess Academy which me and my sister founded in the year 2017.
other_experience: I have a youtube channel with my sister Nandhini Saripalli and her husband GM Anurag Mhamal. We post instructional videos and stream regularly as well. I enjoy commentating on the game.
best_skills: I am a very creative self taught chess player. I thoroughly enjoy the endgame. I am a very good listener and try and understand every thought process of my student behind every move played. A lot of sessions and effort goes in analysis of the students game and working on weaknesses that can be improved. I also can work specifically on a particular aspect as required by the student. I personally believe my best skill as a chess coach is mentally preparing the student to overcome tough situations and positions and inculcating a 'NEVER DIE' attitude.
teaching_methodology: I am flexible in my teaching methods and cater to the needs of every student in an approach i deem most fruitful. I am available and reachable at anytime and just away. I also assign homework to my students to make sure they improve and learn and keep the process going. I take the classes via Zoom or skype.

name: IM Mateusz Ko≈Çosowski
headline: None
about: Hi, first of all thanks for viewing my profile. If you're doing that, perhaps it's for a reason. Aren't you a a person who still lacks some skills to call yourself a strong player? If so, you might be interested in looking for a chess coach. Why should you consider me as a person who can help in mastering your skills?
playing_experience: So far I have played in numerous tournaments all over the Europe, including great many club team competitions. The strongest player I have played against was Levon Aronian (I have beaten Fabiano Caruana online, though ;)). My playing experience helps me a lot in coaching activity - I believe that I can provide players of all levels with lots of practical tips.
teaching_experience: I have contributed to chess development of players from approximately 30 countries. I have cooperated with players of all levels and helped a few of them in obtaining their international titles and medals in national championships. A couple pf my students participated in World / European Junior Chess Champoniships. My students increase their rating on regular basis.
other_experience: I have provided live coverage of online chess matches (e.g. Duda-Karjakin), European rapid and blitz Championships and Polish individual Championships. Feel free to take a look at a few of chess courses I have prepared in cooperation with leading content providers:
best_skills: Throughout my coaching career I have helped my students in practically every area of chess mastery. However, I specialize in:
teaching_methodology: I believe a chess coach should sometimes be a doctor as he needs to be able to diagnose one's chess problems and find a cure for them. That's how I approach my students - individually.  I adjust the material used and training plan to be implemented according to one's needs. I provide homework / training material. I keep up with my students via e-mail / social media / IM. The lessons are conducted using high-quality equipment.

best_skills: I try to do the lessons based on active learning. Chess is like mathematics, without solving problems you don't really understand the subject. teaching_methodology: What you expect is the most important, it will be tailored according to your wishes. (General improvement, endgame, opening repertoire etc.) For the start I'd expect you to send me 10 games of over the board classical games of yours (including draws and losses, not just wins), if you have ever played OTB of course. name: WFM Noemi ≈†piranec
headline: None
about: Hi everyone! I'm Noemi, a 24-year old WFM from Croatia. I've been playing chess actively for the last 13 years and three years ago I became more active in the coaching area. I have a lot of experience in teaching people from various age groups as well as international students. I worked as a chess coach for international as well as Croatian chess academy.  Feel free to contact me on noemispiranec@gmail.com or here on lichess! :)
playing_experience: I've started playing chess at the age of 11. Throughout my career I achieved the following results: 3rd place in Girls U13 Croatian Championship, 3rd place in Girls U17 Croatian Championship, U17 Croatian Girls Champion, in 2019 I won gold medal with my team at Croatian Junior Team championship, came fourth at Croatian Women's Championship, won gold medal with Croatian Women's team at the Mitropa Cup and came second on a very strong Hum na Sutli Open, ahead of very strong IMs and GMs. In 2022 I won the gold medal with my team at the Croatian Women's team Championship.
teaching_experience: For the past 3 years I have been quite active in the coaching area and have mainly worked with children of all age groups. Also, I've been a lecturer in chess in schools programs in two Croatian cities. All of my students so far, have improved both their rating and their chess skills. They also had great results in their age categories at Croatian Cadet Championships. One of my former students regularly wins trophies at Croatian championships.
best_skills: I would say my best skills in chess, but also in general in life would be that I am a hard working and dedicated person. Also, I try to be as objective as possible while thinking couple of steps ahead. I am very patient and good at explaining and transferring my knowledge to others.
teaching_methodology: Each lesson lasts 60min and is conducted via Skype. Before the lesson it would be good if you sent me a couple of your games so I can go through them and see what kind of mistakes you usually make. We will cover all parts of the chess game - opening theory, typical middlegame plans and structures as well as the endgame. But, you can always make your own suggestions and bring out the topics you would like me to cover. My focus will mainly be on improving your way of thinking and overall chess understanding. Each lesson will be followed by a couple of homework exercises so that you can get a better grip of the things we did on each lesson. Always remember that working on your own is just as important as having a coach to guide you! :)

teaching_experience: I have over 10 years of training experience working in the range from chess begginers to masters by means of individual lessons (live and online).
other_experience: Apart from being a player and a coach, I am also a national chess arbiter. For example I was an arbiter at the: 17th European Youth Championship 2007., 25th European Youth Chess Championship 2015, 2nd Easter open (Zurich, 2019) and other tournaments.
best_skills: I am still an active player who can share many years of experience with my students. Apart from working on pure chess skills, I always do my best in motivating my students and adapting my courses to their earlier knowledge and playing style.
teaching_methodology: At the beggining of each training chapter I analyze the knowledge of my student in a certain field. My primary goals are to study the games of my student and to identify his/her mistakes and weaknesses in earlier games. Thenafter, I jointly make a teaching plan together with each of my students with the aim to correct these weaknesses. By problem solving I evaluate if my student has accepted the given instructions. Finally we proceed to the basic plans and ideas in the future openings that will be implemented by my students.

playing_experience: In my youth, I was 6th in the WORLD and vice-CHAMPION in EUROPE in 2011 according to rating list. Many of my youth competitors, of whom I was stronger in rating, equal in rating or almost equal, became top grandmasters, with a rating of over 2600 and over 2700. For example, GM Wei Yi, GM Vladislav Artemev, GM Van Forest Jordeen, GM Sarana Alekei, GM Petrosyan Manuel, GM Sevian Samuel, GM Rambaldi, Francesco, GM Benjamin Gledura, GM Milan Zajiƒá, etc. are now super grandmasters with ratings over 2700 and 2600. For 6 years I played for Partizan from Belgrade (first board), which is still the most trophy-winning in Serbia and the former Yugoslavia. I competed in the European Champions Cup. I also played in the first league in Switzerland, for Sorab from Basel. I played in the Premier League in Bosnia and Herzegovina. I won many open tournaments (for example Open Baƒçka Palanka).
teaching_experience: 2 years live coaching, 1 year online
other_experience: The mind is certainly primary, but regular physical activity is necessary for excellent concentration. See how world champion Magnus Charleshen is physically ready and active (almost like me). without physical fitness he would never have been a world champion.
teaching_methodology: It is not enough to have great talent, nor to have a nature of genius mind in order to become a genius, realize talent and achieve success. A genius is one who realize his genius mind. Success is in realizing your talent, but know that success makes 5 to 10 percent of talent and about 90 percent of work, learning, coaching. name: FM Daniel Kozusek
headline: None
about: (SCROLL DOWN FOR REVIEWS)
playing_experience: I have been an avid chess player since the age of five, immersing myself in the game and actively participating in numerous world and European championships within my age categories. Over the years, I have maintained my competitive spirit and continuously strive for improvement.
teaching_experience: Over the past 10 years, my passion for chess coaching has allowed me to gain extensive experience working with individuals across all skill levels, from absolute beginners to accomplished masters. I am proud to have nurtured the talents of five students who achieved national championships in their respective age categories while also guiding others towards the prestigious titles of FIDE Master (FM) and Women's FIDE Master (WFM). Throughout my coaching journey, I have had the pleasure of collaborating with chess enthusiasts from over 20 countries, enriching my understanding of the game and fostering a global chess community. As I continue to embark on this transformative coaching adventure, I am committed to unlocking the potential within each student, instilling valuable skills, and fostering a love for chess.
other_experience: Drawing upon my extensive experience and qualification in Sports Psychology, I possess a deep understanding of the vital role psychology plays in the game of chess. With this expertise, I am uniquely equipped to assist you in setting optimal goals, addressing concentration challenges, and resolving any other psychological obstacles that may arise within the realm of chess. Furthermore, my dissertation titled "What is the usage and perceived efficacy of basic psychological skills amongst chess FIDE-titled players and amateur players?" reflects my dedication to exploring the utilisation and perceived effectiveness of fundamental psychological skills among both FIDE-titled players and amateur enthusiasts.
best_skills: As a dedicated chess coach, I strive to simplify intricate thinking processes by breaking them down into manageable steps for my students. Through careful analysis of their games, I identify areas that require attention and provide insightful guidance on how to improve. Moreover, I find great fulfilment in motivating and inspiring my students, fostering their drive to continually enhance their skills. By focusing on these fundamental coaching skills, I aim to empower students to develop a deeper understanding of the game and unlock their true potential on the chessboard.
teaching_methodology: My coaching philosophy revolves around creating a supportive and personalised learning environment tailored to your specific needs and aspirations. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned player, I'm here to guide you in developing your strategic thinking, tactical prowess, and mental resilience. By analysing your own games, we gain valuable insights into your decision-making process, identify patterns, and highlight areas for improvement. This self-reflection fosters self-awareness, enhances critical thinking skills, and ensures a targeted approach to addressing your individual needs, unlocking your potential in chess.

about: Hi! I am a 20 y.o. FIDE Master from Poland, studying at University of Warsaw and dedicating my time to coaching others as well as playing actively in tournaments.

name: FM Dusan Colovic
headline: None
about: I am Dusan Colovic, 51 years old FIDE master from Serbia. I am married and a father of two daughters. I have a secondary education with a focus on natural sciences and mathematics. I live in a small town in Western Serbia, located 150 km away from Belgrade. I started playing chess at the age of 10, participating in school and youth competitions and joining the local chess club. During my junior years, I dedicated a lot of time to chess and quickly became one of the top players in the club.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess for over 40 years. Until 1991, I primarily participated in school and youth tournaments and regularly visited the local chess club, where I accumulated valuable chess experience. After that, I began actively playing in open tournaments in the country, providing opportunities to compete with players from abroad and further improve my chess skills. I also regularly participated in team championships with considerable success. Interestingly, I generally achieved better results in team competitions than in individual tournaments.
teaching_experience: I am full time chess coach with 5 years teaching experience.
other_experience: My favorite hobby is computers, especially hardware, so I enjoy staying informed and educating myself about the latest developments in that field.
teaching_methodology: I base my chess teaching on my personal experience, and I aim to impart that to my students. I am a proponent of a classical approach to learning chess. This means we learn chess starting from endgames, then move on to the middlegames, and finally, study openings. Why do we start with endgames? The answer is quite simple. If we make a mistake in the endgame, we won't have the time to correct it later, as there are only a few pieces left on the board. It's much easier to correct mistakes in openings or the middlegames, whereas in the endgame, it is exceptionally challenging.

name: GM Dusan Popovic
headline: None
about: Hi chess friends! My name is Dusan Popovic from Novi Sad, Serbia. My current FIDE elo is 2504. I have coaching programs for all levels. If you want to be my student, feel free to contact me via email dulekpop@gmail or in my Lichess inbox. Training games are also possible.
playing_experience: I became IM at age 20, GM at age 23. Serbian vice champion in 2012, winner of many international tournaments (Amsterdam Science Part 2011, Lugano 2017, Donau Open 2013 etc) . The highest elo I reached was 2583.
teaching_experience: Dedicated chess coach for 20 years with huge experience. Some of my students are GM Nikola Sedlak, GM Milos Roganovic, IM Milos Stankovic, IM Nadj Hedjesi Balind, FM Milan Popovic, WGM Ljilja Drljevic and many others. I am certified FIDE trainer.
best_skills: As a player I like stability. Stable opening repertoire, solid positionally based chess with orientation to initiative.

According to that I create training program for every student in particular . I give lessons via Skype or by typing. Both methods are successful. All of my students know that I am not so called "clock watcher" and my lessons usually last few minutes longer than one hour.

name: FM Tanmay Chopra
headline: None
about: I am an 18-year-old FM currently living in London, UK. Having started playing chess competitively at the relatively late age of 11, I had to put in extreme hard work and dedication to progress. However, doing that has allowed me to know the exact methods to maximise someone's potential in a short span of time. Though it is not easy, it is very possible and I can show you how.
playing_experience: Within the first 4 years of my chess career, I won the Delhi State Championship (2019), followed by the London Junior Championships in December of the same year (as I moved to the UK from India). Furthermore, I jointly won the UK Chess Challenge in 2021. Having played over 40 FIDE-rated tournaments, I sure do hold some Playing Experience.
teaching_experience: I require interested students to send me their tournament games so that I can get a quick overview of their strengths and weaknesses and will let them know what and how to work on in the first lessons themselves. During the lessons, I will have examples prepared for middlegames and endgames that I deem are most required for you to see to refine your understanding as well as improve your calculation. Should it be required, we can also look at opening lines in depth. I am also flexible with the students letting me know what they want to do in the lesson and preparing material according to that.
best_skills: My biggest strengths lie in Middlegame and Endgame, through a good understanding of dynamic and static play coupled with knowledge of theoretical and practical endgames. I particularly enjoy positions with more space. Recently, I have also done a lot of work on openings. So essentially, I can help the student with any area of chess.

name: IM Dirk Schuh
headline: None
about: Ich bin ein Internationaler Meister und arbeite seit √ºber 10 Jahren hauptberuflich als Schachtrainer.
playing_experience: Ich spiele seit meinem 14. Lebensjahr in einem Schachverein und habe vorher im Schulschach erste kleine Turniererfahrungen gesammelt . Ich hatte nie einen richtigen Trainer, auch wenn es einige Leute gibt, die mir viele wichtige Tipps f√ºr mein Spiel gegeben haben. In meiner Jugend habe ich das sehr bedauert und mich gefragt, wie gut ich wohl mit regelm√§√üigem Training geworden w√§re. Damit war der Weg des Schachtrainers vorgezeichnet. 2007 erreichte ich den Titel des Fide-Meisters und 2012 wurde ich schlie√ülich ein Internationaler Meister.
teaching_experience: Mein erstes Training begann 2001 aufgrund einer Wette. Der Nachbarsjunge spielte im selben Schachverein wie ich und hatte mit einem Freund gewettet, er k√∂nnte sich innerhalb von 2 Jahren von seinen knapp 1500 DWZ auf 2000 verbessern. Ich hatte zu der Zeit nicht soviel zu tun, trainierte ihn daraufhin mehrmals pro Woche und fuhr mit ihm zu Turnieren. Damals hatte ich nicht viel Ahnung vom Schachtraining, aber nach einem Jahr hat er knapp die 1800 DWZ erreicht, war also voll im Soll. Leider fand er danach mit dem Bodybuilding eine neue Leidenschaft, weshalb er die Wette aufgab. Meine Motivation war aber geweckt.
other_experience: Neben dem aktiven Schachspiel schreibe ich hobbym√§√üig Rezensionen f√ºr den Schachversand Niggemann.
teaching_methodology: Mir ist erst einmal wichtig, dass Schach Spa√ü macht. Mit Druck kommt man in meinen Augen nicht weiter, darum lege ich Wert auf eine lockere Trainingsatmosph√§re. Daneben bin ich ein recht strukturierter Typ. Ich analysiere mit dem Sch√ºler erst einmal seine jeweiligen St√§rken und Schw√§chen und erstelle mit ihm ein Er√∂ffnungsrepertoire, das f√ºr ihn geeignet ist. 1.e4 mit Wei√ü und dynamische Verteidigungen mit Schwarz bevorzuge ich dabei. Er√∂ffnungstheorie ist heute leider nicht unwichtig, aber ich schaue immer, dass ich Varianten empfehle, die relativ schnell zu erlernen und zu verstehen sind. Wichtiger sind mir Variantenberechnung und die Strategie der Aktivit√§t. Dazu gibt es noch eine Prise Endspieltechnik und fertig ist in der Theorie das Schachtraining!

headline: None
about: Hi I'm a chess coach from Italy, but now live in the beautiful island of Taiwan. I've been teaching chess for about 10 years, in every context: schools, chess academies, chess clubs and of course private lessons too. I learned that a good player does not necessarily make a good coach, and that experience is very important: I believe honesty and passion go a long way. Lessons in English, Italian,‰∏≠Êñá.

teaching_experience: I have a very long(roughly 10 years) and varied experience. I taught classes of kids under 10 in schools in Italy and Taiwan. Groups in chess academies and clubs. And of course private lessons. I therefore have vast experience teaching players of every level, from total beginners who need to learn the rules, up to players of around 2000 elo rating. My professionality and experience was acknowledged when I was chosen by   Friuli Venezia Giulia to lead the regional delegation( around 50 players) to the 2017 Italian National Youth Finals in Chianciano.

headline: None

name: CM Kacper Karwowski
headline: None
about: I am a FIDE Candidate Master with ELO rating peak at 2259, based in Poland. In 2024 I will finish my Master Studies at Warsaw University of Technology in the field of electrical engineering. Nevertheless, I am willing to fulfill my dream and teach chess full-time, because it is my greatest passion. I am ready to spread the love to chess to a wider audience.
playing_experience: I learned how to play chess at the age of 5. During my junior career, I participated in dozens of Polish Junior Championships and won two medals in classical chess (U10 - 2008, U18 - 2016). After graduating from high school, I focused more on teaching others, but despite this, I achieved some significant results during the Polish Academic Championships with my university team.
teaching_experience: Despite my young age I would consider myself as an experienced instructor, because I teach chess since 2015. At first, I taught children from scratch, but nowadays I teach both kids and grown-ups, regardless of their level, thanks to many years of collecting and creating chess materials. As of now, my biggest success as a coach is training one of my students from scratch in 2 years to participate in Polish Junior Championships.
other_experience: I was an editor-in-chief of a Chessbrains.pl chess news site for several months in 2019 and participated in Chesstoken.io project in 2019-2021, but sadly both projects are no longer continued.
best_skills: I would say my standout skills as a teacher are:
teaching_methodology: My native language is Polish, but I have no problems teaching in English.

teaching_methodology: Main focus is on working with memory and the logic of making a decision in the game.As a chess coach, I use a variety of teaching methods to ensure the best possible learning experience for my students. Based on each student and their behavior I decide what to do. For Instance if you are someone want to checkmate your opponent rapidly then we work on sharp openings, in addition I start by looking at my student's games in important tournaments and online Lichess games in order detect their strength and weaknesses. After that I  try to concentrate on these weaknesses and help them to enhance  that areas.

name: IM IM&FT&IA Vladimir Poley

Minsk city champion -1989, Stockholm city champion for 6 years in the row 2003-2008, The winner of lots of International chess tournaments, the biggest "Budapest Spring Festival",1992, Avoine(Fra),2003 (2-6 place), Swedish Team champion with Sollentuna SK, Team Viking( Elit), Division 1 winner in team SS4Springare2018/19 and 2019/20, International chess Festival St-Lo, (Fra) 2-3 places, 2019. The winner of Stockholms chess Salong IM-tournament 2003 a head of World Chess Champion Magnus Carlsen (have score against him 1:1).
teaching_experience: Belarussian State Institute of Physical Culture(Minsk) and Highest School of Trainers (Moscow) ( 1982-1989 ( Honors degree; chess-trainer, chess-teacher), Chess trainer and teacher at Chess school, Minsk(1989-1994) Under leadership of Albert Kapengut, together with GMs Boris Gelfand, Ilya Smirin and Juri Shulman and famous Ilya Botvinnik. President of Belarus Chess Federation (1996-2002). Chess teacher and trainer at "Engelska skolan Norr"(2002-2014)( School was"Best school in chess in Sweden for 8 years 2006-2014). Chess coach, chess-teacher, team leader at SS 4 Springare (2014-2020). My best students were World and Europe Junior Champions Girls U10,12,14 WGM Elena Tairova, IMs Stanislav Smetankin and Alexey Chernushevich BoysU16, Swedish Junior Champions: Jacob Aperia, Ljuba Dvinskikh,Polina Legkij(Otto), Jan-Emrik Lennartsson, Cameron Bergstedt, Marta Religa, Kunal Bhatnagar, Edvin Trost. As well as IM Milton Pantzar, IM JungMin Seo, CM Teodor Baldur Petersson. teaching_methodology: Before we start our collaboration I'll ask you to send me over a dozen of your recent OTB games. if you do not play OTB, your online games will do.  My approach is highly individual and once i track your weaknesses I'll do my best to help you fix them:) If a student has some questions in between our classes I'll be happy to answer them. Lessons are mostly held via Skype or discord but i can adjust to your preference as well.

Most of the time I was in the first 3 on the Youth Hungarian Chess Championships between girls under 18 (even won a few), and I got silver and bronze medals on the Youth European Union Chess Championships. I hold a WGM and a WIM norm, and my highest Elo was 2266.

other_experience: I am an active twitch streamer at
teaching_methodology: I can help you to improve your chess for example by strenghtening your calculation, analysing your games and finding your common mistakes, teaching you more about middle game stategies, endgames, and sharpening your tactical vision. Neverthless, if there is anything else in particular you would like to work on, let me know. I like to make my classes as interactive as possible, because I believe this it the best way for the students to gain knowledge of anything, including chess, while having fun. From me you can learn more about the psychological factors in chess, which can also make you a better chess player!

headline: I am an experienced chess trainer and, in everyday life, a teacher - available for various formats of chess lessons (game analysis, training games, thematic lessons).

other_experience: I am a professional teacher - I teach Dutch to foreigners. If you can teach Dutch, you can teach anything ;-).
best_skills: As a teacher, I always start from the intentions of the student. What does he want to achieve, what are his interests, strenghts and weaknesses. From my experience I'll offer guidance, analysis and support. A combination of methodologies are possible.
teaching_methodology: Possibilities are: game analysis, playing training games with subsequent analysis, or more thematic lessons on middlegame, endgame or openings. I draw up a training program based on an initial meeting in which we play some games.

name: IM Petar Benkovic
headline: None
about: My name is Petar Benkovic, international master from Serbia. I was born on the 8th of May 1980 in Sremska Mitrovica. First move in chess I learnt from my mother Emica at the age of 7. The FIDE title International Master I got in the year 2001, I am also a FIDE Trainer and National chess arbiter, and Founder of the Benko Chess Club.
playing_experience: As a junior I won Championships of Vojvodina in the category under 15,16,18 and two times under 20 years old. I became the Champion of SR Yugoslavia U18 and two times U20 years old, and played Junior European and World Championships, Children chess Olympiad, etc. My nice result was 8th place at the World Youth Championship 1998, Oropesa del Mar, Spain.
teaching_experience: I have 20 years experience as a coach in individual and group training. Like a trainer I worked in Serbia, Bosnia, Montenegro, Switzerland, Germany, Turkey and China. And of course, I have experience with online chess lessons over the skype, zoom, etc.
other_experience: I have experience organizing tournaments for kids, and I am working as well with the pairing program Swiss Manager. Sometimes I make videos for my YouTube and TikTok Channel, you can follow me:
best_skills: The best skills in chess are strategy of middlegames, calculations and endgames.
teaching_methodology: I am giving class over the Skype, VooV or Zoom meeting platform, and it is very important that we can communicate during the class. I use Chess Base program during the training, some homework make in PGN or PDF format for my students.

name: FM Maurice Schippers
headline: None
about: Hi,
playing_experience: I have played chess since for as long as I can remember. I was five years old when I first went to the chess club. I have won many tournaments in the youth. I became national champion once (U12) and I have played one European Championship in 2003, Budva. I like to play several tournaments per year. I played in Barcelona (Spain), Suwalki (Poland) but mostly tournaments in The Netherlands.
teaching_experience: I have been giving classes since I was 16 year old beginning as a teacher for kids in my local club in Almelo. When I moved to Groningen for studies I was a teacher in the club, both for children and adults. Moreover, for two years I tought chess in a school. I am giving private classes for several years now.
best_skills: I would say that tactics is my main skill. I am able to calculate very quickly. I can also easily play blindfold because I have a very good memory and visualisation. My positional understanding in the game is also quite good. I can help you in any aspect of the game!
teaching_methodology: Your games will always be the foundation of the classes. We learn the most from your mistakes and what you did well. From there on I will give additional material. That can be tactics, improving positional understanding, openings or endgame strategy. I always prepare thoroughly and I give my students the best I can. You can always e-mail me if you have questions or you played an interesting game. Usually I use Skype/Zoom/Discord.

name: WFM Tihana Ivekovic
headline: None
about: Hello!
playing_experience: I started playing chess at the age of 4 and haven't stopped since. I have competed in numerous tournaments, including World and European Youth Chess Championships. I have won the title of the Croatian Girls Champion three times and have been competing in the Croatian Women's Championship for the past few years. I am currently in the top 10 women in Croatia and in 2018, I was a member of the Croatian women's team at the Chess Olympiad in Batumi.
teaching_experience: I have been teaching chess for the past 6 years. My students are usually children aged 7-14, but I am happy to work with anyone who is interested in chess. During those 6 years, my students have won a few school championships and numerous trophies at regional tournaments. I have worked mainly with beginners (<1800).
other_experience: As a part of my degree, I have taught several subjects to school children, which has given me experience in dealing with numerous difficulties and has taught me to think creatively when preparing my lessons.
best_skills: I believe that my best chess skill is calculation. When I am focused, I can calculate lines very deeply and that is what I always try to teach my students. As a teacher, I am very patient because I believe every person can learn if they try hard enough. I also encourage admitting to one's own mistakes as I believe that is the best way we learn.
teaching_methodology: When coaching chess, I focus primarily on developing calculation, since I believe that no theory or strategy knowledge can help if someone blunders easy tactics. Simultaneously, I try to teach some basic knowledge about openings, middlegames and endgames. I also like to see my students' games as it allows me to assess their skills and see where they need to improve the most.

headline: None
about: I'm Arkadi, a computer science student at the TU Darmstadt in Germany. Apart from Chess I play the game of go, pretend to play guitar and read a lot of fantasy literature.
playing_experience: 1. Place at the "1.Sandh√§user Schachsommer 2021", an Open in Germany
teaching_experience: Started Teaching in 2013 in my chessclub, went on to be a coach for the regional youth "Kader" (A Geman Kader is a system where the most talented players of a region meet regularaly and learn together), am stil active as an online-coach for the rhineland-palatinate kader. Since 2019 regular coach at the german youth championships for the team of Rhineland-Palatinate. Best student results should be the 2019 win of the German Under 12 Championship, 4th place at the German Under 8 Championship 2022 (a very heartbraking result, as we were leading until the last round). The youth Team of my Club qualified for the German Youth Team Championships three times in the last 5 years. Most recent an older stundent of mine went from a Rating of 1927 to 2110 DWZ last year.
best_skills: From what other players tell me, I am a creative attacker, known for playing g4 at inapropriate moments and starting a crazy attack (I take pride in having played g4 everywhere before it became popular at top level). I consider myself classicaly educated: You have to first be able to think inside the box before you think outside of it!
teaching_methodology: After finding your strength and weaknesses we would develop your personal training plan for three months in advance. After we evaluate your progress and repeat. A typical lesson with me looks approximately like this: We look at the homework. We look at some examples of the topic we are talking about and I explain some rules of thumb. I suggest you to solve exercises based on the topic. You will get homework exercises with me. If you have played some tournament, we analyse games you play. Games take priority as I believe the best way to improve is detailed analysis of your own game.

I let a student overcome his  weaknesses and develop his the best features.

name: FM Mateo Arcos
headline: Anxious before rounds? Low confidence while competing? Lack the motivation to prepare?  Improve your mental side of the game with a performance coach!
about: Hi! I'm Mateo, originally from Uruguay, where my journey in chess began at the age of six. Now residing in Madrid, Spain, I bring over 20 years of playing experience and a deep passion for the game. While my roots are in chess, my academic pursuits led me to study psychology, earning a bachelor's degree and later a master's degree in performance psychology.
playing_experience: With over 20 years of competitive play, I've participated in numerous international and national tournaments, achieving remarkable results. Notably, I competed in nine Pan American Youth Championships, where I gained invaluable experience in the continent's toughest stage and even faced some of the later to become top talents in the world, like Caruana. I secured top-10 finishes twice, including a shared third place.
teaching_experience: Over the past three years, I've transitioned into coaching, leveraging my background in psychology and chess to support aspiring players in their pursuit of excellence. My coaching philosophy revolves around a comprehensive approach that integrates psychological principles with chess-specific strategies. Working closely with students, I've helped them achieve success in international competitions and attain norm-worth performances. Drawing upon my expertise as a performance psychologist, I provide personalized guidance to address each player's unique needs and challenges, fostering their growth and development both on and off the board.
other_experience: In addition to my work in chess coaching, I've also served as a football coach, with a focus on professional development and high-performance training. Through my experience in football coaching, I've honed my leadership skills and gained valuable insights into player motivation and team dynamics. Furthermore, my involvement in esports coaching has provided me with a nuanced understanding of the mental aspects of competitive gaming, which share parallels with chess. These diverse experiences have enriched my coaching repertoire and equipped me with a multifaceted approach to supporting athletes in various domains.
best_skills: As an avid -now informal- player, my forte lies in tactical prowess and imaginative gameplay, which gives me an extra understanding to help develop mental models around calculation with my clients.
teaching_methodology: My coaching methodology is structured around short to medium-term training cycles, typically spanning two to three months, during which we focus on improving specific mental skills relevant to chess performance. These skills encompass areas such as pressure management, establishing effective routines, enhancing motivation, fostering self-regulation, bolstering self-esteem, and refining mental models. With a tournament-oriented approach, I guide students through a progression cycle, which includes assessment, skill acquisition, competitive application, evaluation, and adjustment. Emphasizing a collaborative coaching model, I work alongside players to develop and integrate mental skills into their chess progression journey, ultimately striving for excellence on the chessboard.

name: NM Sebastian Korman
headline: I am a National Master and two-time Finnish Champion (U20) from Finland. I can help you to understand chess deeper and improve your skills systemically and effectively.
about: Hi, my name is Sebastian Korman. I'm a National Master and coach from Finland. I'm also a composer and an artist. I found chess when I was 12 years old and it became my real passion right away. After that, I have spent countless hours to improve my skills, understanding chess better... And because I had coaches too when I was young I think it is my pleasure to share all this knowledge for any player who wants to improve their skills.
playing_experience: I won twice Finnish Junior Chess Championships (U20) in 1984 and 1985 and I became a National Master in 1985. I played in many international tournaments in the 1980s and 1990s, e.g. twice in the World Junior Chess Championships (U20) and once in European Junior Chess Championships (U20). During those years I won many national tournaments in Finland too.
teaching_experience: I started to teach chess already in the 1980s in Finland where I was leading chess courses for young players. After that, I have been teaching chess to numerous players at various skill levels. During the last few years, I have been teaching mainly one-on-one. This way I can concentrate much better on my student's improvement.
best_skills: Analyzing and positional thinking. During the years I have gain experiences to find my student's weaknesses and strengths more deeply. This helps me to find a way how to help them even more effectively and naturally not to forget to have fun with chess too.
teaching_methodology: I teach one to one with Skype (audio/video) with share screen options and various online tools. I will make a teaching plan personally for each student, according to their knowledge and skill level, and their goals in chess. Naturally, I am listening to my student's wishes too.

name: IM Bindi Cheng
headline: None
about: Hi, I'm a self taught player who learned his ways by playing countless blitz games. I was very raw and needed to read some books to help understand the game better. I'm a Canadian International Master, in my 30s and love going on walks to the park. I play poker in my spare time so if that's of interest to you, we can chat anyways. I like decisive results so I encourage my students to always play for a win unless they're at a huge rating disadvantage so if that sounds like you, I'll be glad to have you on board!
playing_experience: I have been playing tournaments from 2005-2017 and recently started back up again. I have played players like Kamsky, Smirin, Moiseenko, Laznicka, Kaidanov and even roomed with a future 2700 in the World Juniors back in 2006. I have been very clutch when it counts such as getting my first IM norm in 2007 when I was 17 and winning on command in the 10th round. I managed to get my 3rd norm and achieve the IM title in 2011 and have hovered around 2400 since then. My best performance was in the 2013 DC International where I achieved a 2650 performance but did not get the GM norm due to playing too many players from one country, it still haunts me to this day.
teaching_experience: I have been teaching since 2007 when I taught a very young Alexandra Botez albeit not very well. It launched me into this teaching journey that I've really embraced recently teaching in schools, group classes and private one on ones. My best student ever is Razvan Preotu who is now a GM but at the time was about 2000-2100 and after 6 months with me he was 2300+. He of course is extremely talented so I can't take all the credit but I have taught some regional and provincial champions who still play today.
other_experience: I do videos on youtube and stream on twitch, here's my twitch
best_skills: I like to play positionally at first but always ready to complicate things if the need arises. I tend to analyze very deeply in the openings and like teaching through lots of game analysis.
teaching_methodology: I prepare by going over recent top level or big tournament games to highlight an example of how good players think and play. I'm usually a few minutes early and I tend to go over time if we're in the middle of a game or analyzing a game very deep. I'm usually on lichess doing something so if you send me a message I'll definitely see it and I usually reply within 24 hours

teaching_experience: I have more than 20 years of chess coaching experience, during which time I have promoted many low-ranking students to high-ranking ones. Given my background in public and private education, I have found a psychological perspective on people that makes things easier for me. In these more than 20 years, in addition to teaching, I have done a lot of research and study in chess and new teaching methods and the secret of finding candidate moves, and I have come up with new and prioritized ways to progress as fast as I can. Raise a player from beginner to master and champion.
other_experience: I have written a book in Persian that includes 6 semesters in chess, about 54 lessons and more than 1000 exercises in beginner and intermediate level. best_skills: For title players, I have found a unique and seductive method to achieve candidate moves, but for a limited number and for the amount I want, I will provide it to them, which in more than 80% of cases is one of the best candidate moves.
teaching_methodology: Based on finding weaknesses and strengthening strengths and based on the fastest way to progress

teaching_methodology: I would first try to understand the student's playing style by carefully looking at his/her recently played games. after studying students' games,  I would start working on the students' areas of weakness in our classes to ensure steady growth in the student's chess understanding. mostly I work on calculation, the way of thinking, decision making, and psychology, I would assign the students a personalized homework routine. I would make sure to keep in touch with his/her homework updates every day.

name: IM Jonas Hacker
headline: None
about: Hi, my name is Jonas, I am a 28 years old chess player and coach from Germany.
playing_experience: I played in lots of tournaments in Germany and abroad. In Germany I have been playing in 2. Bundesliga for several years now.
teaching_experience: I have been teaching chess for more than 5 years now - from beginners up to rating 2100 I am happy to assist you in your studying process.
other_experience: Author of "Beating the Sicilian main lines"
best_skills: I always try to play for a win, not agree draws and always look for possibilities.
teaching_methodology: I help you building up an opening repertoire, study typical middlegame structures and plans with you, analyse your games, I give you advice, what you should study on your own, supply you with homework and exercises, if you wish.

name: CM Jacob Flynn
headline: None
about: I am 21 years old from Ireland and am in my fourth year of studying English Literature and Film at Trinity College Dublin. I started playing chess at a young age and today I consider it my main hobby. Feel free to message me on Lichess with any enquiries!
playing_experience: 2019 Irish u19 Champion
teaching_experience: I worked with the best juniors at my local club on a weekly basis before the pandemic (Ranging from 1600-1900 strength) and gave some small-sized lectures. I have given private lessons to a wide range of strengths, from beginner level up to 1800 FIDE level juniors. I've given private lessons in person before but I feel that working online is very effective with the great features that Lichess offers. I teach after-school chess at primary schools in Dublin.
best_skills: In younger age groups growing up I was far behind my contemporaries- I eventually had a large improvement in a short space of time due to developing a passion for chess. My primary aim is to share that enthusiasm with my students. I have a good feel for many different types of positions and through analysing your games I am quite quick at identifying what areas need to be worked on. I can provide direction as well as insight in this sense. I am also very interested in the psychological aspects of the game that can hold players back competitively, as this is something I struggled a lot with. I follow top level chess quite closely and always have a strong appetite to look at chess.
teaching_methodology: I have a clear way that I want to play, which is to follow the key principles of positional chess as a foundation, and to build upon this in order to play dynamically. I believe that once you learn to appreciate the underlying mechanics of the game, a lot will fall into place for you. Chess can seem very complicated (which it is) but I will try to help you simplify the game in a constructive way.

name: FM akaki qalichava
headline: None
about: My name is Akaki and i was born in Georgia, I've been enthralled by the game since I was 7. Now at 18, after 11 years of chess, I dream of becoming a Grandmaster. But alongside this dream, a new passion has bloomed‚Äîto teach and share my knowledge.
playing_experience: For 11 years, I've been deep into chess, playing in lots of big tournaments all over. I've won the National Championship four times, feeling really proud each time. I even got second place in the Online European School Championship U17 once and grabbed third place in the Online Grand Prix. Each tournament taught me so much about strategy and never giving up.
teaching_experience: Recently starting my journey as a coach, I've welcomed my very first student.
teaching_methodology: Have you ever felt like you're putting in lots of time into chess, but you're not seeing much progress? Let's change that! Together, we'll make a plan that's just for you, so you always know what to do next.

name: CM NIKOLAOS SANDALAKIS
headline: "Chess is the art of turning every move into an opportunity, and in the game of life, I'm here to help you make every move count."
about: My name is Sandalakis Nikolaos and I am 28 years old. I am a 2192 rated CM from Greece with  (peak FIDE 2251). If you are interested in working with me contact me here in inbox or at my e-mail (sandalakisn94@yahoo.gr). I am available for both lessons and training games!  I have also a degree at the School of Primary Education of the University of Crete. And master in "Educational Sciences - Education using new technologies" in University of the Aegean.
playing_experience: Some of my favourite tournament victories:
teaching_experience: Certified FIDE Instructor (FI)
other_experience: For nearly two enriching years, I had the privilege of serving as a primary school teacher, where I had the opportunity to shape young minds and instill a love for learning. This invaluable experience not only solidified my understanding of pedagogy but also reinforced the importance of fostering critical thinking, discipline, and patience in my students. What sets my journey apart is the seamless fusion of my teaching career with my passion for chess. Teaching young children in primary school has equipped me with a profound understanding of educational development, allowing me to approach chess instruction with a unique perspective.
best_skills: As a dedicated chess enthusiast, I have not only honed my own skills in the game but have also dedicated myself to nurturing the talents of aspiring chess players. With a passion for both chess and teaching, I've been able to successfully organize and guide my students on their chess journeys. My approach involves setting clear and achievable goals for each student, tailored to their individual strengths and weaknesses. Through meticulous planning and patient guidance, I've witnessed remarkable transformations in my students' abilities. It's immensely gratifying to see them achieve the goals we set together, whether it's mastering a particular opening, improving their endgame techniques, or even competing at higher levels. Chess isn't just a game; it's a journey of self-discovery, strategy, and intellectual growth, and I'm proud to be a part of my students' chess success stories.
teaching_methodology: My teaching approach involves personalized lesson plans tailored to each student's needs, utilizing resources like Lichess and ChessBase PGN files. I conduct lessons via Skype or Zoom, ensuring accessibility. I maintain ongoing communication to review progress, address questions, and provide supplementary materials, fostering a deep understanding and passion for chess.

name: WFM Ellen Nilssen
headline: None
about: My name is Ellen, I'm 22 years old, and from Denmark. My parents are chess players, so I have played chess since the age of 10. I currently study - but only half-time - and then I spend my other time teaching and training chess. I'm serious about my own chess, and I try to improve by studying every day and regularly competing in tournaments.
playing_experience: I have 12 years of experience playing chess.  At the age of 15, I won the Danish Women's Chess Championship, and not so long after that I joined the Women's National Team. I have represented Denmark at two Olympiads and numerous World- and European Championships, and in 2020 I beat my first Grandmaster.
teaching_experience: I have more than five years of experience teaching both groups and individuals on all levels of chess. I have taught in chess clubs, privately, and plenty online. Furthermore, I have also spent much time doing commentary and promoting chess mainly via my Twitch channel and other social media.
teaching_methodology: I believe that serious chess training can and should be fun and interactive. If you think something is fun, you'll want to spend more time on it as well. In my classes, we focus on your improving your weaknesses through the study of your games and your thinking process. Of course, if there's something that you want us to focus on (for example, opening or endgame), we will make sure to include that. I personalize the lessons so they suit you, and if you ever have any questions, you can always ask.

teaching_experience: With more than 6 years of experience in the field of teaching, I have worked with players who have been national youth champions and have obtained excellent results in international tournaments, such as: FM Maicol Benavides, ‚Äã‚ÄãCM Juan P√©rez, Gabriel Salazar, others.

name: IM Erik Kislik
headline: None
about: I am a 33-year-old International Master from San Francisco, California. I love to help people learn and improve their chess, so I wrote the book Applying Logic in Chess explaining exactly how I would approach becoming an International Master in chess if I was anywhere from 1000 strength to 2100 strength in chess. My second book, Chess Logic in Practice, discusses common practical situations we find ourselves in during middlegames and how to navigate them using logic. I have posted some YouTube videos that have helpful ideas in them that I wish I had learned when I was starting out in chess. Contact me at imerikkislik@gmail.com if you would like lessons.
playing_experience: I played tournament chess for 9 months prior to age 18, I studied chess very seriously and obtained my first FIDE rating at age 20, and became an International Master just after my 23th birthday. I have won two Grandmaster norm tournaments, and have won 4 International Master category tournaments.
teaching_experience: I coached the national champions of Spain, Denmark, Iceland, and Singapore, 3 of whom were Grandmasters.
best_skills: I analyze everything deeply and explain things clearly so that all of my students can understand me. I still understand how amateur players think because I had less than a year of chess experience at age 18. I am quite conscientious and collect a lot of useful training material and organize my openings and training material carefully, which is very helpful when coaching players who want to solve exercises, see accompanying examples, and need help learning new openings.
teaching_methodology: The best way to improve in chess is to play as much as possible, analyze those games as deeply as possible to learn the most you possibly can from them, do chess training that fills in gaps in your chess competence, and then go right back out and play more games and repeat the process. I focus on analyzing my students' games and patching up all areas where they're lagging behind. I have extensive training material that I created myself to give players additional study material if they are very serious about improving.

name: FM Aleksandras Jegorovas
headline: None
about: I am 39 years old, hold a bachelor's degree in philosophy, and is currently working as an analyst for a media monitoring company. My university background and work specialization help me excel at identifying tendencies, patterns, and helpful conclusions so that I arrive at the right solutions to problems. This applies to my chess coaching as well.
playing_experience: I am a multiple medalist in various Lithuanian team and rapid team championships: a two-time Lithuania rapid chess medalist and a one-time blitz chess championship medalist. I've participated in many international tournaments including various world and European chess championships. My best win was at the Pobedyski Cup in Frydek-Mistek in 2008 when I scored 8/9 and achieved a 2300 ELO for a first time. I was also Kaunas chess champion in 2000. My best result in the Lithuanian standard chess championship was 8th in 2007.
teaching_experience: I have worked as a private chess coach for most of my life. Sometimes, I have helped strong players prepare for specific tournaments, especially with their openings. I also have certification from the Department of Physical Education and Sports of Lithuania and official experience coaching groups of young people.
best_skills: Pattern recognition, identifying weak points of my students, teaching them the importance of every move in chess especially when critical positions arise.
teaching_methodology: How do I usually conduct chess training sessions? First, before we start the initial lesson, I thoroughly analyze my student‚Äòs recent games and identify his/her weaknesses. I find leaks and pay special attention to repeated mistakes from those games so we can concentrate on them in our lessons. While some coaches concentrate only on their students' opening repertoire, I ensure that game analysis is the foundation of our work, which I believe is the main path to improvement. However, I do help students with openings based on their own style, rather than forcing them to play my openings (like some other coaches do). Of course, if a student has any special needs or requests, I cover those too, leaving no questions unanswered.
