name: FM Reynold Fern√°ndez
headline: None
about: Mi nombre es Reynold Fern√°ndez. Juego ajedrez aproximadamente desde los 8 a√±os de edad, por lo que llevo m√°s de 20 a√±os dedicando mi vida a este deporte. Soy Licenciado en Cultura Fisica y Deporte y actualmente trabajo en el Centro de Estudios de Ajedrez ISLA. Me considero una persona alegre, estudioso y con mucha pasi√≥n por el ajedrez. En esta etapa de mi vida siento muchos deseos de progresar en el √°mbito profesional como jugador y como entrenador.
playing_experience: Mi ELO actual es de 2325 puntos. Arrib√© a los 2300 puntos ELO en el 2016. Oficialmente maestro FIDE desde el a√±o 2017. He participado en numerosos torneos nacionales e internacionales.
teaching_experience: Alumno Ayudante de la Asignatura Ajedrez por tres a√±os durante mi paso por la Licenciatura en Cultura Fisica Y Deporte.
other_experience: Autor de varios  art√≠culos relacionados con el ajedrez. Ej. Cronolog√≠a de las Ideas: Metodolog√≠a para el Estudio de Aperturas, Estudio y aprendizaje de las aperturas en ajedrez, etc.
best_skills: Tengo una buena preparaci√≥n en la Apertura, me considero un jugador l√≥gico con una buena base conceptual. Tengo buenas habilidades para el an√°lisis, ya que soy una persona que se enfoca mucho en los detalles y capaz de respaldar con argumetos l√≥gicos lo que sucede en el tablero. Me apasiona la investigaci√≥n acerca del Ajedrez y la b√∫squeda de nuevos m√©todos de ense√±anza.
teaching_methodology: Considero que un entrenador de ajedrez debe ser una persona observadora, un investigador que pueda determinar las fortalezas y debilidades del atleta para luego direccionar el entrenamiento. Tambi√©n debe tener cierta flexibilidad de pensamiento para permitirse reajustar un mal enfoque que este interfiriendo con el desarrollo del atleta. Considero adem√°s que la conceptualizaci√≥n es el nucleo del desarrollo cognitivo y que para enteder un suceso que ocurre con regularidad, a menudo tenemos que conceptualizarlo. Por esta raz√≥n el conocimiento incorporado una vez que podemos compararlo y conceptualizarlo determina un salto en nuestro nivel ajedrecistico. Espero por encima de todo ser √∫til para contribuir al cumplimiento del prop√≥sito de cada uno de los usuarios que decidan contactarme.

about: Greetings fellow Chess Enthusiasts!
playing_experience: I've had the opportunity to compete in international tournaments all over the world, from Mumbai and Delhi in India to Bhubaneshwar and Kolkata, and even as far as Europe and beyond in places like Russia, UAE, Vietnam, Spain, Armenia, Netherlands, Italy, Malaysia, Slovakia, Czech, Poland, Azerbaijan, Romania, Hungary, Croatia, and Serbia.
teaching_experience: I have been honing my teaching skills for the past five years and during this time, I have had the pleasure of teaching over 80+ students from around the world. My students have come from diverse backgrounds, with a majority from India, Europe, and America. I feel grateful for the opportunity to have shared my passion for chess with them and helped them improve their game.
best_skills: My passion lies in unlocking the hidden potential of my students through a tailored approach to their growth in chess. As an International Master in chess, my strengths lie in the endgame and positional play, as well as opening preparation.
teaching_methodology: In the world of chess, success is not a static destination that can be reached through a predetermined path. Rather, it is a dynamic journey that requires adaptability and flexibility. As a coach, I understand the importance of tailoring my approach to the unique needs and challenges of each student. Whether it's honing strengths or addressing weaknesses, I believe in a personalized coaching program that is designed for optimal growth and progress. With extensive experience in online platform tools such as Zoom, Skype, and Google Meet, I am fully equipped to provide a seamless and effective coaching experience for my students.

name: FM Raheem Glaves
headline: None
about: I am trainer from Jamaica who started playing chess at age 14 and was at a point in life of just giving up because I found it difficult to improve as I could not avoid losing games when it mattered the most in tournaments. With the help of friends and my passion to get stronger, I started using simple steps which helped me to overcome this and began to fix major holes in my game play; and as a result I started to play accurately in positions that I was not normally comfortable with and in a matter of months became a National Master at 17, and went on to get my FIDE Master title at the age of 18. Now I'm one of the top 3 players in the entire country and I'm showing people all over the world exactly how I did it.
playing_experience: - Best High School Player (2017-2019)
teaching_experience: My current coaching experience counts for 4 years now. I started off helping people from my region to get stronger by coaching schools and attending special events to give my insights about the sport and doing mini simuls. I have had a wonderful experience playing chess throughout my career and now this is my way of giving back and allow as many persons I can as possible to share a similar experience.
best_skills: I am known for my great positional understanding and I am very good at spotting major weaknesses in my opponents' and students' play.
teaching_methodology: I offer personalized chess lessons and in-depth game analysis for my students. With this, methods will be placed to train them to eliminate as many weaknesses in their play as possible. It is crucial to know what are the major reasons why you are losing games constantly and what you need to do to improve which may be breaking one or two bad habits you might have. I will take a series of games you have played recently and find repeated patterns that made you lose or give up advantages and work together to fix them so that you can avoid doing it again in the future. We will first check your opening repertoire to see if the one you currently have can be played at a high level and make some improvements on some variations if there is a need to, or use one of my recommendations if you are willing to do so.

name: FM Arun Dixit
headline: None
about: Hello everyone! My name is Arun Dixit and I'm a FIDE Master from the United States. I'm 18 years old and currently attend the University of California, Berkeley. Chess has been my biggest passion for a very long time, and I hope to share my knowledge of the game with others. Apart from playing chess, I enjoy hanging out with friends, reading comics, drinking green tea, watching movies, and writing poetry.
playing_experience: I've been playing chess for 13 years now, since 2010! Chess can be difficult sometimes, but those that persevere are always rewarded in the long run. Throughout the journey, I've taken first place at 10+ major tournaments and won several "brilliancy" prizes. I became a National Master in 2020, Candidate Master in 2022, and FIDE Master in 2022. I intend to continue playing in competitive events, with the goal of becoming an International Master or Grandmaster within the next couple of years.
teaching_experience: From 2020 to 2022, I was the coach for many talented juniors in the Greater Sacramento area. Many have won prestigious statewide tournaments and earned distinguished chess titles. However, I want to broaden my base and help not just people from the Greater Sacramento area, but the whole world! That's why I've opened this coach profile on Lichess.
other_experience: I served as the president of the chess club at my high school from 2019 to 2023. I also worked as a self-employed private chess coach from 2020 to 2022. However, I'm proudest of my two-year service as a special needs chess instructor at WeEMBRACE, a nonprofit that assists individuals with intellectual disabilities.
best_skills: With regards to chess, I am most comfortable with dynamic, but sound positions. I will often employ unconventional openings, including the Kopec system, to throw my opponents off guard. Tactics are definitely my forte, though I don't consider myself weak at all in positional nuances! As a coach, I am almost always in a lighthearted mood. People that know me often describe me as friendly, humorous, respectful, and patient. I can assure you that I am the least stressful person in the world to be around! :)
teaching_methodology: I center my lessons around what works best for the student. Classes will usually begin with 2-3 imaginative chess studies, featuring significant concepts the student can learn from. After this, we will work on openings, particularly those which the student wishes to learn more about and play in OTB tournaments. Towards the end of the lesson, we will analyze the student's recent games and I will provide insights on how to improve. Consistent with my teaching methodology, I do not assign homework but rather instruct the student to revise material covered in class.

name: NM Joshua Grabinsky
headline: None
about: Born and bred in rural Oregon, USA, I'm currently a 19-year-old junior in college.  I started at age 5 with my dad and brother Aaron.  I took a keen interest, we went to the local chess club, and spent many long nights playing chess in our room.  I caught on to resources like
playing_experience: I've played all over the United States, Canada and Mexico, competing in many U.S. Opens and National Opens.  Tied for first U12 in North American Youth 2015 (first in blitz); 2nd place for ninth grade in National Grade Champs, FL 2017;  tied for first place, ahead of 3 GM's in Larry Evan's Memorial 2019; top U2300 in National Open 2019; 2019 OR Open, 2nd place; OR State Champ 2020.  2020 PRO Chess League participant with the Webster Windmills; 2018 and 2020 OR High School representative for the Denker tournament.
teaching_experience: I've taught at the local chess club kids of all ages and levels, teaching them everything from the basics of rules and moves, to concepts regarding positional play, pawn structures, attacks, and exercises.
best_skills: I will patiently work with students to make the experience enjoyable and relative to them, with constant interaction, analysis of their games, fun exercises, and orderly layout of fundamentals, strategies, opening play, etc.
teaching_methodology: First I will get a grasp of the student's level, strengths, weaknesses, and playing styles, and general knowledge of the game.  I can then plan my lessons to target areas to improve, and build ones that are already strong.  This is done with game analysis, tactical exercises, strategical questions, how to think in chess, calculations, planning, middle game structures, numerous endgames, giving you a feel for how the pieces work together and individually, showing classical must-know situations that occur often.  I can help provide a solid basis for the different openings with either color, and teach other options besides the long, "trendy" theoretical lines, which are a little dry and overly used in my opinion.  That doesn't mean, however, I'm teaching a bunch of offbeat gambits and weird sacrifices, but just something to catch your opponent off guard with and get of the beaten path, fairly early.  Of course, middle game plans and follow up ideas accompany this.

name: CM Markus Regez
headline: None
about: Ich bin 1974 in der Schweiz geboren und spiele seit dem 8. Lebensjahr Schach. Zwischen 1992 und ca. 2005 habe ich die Jugendschachgruppe des SK Aarau geleitet. Daraus hervorgegangen sind FM Felix Hindermann, FM Roger Gloor und einige starke 2000er Elo-Spieler. Seit 2009 bin ich professioneller Schachtrainer und seit 2013 f√ºhre ich eine eigene Schachschule in K√ºsnacht in der N√§he von Z√ºrich. Mein Sch√ºlerinnen und Sch√ºler haben seit 2013 insgesamt 24 Schweizermeister-Titel in Langzeit und Schnellschach gewonnen. Einige Jahre trainierte ich Nah Fecker, der nun FM ist und Angeh√∂riger des Schweizer Herrenkaders.
playing_experience: Seit 1998 spielte ich √ºber 1200 Turnierpartien. Ich trage den Titel "Candidate Master". Meine h√∂chste Nationale Elozahl betr√§gt 2280 und die h√∂chste FIDE-Elozahl 2221.
teaching_experience: Seit 2015 bin ich FIDE-Trainer. 2009 erhielt ich das Zertifikat f√ºr den FIDE-Instructor. Ich bin zudem A-Trainer des Schweizerischen Schachbundes. Zwischen 2013 und 2018 war ich Schweizer Juniorencoach und bin in dieser Funktion an diverse internationale Jugendturniere gereist (EM, WM, U16-Olympiade, L√§nderwettk√§mpfe) und habe dort verschiedene Schweizer Junioren und Juniorinnen gecoacht. Neben Nationalkadertrainings im Sportzentrum Magglingen leitete ich in dieser Zeit auch das Regionalkader Ost. Seit 2013 f√ºhrte ich zudem √ºber 10 Trainer-Weiterbildungen f√ºr den Schweizerischen Schachbund durch. Seit Gr√ºndung meiner eigenen Schachschule haben unsere Sch√ºlerinnen und Sch√ºler 16 Schweizermeistertitel in Langzeit und Schnellschach gewonnen sowie weitere sehr gute Platzierungen. Sieben Sch√ºler spielten an internationalen Meisterschaften (EM, WM) mit. 2012 durfte ich dreimal das Schweizerische Herrenteam trainieren.
other_experience: Zwischen 2013 und 2018 habe ich Partien f√ºr die Schweizerische Schachzeitung kommentiert und spannende Aufgaben f√ºr die Rubrik "Sie sind am Zug" zusammen gestellt. Zudem habe ich 2018 ein Jahr lang einmal im Monat die Kolumne "Accentus Jugendschachseite" im Tagesanzeiger geschrieben. Seit 2019 habe ich die Arbeit bei der Schweizerischen Schachzeitung wieder aufgenommen.
best_skills: Beim Unterrichten bin ich sehr strukturiert und m√∂glichst gut vorbereitet. Ich habe viele Chessbase-Datenbanken √ºber verschiedene Themen angelegt, so dass ich in den Gruppen- und Einzeltrainings auf einen grossen Schatz von Aufgaben zur√ºckgreifen kann. Ich habe √ºber 500 Schachb√ºcher gelesen und lese immer noch weiter. Dieses Wissen lasse ich in die Trainings einfliessen.
teaching_methodology: Beim Start eines Privattrainings ben√∂tige ich normalerweise die letzten 10 bis 20 gespielten Turnierpartien. Diese analysiere ich vor dem ersten Training. Zudem bitte ich den Sch√ºler um eine eigene Einsch√§tzung seiner St√§rken und Schw√§chen und um seine W√ºnsche bez√ºglich dem, was er verbessern m√∂chte. (Er√∂ffnungen, Taktik, Strategie, Endspiele, andere Elemente wie Ausdauer, Motivation usw.) Normalerweise starten wir dann mit dem Thema, das am wichtigsten erscheint. Nach Wunsch kann ich dann auch Aufgaben f√ºrs eigene Training zu Hause zusammenstellen oder gebe Literatur-Tipps, Tipps zu Schachwebsites usw.

name: IM Josiah Stearman
headline: None
about: Hello! I am Josiah Stearman. I am a 20-year old Grandmaster-Elect with a Bachelor's degree in Applied Mathematics from the prestigious UC Berkeley and a Master's degree in Education from the University of Missouri- Columbia. I love watching and playing sports, but I love chess even more!
playing_experience: I started playing chess when I was 5 years old and found my way into the top 3 for my age in the US when I was 7. I have won multiple California Grade level championships as well as the 2nd grade National Championships. I have been an All-American designee for many years which is awarded to the top junior US players. I made NM at 10, FM at 12, and while studying at UC Berkeley, made IM at 17.
teaching_experience: My dad has been a chess and math teacher for over 20 years. He was the one who taught me chess and is the one who inspired me to teach people this beautiful game we play. I started teaching several years back when I discovered my own passion for helping students learn and love the game. I currently give private lessons, as well as group classes under Berkeley Chess School, a non profit chess organization based in the Bay Area.
best_skills: I am an incredibly resilient and resourceful player. I have a very aggressive and energetic style of play, and will certainly bring that same level of energy to our lessons! I am very good at pinpointing strengths and weaknesses, breaking down the psychology of planning in chess, and helping you improve on calculation and decision making.
teaching_methodology: We will work through different modules of training, depending on your needs. This includes but is not limited to... reviewing your games (both online and over the board), in depth analysis of GM games and how top players think, positionally and tactically focused puzzles, and much much more! On our off days, I will typically provide you with homework and resources so you will be able to train as efficiently and effectively as possible!

name: NM Sam Martin
headline: None
about: My name is Sam Martin, and I am a 25-year-old National Master living in the United States. I first became serious about chess when I was a teenager, and I improved rapidly due to working with an experienced coach on openings, middlegame strategy, and calculation. I returned to playing in chess tournaments in 2022, after taking a break of several years while I was in college, and gained the National Master title after crossing 2200 in live rating about a year later. I am still always interested in learning more about the game. If we work together, I'm sure I can help you to learn more and achieve your chess goals as well! I am available for both lessons and training games. The first lesson is always free, so you know what you're getting from me.
playing_experience: None
teaching_experience: I have taught chess for more than 5 years in a number of different settings, both in private lessons and group classes. I am especially experienced in working with kids, and it is always rewarding for me to see a young player grow in their enthusiasm for chess and get better at the game. I accept all ages and skill levels!
teaching_methodology: I have a flexible teaching style that uses a number of different methods to work on a student's problem areas and develop their general understanding, such as reviewing their over-the-board games, giving calculation exercises, looking at opening theory, typical pawn structures, and more. I believe that having a coach is not a substitute for independent study, and I see my main job as giving you guidance and insight to help you study more effectively on your own. I want to give you more tools in your mental toolbox and support your climb to the top by showing you what you need to work on next to become a complete player. I will do this both during the lesson, through examples, and outside the lesson, by assigning homework that builds on and reinforces the themes we have already discussed.

best_skills: I mostly teach students up to about 2000 USCF, although I have had a couple of students who broke 2200 USCF during or shortly after working with me. teaching_methodology: My lessons usually consist of some combination of solving exercises, playing training games, analyzing the student's games, analyzing important historical games, and answering the student's specific questions about openings/endgames/chess resources/etc. In between lessons I am available to communicate with students via email.

name: Austin Earsley
headline: None
about: I am 31 years old.  I've been coaching chess since 2009 and teaching chess to private students since 2012. I started teaching chess full time in 2016 when I was hired by the Renaissance Knights Chess Club in Chicago. I've since moved out of the city and continue to teach full time both online and in person.
playing_experience: I began studying chess in 2007 when I was 16.  In high school in 2008, I was the only player to beat FM Albert Chow in a 30+ board simul at Aurora Central Catholic High School.  In 2009, I won the division 2 state individual championship in Illinois.  I also led my team to a top 25 finish as 1st board.
teaching_experience: My coaching experience began as an unofficial coach for the Bradley-Bourbonnais Community High School chess team.  In the few years I coached and played there I helped them achieve 3 top 25 finishes in Illinois as well as a 13-0 conference record in the SWSC.
best_skills: I am especially skilled with long term students.  Most of my serious chess teaching was in the form of beginners (<1000) who joined my high school chess team.  Many of these students achieved ratings of 1400-1700 within 2-3 years.
teaching_methodology: My teaching philosophy begins with thoroughly learning the rules of the game including all of the intricacies of pawn promotions, castling, and en passant. Then some very basic chess strategy is necessary. Things like controlling the center of the board, developing your pieces to form an effective attack, keeping your king safe, and being aware of your opponent's threats will immensely improve a beginner's chess ability.

name: IM Matyas Marek

about: My name is Matyas Marek; I am a 24 years old International Master of Chess from the Czech Republic. Currently, I am studying in the US pursuing a doctorate degree in bioinformatics.
playing_experience: I have played chess since I was 5. I reached the IM title when I was 16 years old. I have played in countless tournaments, including World and European youth chess championships. My most significant achievement was 6th place at the World Youth Chess Championship under 18 in 2015.
teaching_experience: Currently, I am teaching a few students around my hometown in the Czech Republic; I also have a few students in the US. I have been teaching chess for 3 years.
teaching_methodology: Since chess is a very complex game, I try to teach all aspects of chess. That means my standard lessons usually focus on improving positional play by either analyzing strong players' games or your games, doing puzzles to make spotting tactics in an actual match easier, and last but not least, working on endgame technique, which is sometimes the most complicated part of the game. I also like to practice my students' other skills closely related to chess, such as memory or problem-solving.

name: FM Alessandro  Manzone Barranco
headline: None
about: Hi everyone! I¬¥ m a 32 year-old Fide Master from Argentina. I¬¥ ve been playing chess for 25 years now, and have roughly 15 years of coaching experience, working with players of all levels and ages. Chess is a life-long passion of mine!
playing_experience: It¬¥ s been a life of playing chess. As a teenager I won the U14 National Championship, and then I took part in the World Youth Championship of my age category. I also came in second and third in succesive years in the U18.  I have also played in a lot of international rated tournaments, and won some of them, with fields that included strong, titled players. I have also won the championship of my province many times, currently being the best rated player in the region (2386 FIDE at the time of writing).
teaching_experience: For many years I gave lessons in a local club, to people of all ages and chess ability. With some experience on my back, I started working individually with players who wanted to compete and get better results. Some of my students have won provincial and regional championships. I¬¥ve worked with some young and promising players, particularly Ian Hakanson -4th in the 2019 National U16 Championship (being 14 years old)-, who went from 1700 to 1900 ELO in the span of a single year.
best_skills: As a chessplayer, I think my biggest asset is that I¬¥ m a tough nut to crack! I¬¥ m a rather solid player, inclined to positional play.
teaching_methodology: The training program adapts to the student, not the other way around. My first priority is the analysis of your games, to make a diagnosis of your weaknesses and strengths. From there we will determine a line of work, always focusing on the development of practical playing abilities and enhancement of your thought process. I firmly believe in active learning, so we will make empshasis on the resolution

name: GM Joshua Ruiz

about: Hello! I am Joshua Ruiz, a GM from Colombia. I have been living in the US for 7 years already. Thanks to my performances in chess,  I was offered a scholarship for my Bachelor's Degree if I represented the university's chess team.  I graduated in Computer Science from the University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (UTRGV) and I am about to graduate with my Master's in Software Engineering at The University of Texas at Dallas (UTD).
playing_experience: Some of my most highlighted chess achievements are:
teaching_experience: I have been coaching for 5 years already. I have given private lessons as well as coaching schools in Colombia and the US. I moved to online coaching in 2019 because usually, all my lessons were in person. We are privileged that our beloved sport can be played through a computer, unlike other sports, so why not take full advantage of that.
other_experience: During the Covid-19 pandemic, I started to stream from time to time. With some of the best Colombian chess players, we created a company called Elite Colombian Chess and we deliver Seminars, provide lessons, and we stream at least once a week if there aren't important tournaments being played. Otherwise, we also like to comment on those.
best_skills: I consider myself a very creative and aggressive player. So of course I like dynamic positions more than positional ones. Of course, being a GM you need a level of understanding and I am currently working on that aspect to go to the next level (2600).

other_experience: I participate in the PRO chess league as a player for the San Diego Surfers, and commentate quite frequently when I am not playing. I have a lot of experience commentating casually and run a tiny Twitch channel at twitch.tv/jjosu1.
best_skills: My strengths in this game are probably my intuition, calculation, and the opening.  While it is not hard to see that my experience pales in comparison to that of many older IMs and GMs, I believe that the way in which I look at the game is relatively unique and my age allows me to better connect with a lot of the modern chess audience.

name: FM Pablo Trujillo
headline: The progress in chess is achieved when the player becomes critical and reflects deeply on his game. I invite you to try my highly qualified training methods
about: Hello! Nice to greet you.
playing_experience: My beginnings in chess were in the year 1999 in Caracas Venezuela, where I was champion in smaller categories many times at the District level. Represent Venezuela in different international competitions, such as Pan-American, Central American, sub-zone, zone, as well as tours in Europe. My coach was the International Master Antonio Palacios, I shared many hours of training, friendship and even was an advisor for several years of Grand Master Eduardo Iturrizaga, a personal friend with whom I shared different experiences and training methods.
teaching_experience: - Coach and Analyst of Grand Master Eduardo Iturrizaga. Caracas, Venezuela 2007-2012.
other_experience: - Guest Instructor and Speaker at the Chess Academy Minds Bright. Aragua Venezuela 2015-2017.
best_skills: t is always difficult to talk about oneself because sometimes we tend to lose objectivity. However, I suggest you to know what my chess philosophy is, I consider that to be good at chess, you have to understand if or if the finals, there is no world champion that is not exquisite in handling the technique of the end, so everyone agrees to declare them as a fundamental and most important stage in the game. Taking that as a starting point I will show you different methods that allow you to understand the endings pedagogically, for this I will use different methodologies, some developed by me, others by other specialties. In the same way, we will address the dynamics of the learning process using tools, resources and support material of the best level.
teaching_methodology: For the development of the classes, we will use Skype, Hangouts, whatsapp or any other application available for the audio, as for the board, we will do it interactively using Lichess studies by themes in each class. Classes are prepared in a personalized way for each student according to the data generated by the previous diagnosis. In that sense I will approach teaching through a structured plan per quarter, which includes online classes, practical exercises, assignments by class, discussion of readings and a lot of practice. The times to evaluate progress in chess are usually quite long, but with great perseverance and discipline, great goals are achieved. The secret is in good planning and keep up.

about: Hi everyone, my name is Jos√© Renato Ruiz Maranh√£o. I'm 27 years old and I'm a National Master from Piracicaba, S√£o Paulo - Brazil. Chess taught me many things in life. I graduated with degrees in physical education and music. Aside from chess, I‚Äôm a pianist by profession.
playing_experience: I started playing chess when I was very young. By the age of 7, chess became my passion. Later on at the age of 15, I got to know the chess club in my city and started playing in tournaments, and soon I became one of the strongest players in my city. At 17 years old I won my biggest title - Brazilian Vice Champion under 20 category! This title gave me great opportunities to play in more tournaments and take classes with Grand Masters. In 2014, I took a break from competitive chess. But I have started to compete in tournaments again in early 2019, and now I‚Äôm more excited than ever!
teaching_experience: I have taught in schools of different grades, so my experience lets me teach students of all ages. I also gave private lessons to a number of people in my hometown as well as taught students at my city chess club. I really love to teach and take joy in seeing the great results of my students!
best_skills: I believe that my strongest points are having original ideas and a philosophical mindset about the game which leads the student to have a better understanding about chess in general.
teaching_methodology: I have always been very curious about a lot of chess books and methods. I prefer not to follow a particular teaching standard, but rather adapt to the individual needs of each student, trying to be as didactic as possible.

name: NM Theodore Slade
headline: None
about: I am Life Master Theo Slade and I am from England but I moved to Orlando, Florida in 2015 and have been living here ever since.
playing_experience: I have played over 100 USCF rated tournaments. I have played twelve classical tournament games against Grandmasters, drawing two, as White against Julio Becerra Rivero (2583), and as Black against Sandro Pozo Vera (2432). I have also defeated an International Master with Black, Nelson Gamboa (2495).
teaching_experience: I have been teaching for four years. In 2017 I worked with a very ambitious, engaged student who I got on really well with and within just five weeks he increased from 1328 to 1425. It was a lot of fun working with him and I was delighted to see his success!
other_experience: I run a chess club where I teach up to sixteen people at once, and I also help them as they are playing friendly games. I have also lectured about my chess career, showing my best games. Additionally, I have been writing a monthly column for the British Chess Magazine since I was 12; I am the youngest ever writer for the world's oldest chess journal!
best_skills: I am a positional player, particularly strong in theoretical positions and strategic endgames. Therefore I can help you best in these areas. I am best at explaining in detail abstract concepts, and I think these are especially valuable because they can be applied in many situations.
teaching_methodology: I ask my students to send me their recent games before our first lesson and I always analyze all of them to find their strengths and weaknesses. We always go through them even if the student has already analyzed them with an engine since often I can see weaknesses in the student's game that they themselves cannot see. If there are no student games to analyze, I like showing my games, not because they are the best example, but because I am most familiar with my thought process so I can easily explain why I made all my moves, but I can only speculate with regard to other players. After the lesson, I always email my students a PGN of what we discussed.

name: GM Igor Janik
headline: None
about: I am 23 year old Grand Master from Poland.

other_experience: I have been teaching some groups in my voivodship, I am also occasionally commentating chess for the Polish national federation, and some other commentators/streamers
best_skills: My playstyle was mostly dependent on some sharp positions, such as Dragon, Najdorf, and other Sicilian-style positions. Nowadays I am trying to play some solid openings. I can easily teach you, how to look for some dynamic chances in very solid openings
teaching_methodology: First of all, I am always trying to make some research, to check what kind of chessplayer you are. Then I am preparing some ideas and opening novelties that are based on your openings. I am mostly communicating by Skype/discord or some chess platforms, such as Lichess, but I am also fine with talking on Messenger.

name: FM Nate Solon
headline: None
about: Hi! I'm FM Nate Solon. As a student I was one of the top players for my age in the US. After school I played poker professionally for many years. When I quit poker I returned to chess, but this time as a coach and content creator.
playing_experience: I'm a US and FIDE Master. I won the national grade championship for the US in 8th and 9th grade. I'm also a Massachusetts state champion. I have beaten some of the best blitz in the world, including Andrew Tang and Hikaru Nakamura.
teaching_experience: I've been teaching chess for over 20 years. I've worked with students from beginner to expert level.
other_experience: My experiences as a poker player and data scientist inform my approach to coaching. I'm interested in pragmatic and efficient ways to improve performance. I like to use data to question common assumptions and find unexplored opportunities.
best_skills: I believe in combining a data-driven approach with empathy. In my experience the biggest stumbling block for most players is not a lack of knowledge, but issues with the thought process, so I try to get a handle on how you think and suggest ways to improve it.
teaching_methodology: Common techniques include reviewing your games with an eye towards recurring patterns, calculation training, and helping you build and refine your opening repertoire. I follow up after each lesson with a review of what we covered and suggestions for study material.

name: NM Stephen Adams
headline: None
about: I am a 26-year-old National Master living in Metro Detroit. I love to play, study, and teach chess. My personal goals in chess are rather simple: to become a better player. I want to help you on your improvement journey as well!
playing_experience: 2014 Alabama State Champion
teaching_experience: I have worked with students both privately and in groups. All ages and skill levels are welcome!
other_experience: I love to teach and have tutored students in chemistry and physics in college, though my favorite subject of course is chess! Nonetheless, regardless the subject, I can take concepts that are initially difficult to grasp and help you with both understanding and application.
best_skills: I excel in slower time controls: I am consistently top 10 classical and have peaked as high as #1. As opposed to blitz/bullet where decisions are made primarily on intuition, longer time controls enable players to supplement their intuition with concrete analysis. I will teach you how to analyze positions effectively so that you can make better decisions in your games.
teaching_methodology: Chess skill is the intersection of knowledge, technique, and ability. Knowledge is what you know: opening theory, tactical patterns, theoretical endgames, and positional principles and themes. Technique is how you think: it is how you calculate, blunder-check, the process of decision making, and habits (both good and bad!). Ability is what you can do: how deep you can calculate, speed in a time scramble, and some of the things that can be chalked up as "talent".

name: CM Koosha Jaferian
headline: None
about: My name is Koosha Jaferian, I am a 24 year old FIDE Candidate Master with a current FIDE rating of 2233 and a CFC rating of 2383 (CFC Peak 2507). I am originally Iranian but I currently live in Toronto, Canada where I pursue my Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of Toronto. Mathematics has always been my favorite course in school and I am a Bronze Medalist in International Mathematics Competition (IMC) and also Iranian National Math Olympiad. I managed to finish 3rd among more than 184000 participants in the Iranian Nationwide University Entrance exam.
playing_experience: Between the age of 7 to 12, I was taking chess seriously and managed to win the Fajr International Chess Tournament with participation of all Iranian top players and also players from Azerbaijan in U10 age group twice in a row. I also finished 2nd in Iranian youth chess championship at U8 age category. I also had two experiences in Asian Youth chess championships where I finished 10th and 9th respectively.
teaching_experience: I have worked with a wide range of players. I have the experience of teaching the absolute beginners in elementary school when I was much younger. I also had private sessions with a wide range of people with the FIDE rating of less than 2000 and the online rating of less than 2300.
other_experience: I have been streaming on twitch for more than a year at
best_skills: I love to play solid and positional chess. My main skill as a chess player, is to use the small strategical mistakes of my opponents and gradually turn them into a winning advantage. About the openings, I am an expert in the Caro-Kann and Nimzo/Queen's Indian with Black and I have solid repertoires with white with 1.e4, 1.d4 and 1. Nf3
teaching_methodology: I strongly believe that the student should first understand what is their main area of improvement in chess. As a result, I will first look at my student's games and will try to find out the main recurring patterns in their mistake. After finding their main areas of improvement, I will create a plan including the practice on all areas of chess (Openings, Tactics, Positonal Understanding, Endgames, etc) but with more focus on the areas of improvement. name: IM Yuriy Krykun
headline: Highly motivated and hardworking students are welcome! Now also launching group lessons, camps and lectures at https://yuriykrykun.com/
about: Welcome to my page! I'm a 24-year-old International Master and FIDE Instructor Yuriy Krykun from Ukraine, Ukrainian Champion U-20 in 2018(7.5/9), and vice-champion in blitz(7/9. I currently live in the United States and attend Webster University, a school with the N1-ranked chess team in the nation. I have won a number of international tournaments, won 10 medals in Ukrainian youth championships, and recently won a bronze medal while representing the Ukrainian Youth National Team ( European Championship U-18), and am willing to share my knowledge with you! Besides my playing experience, I have tremendous experience in teaching, and creating chess content, such as books, courses, and articles. Also, I take pride in explaining chess well, which makes people address me when they want to improve - hopefully, you will choose me as a coach, too!
playing_experience: I have been playing since childhood, have faced and managed to beat a number of strong players.
teaching_experience: I've been coaching for about 6 years, both online an in-person. Honestly though, I prefer thinking of experience in hours as opposed to years, as teaching full-time for a year is clearly better than occasionally giving a lesson here and there for 20 years. As for me, I have given about 12 000 hours of private instruction during those 6 years, which is quite a unique experience, I believe.
other_experience: I am very fortunate to be a member of the Webster University Chess Team, which is coached by the legendary Susan Polgar and is the best collegiate chess team in the whole US! Thanks to this program, I have already had a chance to train with many strong GMs and learn more about the improvement methods that lead to great results. In this team, people indeed do give everything they have to remain best for years!
best_skills: I pride myself in being rather good at explaining things clearly and straight to the point. Hopefully, you can find a proof of it by taking a look at my reviews :) If you'd like to find out more about my style of explaining, please check out my YouTube channel, which I had created recently to provide everyone with free amazing educational opportunity, as well as my countless videocourses on Chessable, TheChessWorld, Modern-Chess and several other sources.
teaching_methodology: During the lesson we will pay attention to the analysis of student's games in order to find out typical mistakes and avoid them in future, also we'll study classical famous games, will work on the opening repertoire as well as positional skills and calculation abilities. There are numerous things to be learned by avid investigators of mysteries of chess, I look forward to sharing every single thing I know with you!

name: NM Zane Nasir
headline: None
about: I am a 24 year old tax law student (one year from being a lawyer) from Toronto, Canada! I can often be found playing or studying chess, going to the gym, reading, or biking through landscapes!
playing_experience: I have played chess since I was 7, competed regularly until age 21, but mainly focused on coaching since age 19. I have won several Ontario (Canada's largest province) championships, finished in the top 3 in 4 different national championships, and have been part of 3 gold medal university teams in the Canadian championships. In the individual world university championships I finished top 30 out of 900 participants, over a quarter of which were titled. I reached National Master level at age 14.
teaching_experience: I first started teaching at the age of 14 in 2012. My very first student won the national championship for girls her age 5 different times and is currently a WFM. Since then I have taught every demographic of student imaginable (young, old, beginner, advanced, male, female, other, ect). I teach group classes as well at a discounted rate per student, something I have been doing since 2018.
other_experience: I have been a chess tournament organizer, commentator, been featured in a few streams, and have taught many academic subjects to students in high school and undergraduate university.
best_skills: My greatest skill as a coach is building intuition. I help students get a good feel for what plans to do, and when tactics may be floating around. Being self-taught, I also help students learn to teach themselves on their own time to supplement the lessons.
teaching_methodology: Before delving into the abyss of learning chess, I analyze several of my student's games and talk to them to get a feel for what style they have, and which areas need the most work. Then I tailor a training plan to best assist their overall ability, while nurturing their natural gifts as well. Even for 'ordinary' chess players, I help them excel at areas they may not be familiar with. From my bio "I specialize in building intuition, calculation, and incorporate my background in clinical psychology and neuroscience to assist people with emotional regulation during games/events."

name: GM Dmitry Gordievsky
headline: None
about: Welcome to my page! My name is Dmitry Gordievsky, aka Gordima, on all platforms. I am 27 y.o GM from Russia, Moscow. My peak rating was 2653. I speak English and Russian(obviously) fluently.
playing_experience: My Best Tournaments:
teaching_experience: I have been a coach for around five years. On average, my students increase their rating by 100-200 points after several months of work (1-2 times per week). I've worked on my own for a significant part of my professional career; during that time, I identified effective methods, which I share with my students.
other_experience: Besides coaching, I do commentary, public lectures, and play myself of course.
best_skills: If you decide to improve your chess under my guidance, you get:
teaching_methodology: I prefer to be very specific with all parts of training (openings, psychology, calculation, intuitive play etc). There are many approaches possible to improve various weaknesses. However, since all people are unique, I'm trying to find a training that fits a person and available time. If I notice that a student enjoys doing something significantly more (playing, openings, tactics, watching games, reading books etc), I build a training process in a way, that gets the most out of a practice that my student enjoys the most.

name: CM Ilija Stanojevic
headline: None
about: I am Ilija Stanojevic 21 years old CM. I live in Belgrade in Serbia. I started with chess when I was 4 years old. More than 3 years of coaching beginners in an earlier stage. The concept of my lessons is planned in advance for at least 20 lessons. I will make a plan for how we will work after I see what is the most critical segment of your understanding of chess. That's the part that we are starting
playing_experience: None
teaching_experience: I offer a comprehensive training program that covers various aspects of the game. This includes teaching opening theory such as  Sicilian Defence, French Defence, Kings Indian, Pirc, Dutch and different gambits based on your style of play. Additionally, I focus on developing middlegame strategy and tactics by providing tricks and tips and enhancing basic understanding through the process of thinking. Endgame principles are also discussed, with emphasis on King activity, Rook and Queen endgames, and general principles. I also provide guidance on calculation and positional understanding by offering tactical tips, identifying weaknesses, and crucially focusing on what to think about. In analyzing games, I show students what they should play, consider psychological factors, time control, and provide personal advice/experience. I assess the student's playing style, whether positional or aggressive, and help them find an opening repertoire based on that. To further enhance their knowledge and success in endgames, specific endgames are studied, and additional homework in the form of Chessbase or Lichess files is given. Homework is based on the concepts discussed in the lesson, which helps students control their improvement. For long-term progress, a plan is formulated after one month of lessons.
best_skills: I am well-versed in all aspects of chess, with a particular focus on the middlegame and strategy. While I am proficient in the opening, I believe that strengthening one's understanding of strategy and tactics is the key to success in chess. Many players lack a strong foundation in these areas, and improving this can significantly improve their overall play. By combining a solid understanding of strategy and tactics with a strong foundation in the opening, I am confident that I can achieve success in my chess endeavors.
teaching_methodology: üîé(FOR STUDENTS WHO START LEARNING FROM 0 ) Start with the basics: teach the names and movements of the pieces, how the board is set up, and the basic rules of the game.

name: IM Kim Steven Yap
headline: None
about: My name is Kim Steven Yap and I am an International Master and a FIDE trainer. My best achievement in Chess is when I played in the Asian Chess Clubs League in 2014 in Al, Ain, UAE for team Philippines. I won the gold medal in board 2 but I played the board 1 players in almost all the games, I beat 3 GMs in the tournament including Sasikiran Krishnan of India. Our team, team Philippines - Tagaytay finished 2nd ahead of China.
playing_experience: I have been playing Chess since I was 7 and became a National Kiddies Chess champion when I was 12. I sealed the International Master title when I was 20 after grabbing my final norm in Singapore Mixed-Masters Open. I won the Gold Medal in ASEAN Chess Clubs League in Al Ain, UAE in 2014. During the Berkeley Masters Invitational 2018, I scored 7 pts out of 9 in the IM event to secure first place. In the GM event, I scored 6.5pts to grab a GM norm and went on to snatch second place in the tournament.
teaching_experience: Right after I became IM, I worked as a Chess Coach for the University of Cebu. After finishing college, I have worked in Singapore under ASEAN Chess Academy from 2011 to 2014. In 2014, I founded my own Chess School, the Cebu School of Chess, with the goal of producing future masters. Most of my young students have already received numerous awards. One of whom is Jerish Velarde, who grabbed a silver medal during the Asian Chess Schools in Singapore in 2014, thus coming out as a Candidate Master when he was only 8 years old. In 2018, I traveled around the United States to coach players in different Chess Schools, in the same year I grabbed a Grand Master norm. I worked with Megan Paragua when she was only 7 years old during the pandemic and now she is a Woman Fide Master with a 2100+ USCF rating.
other_experience: I have been successful against a number of Grand Masters such as GM Wesley So, GM Zhao Jun, GM Sasikiran Krishnan, GM Conrad Holt and so on.
best_skills: I usually try to understand a player according to the way he understands a position and I focus on finding solutions to move him to the next level. I am a specialist in endgames and e4 openings for White. As Black, I have a repertoire for the Grunfeld system and the Sicilian defense.
teaching_methodology: I provide holistic training programs for my students that includes tournament and psychological preparation. Each player has a different weakness and strength and as a coach I work on how I could correct the player's bad habits and enhance his strength much further.

headline: None
about: Founder of RedBandit Chess, a comprehensive chess coaching program.  I have 10+ years of experience coaching students ranging from complete beginner to 2100.  Many of my students have competed nationally and have made significant improvements.  My peak rating is 2364 and I am 3-time Connecticut State Champion.  I have also co-authored Mastering Chess: 2nd Edition with IM Danny Kopec, et al.  You can find out more about me and my method when it comes to chess instruction on my website.
playing_experience: 3-time Connecticut State Champion (2013, 2015, 2016)
teaching_experience: I have been coaching players of all levels, adults and children, for over ten years.  I have also coached teams that have competed at the national scholastic championships.  Many of those individuals have scored very well on the national stage and one of my teams placed 1st at the National Elementary Championships.
other_experience: I teach with a deliberate focus on assessing and improving executive functioning (EF). Broadly, EF comprises a set of cognitive control processes that enable goal-directed behavior and self-regulation. Specific skills associated with EF include decision-making, planning, sequencing behavior, inhibiting habitual responses, shifting between tasks, and coping with novel information or situations. As such, EF is necessary for developing good and flexible habits in everyday life. EF skills have also been linked to better overall academic, vocational, and emotional  functioning. Thus, by using chess as a fun and evidence-based approach to targeting executive functions, I provide my students with life-long, cognitive benefits ‚Äì whether their goal is to participate in a beginners tournament or reach the level of master.

name: GM Peter Prohaszka

about: I am GM Peter Prohaszka 31 years old, from Hungary. I became Grandmaster at age 17. My peak FIDE rating was 2627 and with that I was in world top 150. My best results: I won the U14 European Championship. In 2022 I became Hungarian Champion. I am part of the Hungarian National Team.

My students won gold in the U14 Girl Championship and Silver at the U16 Girl European Championship.  I am the second of the Hungarian National Woman Team since 2021.

about: I am IM Maximiliano Perez from Argentina, I am dedicated to training players with ambitions to progress from 1500 to 2350. I work all aspects of chess, including psychological ones, giving advice and showing different situations within the game with my own examples. My idea is to explain the way It is correct that one should think about the positions on and off the board. I also give group classes and chess seminars in clubs. I have a YouTube channel where I have uploaded free classes and you can see how I explain chess. It is the following:

other_experience: I have read a lot about neuroscience and I have applied it in my own games. I think it is important not only to have good technique but to do a comprehensive job taking into account the psychological aspects that hold us back.
best_skills: I have a lot of experience as a teacher since I have been teaching for 10 years and where I have collected several examples of the best games in the world as well as my own game where I can explain how the reasoning I had to make this or that move was.
teaching_methodology: The class is on Skype and is interactive. It consists of seeing some type of position where I will ask questions to discover strengths and weaknesses. This also serves to find patterns which we will then work to improve. I consider that something that needs to be worked on and is Fundamental is the way of thinking that is why I place a lot of emphasis on the question ¬øHow did you come to that conclusion?

headline: I prefer to work with those who wish to play at a serious international level. Worked with Ponomariov, Karpov, many children's Wchs. Write me at: gmi@europe.com
about: Mikhail Golubev. Chess grandmaster, journalist, author, trainer, organiser from Odessa, Ukraine. Website:
playing_experience: IGM since 1996. Ukrainian Champion 1996. Winner of the Swiss Open Championship in 1999.
teaching_experience: I have been giving online chess lessons since December 2019. I prefer to work with those who wish to play at a serious international level. Normally I don't work with beginners. I have worked as a coach or assistant, in particular, with the world champions Ruslan Ponomariov and Anatoly Karpov, and with many European and World youth/junior champions (U-10 ... U-20).
other_experience: Chess journalist, author of four chess books, chess organiser. My chess books at Amazon:
best_skills: As, formerly, a professional player for many years, I know what serious, professional chess is about.
teaching_methodology: Chess improvement is about making your weakest areas stronger. My usual training method is, most normally, looking at the student's games first, and then it becomes clear which aspects of his/her play deserve to be improved ASAP. When the main problem is solved, then another problem takes its place, and so on. Being people, players are all very different, so my approach is individual. It's partly based on my experience as a student in the "Botvinnik School" in the USSR of the 1980s.

best_skills: One of my strongest skills is communication. Prior to working in the chess industry, I was a journalist and writer - two passions I still maintain with regular contributions to chess journals. Communication between student and coach is critical and can make the difference between improvement and stagnation in your chess game. As every teacher knows, the ability to relate the material to your student is paramount.
teaching_methodology: "No fantasy, however rich, no technique, however masterly, no penetration into the psychology of the opponent, however deep, can make a chess game a work of art, if these qualities do not lead to the main goal - the search for truth." -Vasily Smyslov

name: CM David Balogh
headline: 'Hopelessly scrolling down the coach page list in order trying to find the best coach for me... Oh wait, it's just happened!' - You
about: I am David Balogh from Kisujszallas, Hungary, born in 1993. I learned how to play chess at the age of 9 and since then I am a fanatic chess player. Due to the lack of my own family's interest and the lack of professional guidance it took me unnecessarily long to make progress. Still, my passionate spirit kept me going forward, and by the age of 15 I got my first Fide Master scalp over the board. My play at that time was not based on clear basics. Soon after struggling I realized that I did not understand why to do this and that. I lost some games without knowing the reason and was unable to find my own mistakes. I felt really disgusted by my own play so this painful experience led me to hire a coach. I learnt the basics, new ideas! In 2012 I won the V. Puspokladany Open. In mid 2017 I entered into the group of 2200s and I officially become a FIDE Candidate Master after competing in Budapest Spring Festival. My best result comes from the 7th Tittel Pal Memorial in 2018 July, where I finished 1st place with the rating performance: 2394! I am hard on myself and this helps me to make progress. My next goal is to become Fide Master. Fide card:
playing_experience: -Winner of the 5th Puspokladany Open (2012) - An early big achievement!
teaching_experience: Several years of experience in coaching! Pupils have all improved their performance with me! Trend continues!
best_skills: I am an active player with huge experience behind. As a coach, I use these to guide you through the struggle - what works for me will definitely work for you too! I prefer unusal and original ideas which are based on sound positional grounds, so I give not only unique, but also correct insights! I'm not a fan of peaceful draws, so I show you how to play on! My lessons are not only useful, but definitely fun!
teaching_methodology: As long as you love playing chess and you really want to be better at it, then no matter who you are, how old you are and what level you currently are: we will achieve your goals together! As a coach, I want to share my experience with you and to help those of you who have the same issue like me struggling to get better at chess. I can help mainly players from beginner to U2200 FIDE rating level. Just a brief list of what I can offer you:

teaching_methodology: In my view hard work is the only way to become good at chess. Therefore I see my role in guiding your way, providing material if needed and give strategies on how to tackle your difficulties. Obviously I help you in explaining positions and give you explanations when you need them :)

I finished 2nd in the 2019 Oceania Zonal with 6.5/9, and qualified to play in the 2019 World Cup (as a replacement for the Zonal winner). I was eliminated in the 1st round by GM Liren Ding.
teaching_experience: I am a certified FIDE Trainer (2016) and have captained the PNG Olympiad Team (2016). I have been teaching chess since 1983 with some of my students going on to become national champions in Australia, as well as representing Australia in international events.

name: FM Adarsh Tripathi
headline: None
about: Hello there! I'm Adarsh Tripathi, and I'm thrilled to share a bit about my chess journey with you. Chess has been a significant part of my life for over a decade now, I'm a FIDE Master with a peak FIDE Rating of 2361 with 1 International Master norm, which is a milestone I'm pretty proud of. Beyond playing, I've also found my true passion in coaching.
playing_experience: I am a FIDE Master with a FIDE rating of 2357 and a Lichess rating exceeding 2700. My chess career is marked by several achievements and memorable games, but my favorites include a closely contested draw against Super Grandmaster Vladimir Fedoseev in a classical event (where I had a whopping advantage of +7 up until the end, talk about regrets!) and a victory over a 2400-rated FIDE player, despite a material disadvantage of an entire knight straight out of the opening, with no compensation at all. I am a recipient of a Commonwealth Medal and have secured multiple State Championship titles. My playing style is diverse, with experience in a wide range of openings, from the aggressive Dragon to the more strategic London.
teaching_experience: I am a passionate chess coach with students of all ages and levels from all over the world. I am currently a coach at the Magnus Carlsen Academy, the official and only academy of the World Champion and World #1 Chess Player Magnus Carlsen. I take great pride in helping students achieve their goals and seeing them progress on their chess journey.
other_experience: I have authored several articles and developed curriculum to help students improve their chess skills. My most recent work is a Chessable course, World Class: Ding Liren, which received critical acclaim. I am excited to announce that Chessable and I will be collaborating on a new strategy course in the future (more details to come!).
best_skills: I tailor my chess teaching to fit each student's needs, considering their age and the time they have for chess. I believe learning from mistakes is key, so I guide students to figure out errors on their own, helping them remember and understand better.
teaching_methodology: My coaching methodology is focused on building a strong foundation in the basic principles of chess, including opening strategy, endgame technique, and tactics. I also believe in creating a positive and supportive learning environment for all of my students.

Mis inicios en el ajedrez fue por mera casualidad pero cuando lo empece a jugar me encanto y hasta podr√≠a decir que siento un gran amor hacia el. He trabajado muy duro para estar donde estoy y seguir√© trabajando para llegar mas lejos. Soy un gran partidario de que no se necesita un talento nato para llegar lejos en este deporte, ya que todo se basa en la forma e intensidad con la que ejercites tus habilidades ajedrecisticas. Si desea conocer mas de mi comun√≠quese a mi correo: michellopezabreu@gmail.com o a mi watsapp:+584129353635, yo responder√© amablemente cualquier pregunto o duda que tenga.
playing_experience: He participado en diversos torneos a lo largo de mi carrera ajedrecistica, obteniendo buenos resultados contra Maestros internacionales, maestros Fide, Candidatos a Maestros y Maestros nacionales tanto de mi pa√≠s como extranjeros . Sinceramente me costo mucho trabajo llegar a donde estoy y se que con trabajo duro y esfuerzo se puede hacer grandes cosas. En el a√±o 2016 logre colocarme en el podio del Festival centroamericano y del caribe 2016, logrando el tercer lugar (empatado entre el segundo y tercero) y as√≠ obtuve mi titulo de Maestro Fide, actualmente logr√© ganar campeonato panamericano Fisu am√©rica 2021 obteniendo el primer lugar y luego logr√© obtener el lugar de subcampe√≥n en el Festival de ajedrez Sim√≥n Bol√≠var 2022, d√≥nde estuvieron la selecci√≥n ol√≠mpica de mi pa√≠s (Venezuela).
teaching_experience: Llevo 6 a√±os ofreciendo mis servicios de entrenador en lichess a diversos ajedrecistas de distintos pa√≠ses con resultados satisfactorios. Pienso que lo mejor de ser entrenador es ver el avance de tus alumnos, adem√°s es reconfortante tener una buena relaci√≥n alumnos-maestro. He tenido alumnos muy prometedores que hoy en d√≠a ya son jugadores bastante fuertes e incluso son entrenadores por la buena metodolog√≠a con la que hemos trabajado. Tambi√©n cabe a destacar que soy entrenador en distintas academias internacionales de ajedrez.
other_experience: He sido alumno de diversos Maestros los cuales me ayudaron mucho durante mi progreso entre ellos est√°n: IM (Maestro Internacional) Jose Manuel Alvarez (Cuba), IM (Maestro Internacional) Leordis Quesada (Cuba) y IM (Maestro Internacional) Anibal Gamboa (Venezuela) los cuales me ayudaron mucho en mi desarrollo ajedrecistico. Al juntar todo lo que aprend√≠ con esos Maestros pude entender mucho de este hermoso deporte y me proporcionaron cierto nivel de metodolog√≠a para poder entrenar solo tranquilamente.
best_skills: Podr√≠a decir que mi fuerte en ajedrez y lo que mas me gusta de el es el juego posicional, el medio juego y los finales, los cuales me encanta ense√±ar ya que son partes del ajedrez que he estudiado  por varios a√±os.
teaching_methodology: Evaluare las fortalezas y debilidades del alumno mediante las partidas que ha jugado, al identificar dichos aspectos proceder√© a organizar un sistema de entrenamiento basado en sus debilidades, fortalezas, repertorio de aperturas (en caso que no tenga un repertorio de aperturas se asignara un repertorio basado en los gustos del alumno). Trabajaremos aspectos te√≥ricos, posicionales y t√°cticos de manera continua para fortalecer la visi√≥n del alumno. Revisaremos diversos tipos de partidas para enriquecer el conocimiento de aperturas y el calculo exacto de variante lo que ayudara a que el alumno vea lineas mas complejas y largas sin esforzarse tanto; ademas de que luego de cada sesi√≥n de entrenamiento le enviare un documento con todo lo visto en clase, esto sirve para fijar el conocimiento y poder repasar cualquier aspecto de la clase en cualquier momento sin perder la continuidad.

teaching_experience: Vasta experiencia como entrenador.Posee 23 a√±os de experiencia laboral con grandes resultados.Soy FIDE Trainer , Licenciado en Deportes y Educaci√≥n F√≠sica y Maestro Internacional de Ajedrez. Comenz√≥ a trabajar como entrenador en el curso 2002-2003 en la Escuela de Iniciaci√≥n Deportiva Cerro Pelado de Camag√ºey. En el curso 2003-2004 lo trasladan a la Academia Provincial de Ajedrez entrenando a los atletas de alto rendimiento y sus atletas participan en los Juegos Escolares Nacionales de Alto Rendimiento alcanzando el tercer lugar nacional general por provincias y una de sus atletas obtuvo medalla en la categor√≠a 13- 14 a√±os. A mediado del curso 2004-2005 comienza a trabajar en la Escuela Comunitaria Deportiva Centro pasando a la Escuela de Iniciaci√≥n Deportiva Cerro Pelado de Camag√ºey como prestaci√≥n de servicio. En el 2007 por sus resultados nacionales viaja a La Rep√∫blica de Venezuela, Estado Cojedes para trabajar con el equipo de este pa√≠s.  En el 2008 su atleta venezolano Jos√© Lu√≠s Castro obtiene medalla de plata en el Nacional Cadete y logra su clasificaci√≥n para el Panamericano de Argentina 2008. En el 2009 Jos√© Luis Castro logro medalla de oro en los Juegos  Nacionales de Cadete y logra nuevamente clasificar para los Juegos Panamericanos. El atleta Juan Moreno logra medalla de bronce en la categor√≠a sub-12  logrando su clasificaci√≥n para los Centroamericanos de este deporte en la Ciudad de Panam√° donde obtuvo el tercer lugar. A su  atleta Jos√© Luis Castro por sus resultados lo  invitan  al Centroamericano en M√©xico donde obtiene el primer lugar empatado. En Noviembre del 2009 regresa a Cuba y contin√∫a su trabajo  en la Escuela  Deportiva Cerro Pelado de Camag√ºey, con buenos resultados. En el 2011   participa en los Juegos Escolares Nacionales de Alto Rendimiento 12-14 a√±os alcanzando primer lugar Nacional por provincia con su equipo  y la medalla individual masculina del primer tablero Dexter  Docampo y la medalla de plata femenina en el primer tablero de Laura Zayas, por todos estos resultados es seleccionado mejor entrenador de los Juegos Escolares Nacionales de Alto Rendimiento 12-14 a√±os del  a√±o 2011.En el 2012   participa en los Juegos Escolares Nacionales de Alto Rendimiento 12-14 a√±os volviendo a alcanzar el  primer lugar Nacional por provincia y la medalla individual de oro con la atleta femenina Laura Zayas. En el 2013 obtiene 2 lugar nacional por provincias en el juvenil y las medallas de oro individuales de Laura Zayas y Carlos Daniel Albornoz .En los Juegos Escolares Nacionales obtiene 4 lugar por provincias y medallas de oro individual de Carlos Daniel Albornoz , Jorge El√≠as y medalla de plata del atleta Dexter Docampo.En el 2014 la atleta Laura Zayas obtiene medalla de oro en el campeonato nacional juvenil y su provincia segundo lugar adem√°s que entrena a la MI Tania Miranda que obtiene su clasificaci√≥n a la Final del Campeonato de Cuba. En el a√±o 2015 la atleta juvenil Laura Zayas obtiene nuevamente medalla de oro en el Campeonato Nacional Juvenil y el atleta Jorge Le√≥n obtiene su primera norma de Maestro Internacional en el Capablanca in Memoriam. En el 2016 trabaja con el atleta Carlos Daniel Albornoz el cual logra su t√≠tulo de Maestro Internacional y m√°s adelante ya de Gran maestro y Campe√≥n nacional de Cuba. Del 2017 hasta el momento trabaja  en Cabo Verde ,Isla de Sal,  donde es  entrenador de la selecci√≥n nacional de ajedrez de Cabo Verde .Adem√°s continua entrenando online a varios GM,MI ,MF y jugadores j√≥venes de todos los continentes.

teaching_methodology: I start by analyzing the past games of my students to identify their immediate weaknesses. Then I help them understand the core principles governing the game starting from the opening all the way to the endgame. Once they have grasped the essentials, we move on to the methodology and psychology of calculation.

name: GM Frode Urkedal
headline: Chess is my greatest passion. It's such a simple game, yet so deep and difficult. Easy to learn, impossible to master, there is always room for improvement.
about: Hi, I am a grandmaster from Norway, born in 1993. I have played chess since I was  7 years old and hands down, it's the best game I have ever played. I am a quite tactical player  I love initiative and attacking(who doesn't ?). The later years I  have gotten a bit more positional, torturing your opponents in a position with an everlasting advantage is fun too(sadistic indeed). I am also a huge opening nerd and have many new ideas to bring to the table. It's important that my openings are objectively sound, and I will try to crush any opening that I deem not (like KID, Benko, Benoni, Dutch, Philidor, Modern defence and so on).
playing_experience: I started to play chess at my school when I was 7. According to my chess teacher I was not the best at the beginning, but  when I was like 9 I started playing tournaments. I remember playing chess with myself on a magnetic chessboard quite a bit so I think I was a bit obsessed :). At the age of 10,11,12,13, I won the Norwegian championships miniputt(u11) lilleputt(u13), kadett(u 16) and junior(u20) and have played in the Elite group since then.
teaching_experience: I have experience teaching players of all ages. I have thaught at schools, for my club, other clubs, the chess federation and chess coaching companies like Wallace Chess. I have been a coach for European and world youth championship many times. Right now I am one of the coaches for Flere Mot Sjakk Toppen(the youth national team), and also a mentor for some of the players.
best_skills: I am a strong tactical player with a lot of knowledge I am willing to share. I don't like to hide my opening secrets, I like to share so we all can get closer to chess enlightenment. I will break down how I think into easy digestable parts depending on your playing strength.
teaching_methodology: In my private sessions I will usually look through the students games before the first lesson to get a picture of strength and weaknesses. I will also ask what the student wants to learn, goals and visions. what they think are their weaknesses. Getting better at chess is not a quick fix it takes time and effort. Perhaps the easiest way to get better at chess is to play a lot and analyze your games. So unless you are a very strong player already (and even then) you should do this. I will help the student giving my perspective and guide them into making better desicions on the chessboard. I also prepare positions from games, often my own or prepare openings  and more.

name: CM Jonathan Arnott
headline: None
about: Everyone's unique. People learn in different ways. The art of teaching, or coaching, is working out the key to helping a particular student to improve.
playing_experience: I'm a Candidate Master, former England Under-21 squad and captain of Yorkshire. I've represented White Rose in the European Club Cup. I captained the Chessable White Rose side in the inaugural online 4NCL, which won the top division. I was the English Under-16 Squad champion in 1996/1997...
teaching_experience: Some of my former students have gone from absolute beginner to representing their County, or playing for England age-group teams. Then there's also frustration: when you see someone break the 2000 barrier at a young age, knowing that they could go on to become an IM or GM and they stop playing to focus on a career.
other_experience: Too many to mention! I went to university at the age of 15 (scary, but fun).
best_skills: Teaching is just natural to me. I learned to teach when I was about 6. My old Maths teacher used to ask me to help others in my class when I'd finished my work. I worked fast, and then I'd explain to my friends the things they didn't understand. It was great - I learned what worked and what didn't. I learned how to relate to people.
teaching_methodology: I don't have "a system" that I'm going to expect every student to follow to the letter. I need to develop a feel for the pattern of mistakes that you make. Where are the gaps in your knowledge? What do we need to do to help you improve? Do we need to focus on opening, middlegame or ending? Is it tactical or positional play? Do you need to be more analytical? Do we need to help you develop your instincts?

name: WIM Srishti Pandey
headline: None
about: Hello, my name is WIM Srishti Pandey, and I have been playing chess for over 9 years. Chess has taught me valuable lessons, and I would love to share them with you.
playing_experience: As the National U19 Champion in 2019, I have participated in various international tournaments in countries such as Spain, Hungary, Armenia, Iceland, Germany, Serbia, Portugal, Italy, and France. In 2021, I achieved a notable milestone by beating legendary Grandmaster Alex Yermolinsky with the black pieces. Additionally, I completed my WIM title in 2022.
teaching_experience: For the past 5 years, I have been coaching people of various ages, and I have developed an effective and systematic training program that helps my students improve in all phases of the game. I am available for both individual and group sessions.
other_experience: Throughout my years of playing chess, I have had the opportunity to work with many strong GMs, such as GM Swapnil Dhopade, GM Debashis Das, GM Kristian Szabo, GM Swayams Mishra, GM Mchedlishvili, Mikheil, and GM Tornike Sanikidze. This experience has helped me develop a deep understanding of subtle nuances in the game.
best_skills: Some of my most vital skills include attacking and dynamic play, endgames, and a simple and effective opening repertoire for both colors. I believe in forming long-term friendly relations with my students and organizing online tournaments to foster growth and competition.
teaching_methodology: In terms of my teaching methodology, I tailor my lessons according to the needs of my students. I follow a structured approach that includes deep analysis of games, studying the most important classical games, studying a customized opening repertoire for both colors, and working on important skills such as visualization, candidate moves, and intermediate moves.

name: IM Vishal Sareen
headline: Chess training for me is unlocking a student's potential to maximise their growth. It is helping them to learn rather than teaching them!
about: Hello, it's a pleasure to indtroduce myself. I am IM Vishal Sareen from New Delhi, India. Been a professional chess trainer for almost 17 years now. From training the young and hopeful to improve their skills to working with several Grandmasters, I have done that all!. Trainer of several Indian teams including the Indian women team for two years, trainer of last three Arjuna Awardees (second highest sporting honour) in Chess in India. Personal trainer of GM Abhijeet Gupta for over 15 years, I also hold the highest Coach title - FIDE Senior Trainer (FST) awarded by the apex chess body - FIDE.
playing_experience: A formner India Under-15 champion, I first represented the country in World cadets Championship of 1986. Represented India on several occasions thereafter as part of different teams in several opens across the world as well as many Commonwealth Championships. PLayed in Asian Continental too. Made several IM norms before finally taking the International Master title in 2004. Although not a serious player anymore, I played in a closed IM event in New Zealand a couple of years back and finished second even though it was competitive chess after a long hiatus! My best wins: have beaten many Grandmasters since my younger days... my first GM victory was against Matthew Sadler of England in 1994 Lloyds Bank Masters in London. Since then till I took semi retirement, there are many victories against GM opposition. All that can be found in the Mega Database!
teaching_experience: I felt the need for Chess training in India and decided to embark on this unchartered territory to become the first professional chess coach of India way back in 2004-05. My first set of students included Parimarjan Negi, Abhijeet Gupta, Tania Sachdev and Sahaj Grover. All these four became celebrated chess players of the country as Negi, Gupta and Grover went on to become Grandmasters under my training while Tania became one of the most successful women chess player winning the AsianContinental, Olympiad medal and ofcourse the Indian national championship. Both Negi and Gupta also became Indian national champions subsequently and these two gave me my proudest moment as coach in 2008: Gupta won the gold and Negi the silver in what was an unparrelled performance.
other_experience: I am a writer on chess for over 20 years now and have written extensive articles for Indian news agencies, many magazines and also several news papers. I have been a chess commentator for India's National TV network - Doordarshan for over 20 years. Currently working on a Chess Syllabus for the masses which will be distributed free of cost in downloadable format.
best_skills: 1. Since I work with several strong players, deep opening preparation is always important. Analysis right from an early stage is the key.
teaching_methodology: I am pretty active on all basic channels - Zoom, Skype, Whatsapp so that communication with students is not a problem. Try to fill them up with enough homework post our lessons.
