There are numerous things to be learned by avid investigators of mysteries of chess, I look forward to sharing every single thing I know with you!

name: IM Dragos Ceres
headline: None
about: I am Dragos Ceres, 19 years old, professional chess player, born in Chisinau, Republic of Moldova.
playing_experience: I started playing chess since I was 7 years old, won my first National Youth Championship U8 a year later in 2012.
teaching_experience: The teaching experience I have is still at an early stage as I started roughly 5 months ago, but I enjoy it a lot and my students are satisfied with the work we do together, as they are learning new and instructive things.
best_skills: To boost your skills in chess, I believe one of the most important thing is learning how to correctly make decisions, as during the all 3 parts of the game this is the deciding factor, that's why I focus a lot on the positional understanding and endgame knowledge, as I consider it the key to making a decision; of course, also calculation and dynamical understanding is important, and I also focus on that aspect of the game.
teaching_methodology: My teaching methodology really depends on the student, as I am comfortable with teaching any part of the game (opening theory, middlegame strategies, endgame knowledge), so my first lesson is usually getting to know the player and the student and understanding which part of the game he wants to improve, and for the next 3-5 lessons I focus mainly on that, and after it, we usually continue with other aspects. During a lesson, I will always explain what is happening on the board in a simple way, and try to show my student the way I am thinking and how I am making a decision. Also, during the strategies lessons, I use a lot of instructive books, f.e. the books of J. Aagaard or M.Dvoretsky, as they are the ones that made me improve 3-4 years ago.

name: FM Giorgio Belli
headline: None
about: Ho 23 anni, sono Maestro Fide e studio psicologia all'universit√† e sono molto interessato anche al lato psicologico del gioco che secondo me non √® meno importante del lato tecnico degli scacchi. Mandatemi pure un messaggio privato se siete interessati ad eventuali dettagli o dubbi.
playing_experience: Gioco da quando ho 12 anni e da quando ne ho 17 sono Maestro Fide, ho fatto molti tornei internazionali in Italia e in Europa e ho partecipato agli Europei Under 16 nel 2015. Ho fatto buoni risultati con diversi GM ed IM, continuo a studiare per raggiungere risultati sempre pi√π importanti. Nel 2016 sono diventato campione interprovinciale di Udine e Pordenone e nel 2022 la squadra di cui sono capitano ha raggiunto per la prima volta la A1, mentre nel 2017 ho vinto i tornei magistrali di Palmanova davanti a diversi GM e di Caldaro davanti a diversi FM. Ho vinto molti tornei blitz e rapid.
teaching_experience: Da 2-3 anni insegno privatamente sia a bambini che a ragazzi che ad adulti con buonissimi risultati sia dal punto di vista di gioco e risultati che dal punto di vista umano. Infatti punto molto ad avere un ottimo rapporto con l'allievo per avere uno scambio alla pari che favorisce la partecipazione e l'impegno dello studente. Nel 2018 sono stato coach e delegato regionale del Friuli Venezia Giulia, occasione in cui un ragazzo ha vinto il titolo di campione italiano di categoria, unica volta nella storia del Friuli. Per le lezioni online uso sia Zoom che Skype che Team, a preferenza dello studente
best_skills: Mi piacciono molto la tattica, gli attacchi sul re e le partite aperte e ne ho giocate diverse molto belle e con mosse spettacolari, ma col tempo ho imparato a gestire bene anche le posizioni chiuse e molto lente. Il mio punto forte √® il mediogioco in cui unisco conoscenza teorica di molte partite e posizioni ad intuito e calcolo. Col bianco ho un ottimo repertorio mentre col nero ho diverse opzioni per essere flessibile. Sono molto paziente e non ho problemi a spiegare le cose diverse volte o ad accettare critiche o consigli dagli studenti.
teaching_methodology: Come prima lezione sarebbe opportuno fare un incontro in cui si analizzano le partite recenti fatte dallo studente oppure per giocare con conseguente analisi e da l√¨ provare a capire quali sono le lacune e preparare un piano personalizzato a seconda dello studente. In alternativa sono disponibile per ogni tipo di richiesta specifica (apertura, finali, tattica, gioco posizionale). Insegno volentieri anche ai principianti concentrandomi sui principi del gioco piuttosto che sulla memorizzazione delle mosse.

name: IM Sammed Shete
headline: None
about: Hello Guys,
playing_experience: My Best Win is against GM Aram Hakobyan in the 2022 Dubai Open.
teaching_experience: I have been training students for the past 7 years from different countries and different age groups. It all comes down to middlegame skills, tactical ability, and calculation in the end. Almost all of my students have shown substantial growth in these areas. My current students are rated around 1200 to 2100.
best_skills: I will focus more on teaching middle-game and end-game techniques and calculation. First, we will analyze your games and then understand what kind of mistakes you are making. We will move forward by improving on those weaknesses with puzzles, game analysis books, or some other material. The best part about me is that I will be easily able to sense your mistakes in most of the positions because of my vast playing experience, and I always go for different kinds of positions.
teaching_methodology: Anyone can improve quickly, given the right lessons. I offer personalized chess lessons. I see the games of the student, and I study his style, mistakes, and weaknesses. After that, I build a program to work to solve these problems and improve his skills.

Thenafter, I jointly make a teaching plan together with each of my students with the aim to correct these weaknesses. By problem solving I evaluate if my student has accepted the given instructions. Finally we proceed to the basic plans and ideas in the future openings that will be implemented by my students.

name: FM Kevin Bachler
headline: None
about: I am Kevin Bachler, 45-year chess coach for both adults and youth.  I am located near Chicago, IL in the United States. I have run some of the major chess camps in the U.S., including OleChess and the Caveman Chess Camp.  I have coached many individuals and teams to state and national championships.
playing_experience: Frankly, I've had less time to play the past few years while focusing more on my primary career and coaching. I've won many smaller, local events.  In terms of large regional or national events:
teaching_experience: I have been coaching since the mid-1970s. I have coached teams to over 10 state titles, three national titles. My teams have at times won 22 tournaments in a row, or had seasons with results of 27-1 in matches.  I have had students participate in the U.S. Junior Championship.  I have run several of the major chess camps in the U.S.
best_skills: My goal with young students is to assist them in successfully mastering fundamentals of positional play and tactics, such that if they wish to move to higher levels I will eventually replace my position with that of a GM instructor.  GMs have valued my teaching because I stress these fundamentals.
teaching_methodology: I focus strongly on classical games and positions to illustrate concepts.  For younger students, appropriate analogies are important - placing a concept in a context they can understand.

name: IM Eddy Ravelo
headline: None
about: Ante todo les doy la bienvenida a mi perfil, mi nombre es Eddy Ravelo Gil, tengo 48 a√±os, soy cubano, vivo actualmente en San Diego, Venezuela, soy  Maestro Internacional, elo actual 2406.  Me dedico a tiempo completo a dar clases de Ajedrez .
playing_experience: Campeon nacional de mi pais en categorias menores y juveniles, primer lugar en un torneo internacional del ISLA en Cuba con la presencia de varios Grandes Maestros y Maestros Internacionales, 3er lugar en otro torneo internacional del ISLA en Cuba, participacion en otros torneos nacionales e internacionales en Cuba como el Capablanca, derrotando a varios Grandes Maestros y Maestros Internacionales en alguno de ellos y en Venezuela he ganado varios Torneos Nacionales e Internacionales donde he ganado a fuertes jugadores y he entablado con fuertes jugadores como el GM Lazaron Bruzon, GM Bartlomiej Macieja, GM Eduardo Iturrizaga, GM Vasily Papin entre otros.
teaching_experience: Tengo mas de 15 a√±os dedicados al entrenamiento profesional de Ajedrez que comparto a la vez con mi pasion de jugador,  en Cuba fui entrenador de la academia provincial de La Habana donde entrenaba a los talentos de la capital de mi pais, fui durante esos a√±os el entrenador principal  a los Campeonatos Nacionales Escolares y Juveniles de los equipos y  jugadores que representaban a la capital de mi pais, muchos de esos alumnos ya son Maestros Internacionales y Maestros Fide, en Venezuela llevo ya mas de ocho a√±os haciendo un trabajo similar en el estado Zulia entrenando a los equipos menores y de primera categoria ganando medallas de oro tanto por equipo como individual.
other_experience: Colaboracion con el Informador Ajedrecistico, trabajando junto a mi amigo y GM Julio Becerra, he pasado cursos de superacion de Arbitro de Ajedrez y cursos de psicologia deportiva .
best_skills: Desarrollar las habilidades estrategicas y tacticas de mis alumnos desde la apertura al final.
teaching_methodology: Lo primero y esencial es hacer un estudio del alumno para saber sus cualidades y debilidades, ya que cada uno tiene necesidades diferentes y en base a ese estudio preparar el plan de entrenamiento a seguir para mejorar lo mas rapido posible.

name: WIM Silvia Raluca Sgircea
headline: Hi, I'm Raluca and have been teaching for about 15 years, working with both kids and adults. I am available for both live classes and game analysis.
about: I am Women International from Romania, FIDE Trainer and active player. I have played my first official tournament at the age of 6 and have continued to play ever since.
playing_experience: I learned chess from my father when I was 3 years old and played my first official tournament when I was 6. I still try to play as many tournaments as I can, mostly in Europe. I have one Woman Grandmaster norm and the highest rating I have reached is 2302.
teaching_experience: I have been teaching for over 15 years, both online and in person. I work with players of all ages and my lessons are customized, depending on the student's strength and needs. I will go over your games and understand which parts of your game you need to work on and will include this in our trainings.
other_experience: In 2017 I did commentary in Spanish together with IM David Martinez of the Individual Spanish Championship.
best_skills: Openings with white: 1.d4 structures, the Maroczy
teaching_methodology: My lessons vary depending on the student's strength and needs. I usually go through their games in order to identify the most common mistakes they make and then decide on a suitable teaching plan for each of them. I use examples from famous games of strong players, classical games, but also interesting positions from my own games.

teaching_experience: ‚Ä¢ Entrenador de destacados jugadores de diversas edades, como por ejemplo el joven prodigio argentino Faustino Oro
other_experience: ‚Ä¢ √Årbitro de categor√≠a FIDE (AF) licenciado por la Federaci√≥n Internacional de Ajedrez (FIDE).
best_skills: Todo el aprendizaje que adquir√≠ en el ajedrez y en carreras universitarias, en especial los conocimientos interdisciplinares desarrollados como posgraduado en docencia en la ense√±anza superior, sumado a mi experiencia como jugador y profesor de ajedrez e idiomas, me permiti√≥ comprender, reconocer errores y saber corregirlos, desarrollando diversas t√©cnicas y habilidades para el estudio, entrenamiento y ense√±anza de forma eficaz.
teaching_methodology: La metodolog√≠a que utilizo se basa principalmente en identificar los motivos que provocan nuestros errores sistem√°ticos, ya que el ajedrez es un juego de toma de decisiones. Por eso, considero que lo m√°s importante para mejorar constantemente es mediante el an√°lisis de las propias partidas para identificar los errores cometidos, pero para corregirlos es fundamental entender la raz√≥n del error, el proceso de pensamiento que provoca los errores cr√≥nicos. De esa forma, ayudo al alumno a mejorar su proceso decisorio y comprender los motivos que provocan las decisiones equivocadas en el transcurso de la partida ya que, generalmente, estamos seguros de nosotros mismos cuando nos equivocamos, por eso es m√°s probable que un observador ajeno con experiencia en el proceso de ense√±anza y aprendizaje detecte nuestros errores sistem√°ticos. Nos concentramos demasiado en lo que conocemos e ignoramos lo que no conocemos, lo cual nos hace confiar demasiado en nuestras creencias ajedrec√≠sticas.

about: My name is Vuk Savanovic, I am a 2303 Fide ELO rated chess player and a professional chess coach. I work and live in Novi Sad, Serbia.
playing_experience: I've been playing chess since I was 4 years old. During that time I was a Serbian junior champion 3 times, ranked top 10 in Junior European Championship twice, won dozens of Rapid and Blitz tournaments.
teaching_experience: In my time as a chess coach I was truly fortunate to work with lots of people. The most important thing that allowed me to improve as a coach is the fact that I worked with students from the age of 8 to over 60. Also, just as important was that many of them were complete beginners, and some of them had a rating of over 2100. This fact forced me to learn how to work with players of different levels and ambitions.
other_experience: Held 3 chess camps for kids, and a number of online group lessons.
best_skills: Since I was a kid to this day, my style of playing chess was always very simple: I believe in playing main lines, and I like to play sharp positions. Of course, with years comes maturity, and a realization that if you want to be a good player, you must be ready to play every type of a position.
teaching_methodology: I truly believe that the single most important factor which decides a quality of a lesson is the time a coach invests in preparing it. All I can guarantee for my student is that it will be very difficult for them to find someone as dedicated and hard working as I am.

name: FM Benjamin Falcon
headline: None
about: Mi nombre es Benjam√≠n Falc√≥n, nac√≠ en la ciudad de Rosario en Argentina y actualmente tengo 21 a√±os. Soy Maestro FIDE y mi Elo Fide es de 2270 (m√°ximo 2341).
playing_experience: Llevo mas de 15 a√±os jugando al ajedrez y tengo vasta experiencia. Fui 3 veces campe√≥n argentino juvenil y medallista de panamericanos y sudamericanos. Tuve participaci√≥n en 4 Mundiales (Grecia 2010, Brasil 2011, Eslovenia 2012 y Uruguay 2017), 5 Sudamericanos (2013 Bolivia, 2014 Uruguay, 2015 Bolivia, 2016 Chile y 2019 Argentina) y 3 Panamericanos (Brasil 2010, Per√∫ 2012 y Uruguay 2016).
teaching_experience: Brindo clases particulares y grupales desde el a√±o 2019 a alumnos de todas las edades, teniendo grandes satisfacciones con sus progresos. Mis clases son muy interactivas y disfruto darlas.
other_experience: Tuve el gran agrado de brindarle clases particulares  a Sergio "Kun" Aguero
teaching_methodology: Mis clases son muy interactivas, trabajando en relaci√≥n al alumno y a las fallas o puntos d√©biles que considere que el mismo tenga, abarcando todas las fases del juego (apertura, mediojuego, final). Trabajar sobre nuestros puntos d√©biles y errores mas comunes es fundamental para dar los verdaderos avances. Considero muy importante el trabajo posicional del ajedrez, y en esto es fundamental el entendimiento de las distintas estructuras de peones. As√≠ mismo, es crucial tener un repertorio bien trabajado, y que el mismo se adapte a nuestro estilo de juego. Este trabajo de repertorio, no solo debe limitarse a las movidas iniciales "mecanizadas", sino que debe entenderse el esp√≠ritu de sus distintas la estructuras, los planes de mediojuego y los finales t√≠picos que derivan del mismo. Por otra parte, tambi√©n gusto de tratar la parte psicol√≥gica que tiene este deporte, que considero muy importante, sobre todo en situaci√≥n de torneos.

name: GM Cyril Marcelin
headline: None
about: 44 years old, GM from France living in the austrian mountains. I was in the past a full-time pro (check your database :)) but becoming father several years ago, I decided to play less and to teach more.
playing_experience: None
teaching_experience: I started to teach chess 25 years ago! At that time, I was working on a weekly basis for a club and had also private students. Since I left France several years ago, I teach almost exclusively online.
best_skills: I have a lot of respect for chess and feel comfortable seeking for the truth in classical openings and endgames. As a trainer, I'm able to adapt to the needs of my students.
teaching_methodology: I always start by analysing seriously the games of my students. The goal is to find some recurrent mistakes and to work on it (very often, the simple fact to find them is enough to improve!). After that, I show some methods to work on chess alone (yes, without me!). The idea is simple: if you know what and how to study between our sessions, you will improve much faster. My goal is to be efficient  and I try to avoid to show some chess content that you can find and understand alone (I give homework in this case). Instead, we will focus on the right steps to follow to analyse your own games and build an opening repertoire according to various criterias (time available, abilities, style...). "En passant", we will also discuss how to take better practical decisions. Chess is really deep and to sum up, I try to be the coach that I didn't have!

name: IM Tor Fredrik Kaasen
headline: None
about: Hi! My name is Tor Fredrik Kaasen. I am 21 years old. Living in Oslo, Norway. Working as a chess coach for 4+ years. National coach of Norways Women team during the Chess Olympiad 2022 in India. I love playing chess and I am very competitive. I also love to share my knowledge with my students, and to see them make progress due to my work.
playing_experience: Started playing at the age of 9. I reached 2400+ at the age of 14, and after that I started working more seriously. I became the 3rd youngest IM in Norway ever (15)
teaching_experience: Been coaching young Norwegian talents last 3 years. One of them went from 1870 to 2188 after half a year working with me. I also made a player go from 1200 Fide to 1950 in one and half year.  Have been giving many group lessons for the club "Dragulf" in Norway, where there are many talented youngsters.
other_experience: I have made a course for Chessable called "Neutralize the Catalan"
best_skills: Strong in calculations and dynamics. Universal player, ready to play all types of positions. Very updated on the lastest opening theory, so I can surely help you in that field. Have been working with many GM coaches in my life, so i am familiar with different teaching methods.  I am always following my students very closely, watching their games and making suggestions what to do better/ to improve the way to think.
teaching_methodology: I always start with watching my students latest games. After looking through them I will have a good idea about what is good and what could be improved upon. I believe the basics needs to be learnt very well. So I will go through this very carefully until I am sure the students understand it well. By showing good examples, we will go through  the most important middlegame positions, which is essential to reach higher level in chess. I think for the younger players, the endgame should be paid special attention too, the basic endgames and to work on the technique is something I always teach. After this we start on more advanced strategy/concrete theory. I am also a huge believer in looking through the old classics. Bobby Fischer is my favorite player, so it is a must to know many of his games when working with me :)

name: IM Vaso Blesic
headline: After a bad opening, there is hope in the middle game. After a bad middle game, there is hope in the endgame. But in the endgame moment of truth has arrived.
about: I am international master from Serbia Vaso Blesic with current ELO 2396, max ELO was 2426. I am 35 years old man with pharmaceutical degree on Belgrade University.  I am also fide chess instructor, but I believe then I am better coach, then many chess FIDE trainers.
playing_experience: I have more then 30 years chess experience in chess competitions, I took first place in many tournaments because I am good fighter and I am good in chess psychology.  For example I took twice in row Amateur Belgrade championship, twice was first in Ada tournament (summer international chess tournament in Belgrade), Usce tournament, Summer open... I also played in many club championship in Serbia, and Bosna and Hercegovina. Last international master norm I took on Gibraltar open when I drew 2 games with Super  >2700 GMs (Nakamura was one of them)
teaching_experience: I started to work like teacher about 20 years ago, and I work more like sparing partner than teacher. I worked with many students around the globe. I worked with some players who won a medal on European youth chess championship. I worked with 10-20 players who won national championship in their age group.
other_experience: I speak English language. I understand Polish and Russian too, I can speak but I am not fluent in those 2 languages. I love to swim and play volleyball and basketball. Now I am learning Turkish too, maybe one day I will try to learn another language.
best_skills: I played almost all openings especially in my training games and know almost all type of positions, and I always try to improve my repertoire. When I am learning younger players I love to create sharper repertoire, and love to include some new variations from time to time.
teaching_methodology: For student it is the best to send me some of their games, I am preparing lessons from the books, chess base or from mine or my students practice. When I am teaching, I prefer using lichess studies with skype audio, but sometimes it can be on some other platform or only sharing my screen on skype, and analyzing with my students. If student want I can give him homework from varies topics (I think that this is the best), but it is optional.

I was second to Ante Brkic when he was third on World U12 championship (Oropesa del mar 2000.) I trained Jadranko Plenca who was one of the Croatian most talented players. Six years ago he was second on European championship U18 (Mamaia 2017.) I colaborated with grandmasters: Ivan Saric, Ante Brkic, Ognjen Cvitan, Sasa Martinovic...Many of my students were champions of Croatia in youth categories: Jadranko Plenca, Mario Muskardin, Zrinka Deur Saric, Borna Cotic, Mato Mican, Ivano Mocic... FM Nils Richter was German U18 champion (2021.), Matija Sakic was 4 time Swedish youth champion. I also had success as a coach of female players. I trained Kristina Saric, Zrinka Deur Saric, Ana Berke... My wife Kristina Saric was champion of Croatia (Zagreb 2017) under my guidance.
other_experience: My professional skills are exclusively related to chess.
best_skills: I am very good as a second/coach for the players between 2100-2300. My specialty is preparation for the game. First, I am looking for weaknesses of opponent player. Later I am trying to show my student how to take advantage of these weaknesses.
teaching_methodology: When I have new student: first, together we analize deeply his games in the last few years. After I discover his flaws/weaknesses, I am trying to fix it on the long run. I often use literature of the famous chess autors: Dvoretsky, Capablanca, Aagard, Delchev, Baburin, Yusupov... depend what is the theme of training (opening,middlegame, tactics...).

name: FM Zachary Dukic
headline: None
about: Hello everyone, and welcome to my coaching profile! My name is Zachary Dukic, I am a 25 year-old Canadian FIDE Master with one IM norm living in the nation's capital, Ottawa. I speak English and French fluently as well as Italian at a fairly proficient level. My two biggest passions in life are chess and teaching, and so it's only natural that I combine the two! My peak FIDE rating is 2275 and my peak CFC (Canadian rating) is 2423. Apart from teaching chess, I also enjoy playing soccer, biking, and of course, studying chess! I am constantly seeking to be the best possible chess player I can be, and it would be a privilege to pass this knowledge and passion on to you!
playing_experience: I have played in many tournaments throughout the years, but here are best ones that hold a special place in my memory:
teaching_experience: Apart from 7+ years of teaching chess both in classrooms and privately, I also have degrees in Second Language Teaching (BA) and Education (B.Ed) from the University of Ottawa. I am extremely passionate about teaching and I try to accommodate students to the best of my ability. I have taught students ranging from complete beginner to 2200 strength (CFC).
other_experience: As mentioned earlier, I have degrees in Second Language Teaching and Education. I specialize specifically in FSL (French as a Second Language) and have acquired extensive experience over the last 5 years instructing children and adults in French both privately and in classrooms. Additionally, for the past year I have been teaching a Saturday Italian Class for young second and third generation Italians in Ottawa seeking to communicate with their relatives. It has been a truly enriching experience, as I, too, am a third generation Italian who learned Italian in order to reopen the line of communication between my family in Canada and my relatives in Italy.
best_skills: I enjoy playing theoretical, tactical and attacking chess. My openings reflect this playing style, which include the Open Sicilian and the King's Indian Defense, both of which I have been playing for many years and played a big role in allowing me to score the aforementioned wins.
teaching_methodology: I teach students through Discord, Skype, Zoom, WeChat, while using Lichess studies in order to explore different concepts. Instead of analysing student games in their entirety, I will often pick and choose specific positions that arise in games that are relevant to the content discussed during lessons. I feel that this is important, as it is much easier for students to grasp their mistakes once they have a background about why it's a mistake, rather than saying "this is a mistake, that's a mistake, this here is a mistake, blah blah blah".

name: FM Amir Hadzovic
headline: I will help you to take your game to the next level! https://www.chess.com/article/view/coach-of-the-month-fm-amir-hadzovic
about: Hello, I am Amir Hadzovic, FIDE Master and Certified Chess Instructor from Sarajevo, Bosnia & Herzegovina.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess for the past 20 years. I am a winner of many national youth championships and open tournaments. I have also participated in several world and european youth championships.
teaching_experience: I became a Certified Chess Instructor in 2016, but I have been tutoring students of all levels and ages for 8 years (working one on one and working in two chess schools in my city). I am a very motivated tutor, who pays special attention on understanding the game of chess.
teaching_methodology: My main focus is on understanding the game (just learning opening lines is not enough, you have to know all the plans and understand the position you play). I think that is the most important part in becoming a good chess player. Also i like attacking chess and I try to teach my students how to think and play in that way.

teaching_methodology: The analysis of own games is a key element to achieve the objectives. Additionally I consider that the practice is as essential as learning and achieving a balance between both facets is extremely important, therefore part of the training consists of training games and their subsequent detailed analysis.

name: IM Alex Krstulovic
headline: None
about: I am Alex Krstulovic, a 20 year old International Master from Hungary, currently studying economics at the E√∂tv√∂s Lor√°nd University in Budapest. I'm looking for ambitious students that wish to improve their game.
playing_experience: I started playing chess when I was 5 years old and participated in my first Fide-rated tournament when I was 6.  I became Hungary's youngest title holder ever, by winning the U8 European Chess Championship, which awarded me the title of FIDE master. Since then, I won the National Youth Championships numerous times and I achieved the title of International Master when I was 16 years old, in 2020. In 2023  I became the U20 champion of Hungary and achieved my current peak rating of 2447.
teaching_experience: I've worked with and learned from many strong grandmasters, including 8 time Olympic team member and medalist GM Pinter Jozsef and GM Nikola Sedlak, who won gold on his board in the Tromso Olympiad in 2014 and authored numerous books. My aim is to utilize the knowledge and experiences I've gathered from them with my own students.
best_skills: My strongest points are openings and strategic understanding, but I believe that other areas are no less important. I specialize in 1.d4 openings with white (especially the London system and c4 Nf3 setups) and the Caro Kann with black, but I also have experiences with a wide variety of openings and positions.
teaching_methodology: I believe the first step should always be the analysis of the student's games and identifying typical mistakes and how to avoid them. A lot of times, this can be achieved by designing a repertoire that fits their playstyle. Learning typical middlegame positions and key concepts that arise from these openings can also have a large impact on the outcome of the games.

headline: None
about: Hi!

From surpassing friends to winning championships, I became a provincial and national youth champion for consecutive years. Notable achievements include a second-place finish in the Pan American U-20 Championship (2012) and 10th place in the World Youth Chess Championship (2011), earning the FIDE Master title at 15. With a peak FIDE rating of 2190, I now prioritize teaching to share my passion and knowledge.
teaching_experience: ‚úîÔ∏èChess coach since 2011
other_experience: ‚úîÔ∏èHuman Resources Manager at London Chess Academy Ltd since May 2022
best_skills: As your chess coach, I aim to tailor a personalized study plan, making learning enjoyable and engaging through fun, interactive lessons. Beyond that, as a dedicated enthusiast, I go the extra mile by sharing additional materials, organizing tournaments, and offering ongoing support outside of class. With my guidance, you'll elevate your chess game and reach your goals.
teaching_methodology: Discover the art of chess with my coaching, influenced by the wisdom of grandmasters like Smirnov, Nimzowitsch, Aagaard, Brunia, van Wijgerden, and de la Villa. I specialize in nurturing logical thinking skills, empowering students to analyze any position strategically and make optimal moves. Guiding personalized learning journeys, I stress the significance of thorough study and assimilation. My approach to openings is practical and dynamic, prioritizing the understanding of logic, plans, and ideas behind moves over theory. I also ensure a solid grasp of basic endgames and typical plans. Equip yourself with the tools to thrive in chess, both on and off the board, through my unique coaching style.

about: I am Luka Oboladze, an international master in chess. I live in Tbilisi, Georgia and I love communicating and teaching people from different parts of the world.

I have also played a lot of youth tournaments and reached many successes, like being in the top 10 of the world under 12 section, twice top 5 in european youth chess championships and 4 times champion of Georgia.
teaching_experience: I have 3 years teaching experience with players of every level and cultural background. After our studies all of them had significantly better results.
other_experience: I have commentated local chess events in Georgia and really enjoyed it.
best_skills: My style of playing chess is a mixture of dynamic and positional, because the main thing about becoming strong in chess is being good at all aspects of the game and not just one. I'm good at combinations but also pretty good at playing static positions with maneuvers.
teaching_methodology: Analyzing the games of the students, finding their strong and weak sides. Finding the opening repertoire which best fits his/her style. Analyzing games from the strongest grandmasters, classics. Working on endgames. Keeping track of newest novelties and trends used in recent tournaments and analyzing them. Having a friendly relationship with students.

best_skills: Deep understanding of being able to solidly join different stages of the game in harmony, the opening connection to the middle game and the middle game connection to the endgame. A step by step process through understanding different patterns and identifying weak points in your play.
teaching_methodology: I believe in practice makes perfect. Consistently exposing the brain to different patterns and positions and being able to come up with your own quality of thought in such positions. I aim for the classes to be both fun and interactive, studying materials and homework are always provided.

name: CM Robert Willmoth
headline: I changed career twelve years ago, to become a chess coach.  I am an English Chess Federation grade 4 accredited coach and a Fide trainer
about: I am a professional chess coach and Managing Director, running my own chess company www.chesscoachingservices.co.uk  .I have a team of coaches working in schools across a number of counties in England. I also run Barnet Knights junior chess club
playing_experience: I have been in playing for 40 years. I competed at the British championship from the age of 17 for the next 18 consecutive years. My best victories are against Grandmasters Glenn Flear, Pete Wells and Michael Adams.
teaching_experience: My team teach in over 50 schools. We have a set structure for daily lessons in schools. This has proved very successful since its inception in 2020.   The pupils i taught when i started are now approaching master level.  My first ever student within a short period of tie won the London U8 , U10 and British U8, U9 and U10 titles.   In addition to this i have had a number of different schools reach the National schools team finals including The Beacon, NBH, and Garden Suburb.
other_experience: I spent 21 years at Barclays Capital, leaving as a Vice President in 2010.
best_skills: My best skill in teaching is understanding very quickly a students needs and adapting the training around their abilities to bring out the fastest improvement
teaching_methodology: I have a set structure in all of my schools and individual lessons. I follow a step by step approach, using building blocks of chess knowledge to build on current skills and enhance new skills.

teaching_experience: - I have been teaching private lessons for 4 years and have experience teaching all ages, especially adults, and all beginner-intermediate levels.
other_experience: Outside of private and group lessons, I also stream a variety of chess content on my Twitch channel (
best_skills: When it comes to teaching, I like to adapt to each student's needs while still improving each part of their game. Depending on what gaps each student needs help to improve most in, I do a good job at focusing more time in those areas. I explain my points clearly, break down topics that can be hard to grasp and also have a patient and understanding approach to my teaching style.
teaching_methodology: The first lesson I use as a diagnostic. I analyze your games, give certain positions related to calculation/middlegames/endgames to understand how you think and your strengths as weaknesses overall as a player. This helps me prepare to target your weaknesses for future lessons. I always prioritize questions you would like to cover during lessons but if you do not have a preference, I will always come to the lessons prepared with material.

name: IM Valeri Lilov
headline: None
about: I am a 33-year-old International Master and professional chess coach. My FIDE rating is 2438 (Classical) and 2515 (Online). In addition to giving high quality private lessons, I work as professional lecturer for many popular sites, including
playing_experience: At the age of 6 years and a half, Valeri played for the first time in a real chess tournament among other strong players under the age of fourteen. Then, he took the respectable second place. At the age of seven, Valeri was able to play blindfold chess on several boards simultaneously. A year later, he managed to boost his ELO rating to 1985, which was a record-breaking achievement for an eight-year-old kid in his native country of Bulgaria. In the following years, Valeri became the national chess champion in all age groups including U10, U12, U14, U16, U18, and U20 and that achievement brought him numerous medals and distinctions that encouraged him even more in his quest of becoming a master. In the year of 2000, Valeri became the European Individual School Chess Champion U10 scoring 6.5 out of 7.0 points in this annual international event held in Moscow, Russia.
teaching_experience: Currently, Valeri works mostly as chess trainer. He is now employed as part-time lecturer for five of the most popular chess giants on the internet, including ChessBase, ICC,
other_experience: In January, 2010, Valeri Lilov was officially invited to the ChessBase headquarters in Hamburg, Germany to record his first two DVDs on the Sicilian Kan and Queen‚Äôs Gambit Accepted. This marked the beginning of a long collaboration between ChessBase and IM Valeri Lilov which ultimately resulted in over 15 DVDs being produced and a number of other instructive chess training materials being distributed to the countless chess enthusiasts around the globe.
best_skills: Upon the purchase of one private online lesson, you are entitled to receive a free special personalized chess training program, which will outline the topics that you most need to study, as well as the training methods and materials, which will deliver greatest results in terms of improvement over a short period of time. Tiger Lilov‚Äôs online course also includes free thematic homework assignments, which are given upon the completion of each chess lesson on a given topic and helps students measure to what degree they have understood the material. Though optional, the homework assignments are a great way for IM Valeri Lilov to keep track of his students‚Äô improvement and provide them with the opportunity to test their new knowledge and skills as they progress further! The Tiger‚Äôs lessons are indeed the best personalized chess training on the internet! With his innovative approach and originality, IM Valeri Lilov has crafted a fool-proof system for coaching chess players of various levels effectively, which made him one of the top chess trainers online!
teaching_methodology: A Personalized Approach to Training...

teaching_experience: Throughout my chess career, I have not only played, but also coached a number of young players. name: IM Filip Pancevski
headline: None
about: My name is Filip Pancevski 30 year old  International Master  from Macedonia. I have two GM norms. My Fide rating in classical chess is 2495 (highest 2523) elo points. I'm also a graduated economist.  You can see more about me on my website
playing_experience: I started playing chess when I was 5 years old and I played my first rated tournament at age of 7. I have won many National youth championships and have represented my country on European and World Youth Championships. I became National Champion four times so far, in 2010, 2012, 2014, 2016, 2018 and 2022. Since 2009 I have become member of the National chess team and have played on six European team championships and four chess Olympiads. When I was 10 years old I joined the chess club Alkaloid with which I have won more than fifteen National Team Championships. In 2016 as a member of Club Alkaloid I won the golden medal on the European Team Championship, and in 2017 we became European vice-champions. In my career I have been winner on many rapid and blitz tournaments.
teaching_experience: My teaching experience started as a assistant coach in the chess school where I started learning chess. Being one of the strongest students in that chess school, my coach asked me to assist him with the youngest chess talents. The reason for teaching while still being a student in the same chess club was, as my coach said, " In order to be sure that you know something you need to be able to explain it to a beginner".  I began teaching online in 2013 and since then I have had more than 50 students from all around the world.
best_skills: I'm excellent in middle game and endgame which I think are the most important parts of the chess game. I can help a student in the process of thinking during the game, time management, preparation before the game, opening repertoire (which should be according to players tastes and style). I can also help in developing logical thinking and psychology which are very important aspects of chess.
teaching_methodology: Nowadays there are many chess books, many chess videos, chess programs and lot of other chess related materials. It is impossible to learn and memorize all that information in a lifetime. That is why the chess player needs to know exactly what to learn and how to learned it. This is where chess coach can help a lot.

name: IM Renier Castellanos
headline: None
about: International Master Renier Castellanos from Spain, chess coach and active chessplayer. Started playing chess at the age of 7 and to this day I continue. I like traveling, photographs, sports .
playing_experience: Played in two Olympiads in the Chilean team, Calvia 2004, and Torino 2006. I have two GM norms. I usually play in Europe in every possible Open event. Spain, Italy, and France.
teaching_experience: Over 10 years of coaching experience, my training plan is especially focused on improving your openings and the middle game motifs that normally emerge from them. It gives results in short term. Moreover, I provide deep analysis of your own games. I believe that one of the keys to improve your play is recognizing your own mistakes and your tendency to repeat them in certain positions. My students also benefit from my own new chess experience, keeping therefore up to date with theory and fresh analysis all the time.
teaching_methodology: My methods may vary depending on my student's strength. Mostly I go over everything that has worked for me in the past and has helped me to play better and overcome difficulties. Opening advice, middle game knowledge, classic games on most know etc. I present a concept and then work with different types of positions. Not only from published works from famous players and trainers but also plenty of original positions from my own games and research. Students are welcome to send me positions to analyze as well.

name: WIM Camelia Ciobanu
headline: None
about: This is WIM Camelia Ciobanu, a multiple chess champion and currently a chess coach and author. In the last 7 years I have trained hundreds of players all over the world, from beginners to advanced, both children and adults. I am very happy to assist to their progress in chess understanding and to help developing their talent and skills. Some of my students competed in OTB tournaments, winning local or  International opens and also medals at the National Championships. My goal is to make you go beyond your limits and become a master of the wonderful game of chess. For that reason I also offer free video tutorials on my YouTube channel. If you would like to become my chess friend please join me on:
playing_experience: Starting to play in tournaments at the age of 8, I witnessed a rapid and constant growth, winning 3 National Champion titles before the age of 20 and plenty other gold medals at the National Team Champs, culminating with being the European Champion under 18 together with my team. During my chess career I had the privilege to play in several European and World Championships and I was also thrilled to be able to win numerous competitions both in my country and abroad. These are the countries I have been playing to: Romania, Hungary, France, Greece, Spain, Montenegro, Turkey, Italy and Israel. Coming next, I would like to play chess tournaments and championships in the United States of America. Since I moved to Italy, I played mostly in Sardinia, Sicily and Rome. This year I represent a chess club in Sardinia.
teaching_experience: As a trainer I taught chess in two schools in Romania and in a high school and community centre in Italy, besides the private lessons and the courses I held in different chess clubs. In recent years I held training sessions online, helping people around the world to improve their playing performance and deepening their understanding of the chess logic. It is a very pleasant experience to connect with people from different continents, with different cultures, speaking the same language of... chess. Chess is a great tool to keep one's mind in a constant exercise of thinking, which maintains the brain active and young.
other_experience: 2018 and on: I've coached more than 400 students;
best_skills: My students consider me to be very patient, listening to their ideas and dilemmas and careful to explain in much detail the logic behind each move. They appreciate the variety of topics we discuss, the constant interaction during our lessons and especially the fact that we play together. My playing style is mostly energetic, with a harmonious blend of strategy and tactics which inspires my students to try and do the same. They also like my being open to their suggestions and focus on their areas of interest and especially the fun we share while learning. You can read some of their feedback in the reviews' column on the left side of this page. Will you join us too?
teaching_methodology: Generally we focus on understanding the positions, detecting the opponent's weaknesses and making the right plan. We will learn how to attack, how to defend, tactics, strategy, we'll analyse your games and also play together. We will study the basic principles in different openings and some endgames as well. It depends on what your areas of improvement are so we can work on rising your chess performance to meet your personal goals. Send me a message and let us schedule our first lesson together. I cannot wait to start working together! What about you?

name: IM Prince Bajaj
headline: None
about: Hello, my name is Prince Bajaj, and I am an International Master from India.
playing_experience: I am an accomplished Chess International Master and coach with over 18 years of experience as a player. Throughout my career, I have represented India in numerous Commonwealth, Asian, and World Youth Chess championships in more than 20 countries.
teaching_experience: As a coach with over 5 years of experience, I have had the privilege of training, mentoring, and guiding numerous students of all skill levels. Throughout my coaching career, I have been able to help many of my students significantly improve their ratings, with some increasing their ratings by up to 800 points and achieving the prestigious titles of Candidate Master and Fide Master.
teaching_methodology: My coaching approach involves an insightful analysis of games to identify the student's strengths and weaknesses, which is then used to create a personalized program for improvement.

name: CM Mihael Jakrlin
headline: None
about: I am a 21 year old CM from Croatia. Chess is my first love and I learned my first moves at the age of 3 from my dad. He was taught by his dad since chess is passed down from generation to generation in my family. From then on, the board and I have been inseparable. My hobbies include going to the gym and playing rugby. I study civil engineering and  like (almost) everything that young people like :) Feel free to message me.
playing_experience: Most of the expirience I gained playing in Croatia was at the national and league level. I have been playing chess at a competitive level for over a decade, finishing multiple times in the top junior and cadet championships. Currently, I play the first board for the club in the city where I study. I also participated in several European competitions in youth categories. In addition to all that, I participate in a lot of blitz and rapid tournaments all over Croatia.
teaching_experience: I have almost three years of coaching experience with younger generations and I have been a club coach for quite some time. As far as one-on-one work is concerned, my first student was my brother, who now has almost 1700 classical elo.
other_experience: English is my second language, which I have been learning and speaking for over a decade now. I gained a lot of  experience through tournaments, and in my spare time, I play a lot of online chess, especially bullet and blitz on various chess sites.
teaching_methodology: My main goal is to find a style that suits each student and follow that in order to develop in the future. I concentrate much more on understanding the positions than on pure learning because it is important to have a plan in every position. However, you still need to have a sharp eye for tactics since they are crutial and a key to victory. Feel free to message me.

name: FM giuseppe fabiano
headline: "Un vero giocatore di Scacchi preferisce una bella partita ad una vittoria - A true chess player prefers a good game to victory" F. Arrabal
about: Classe 1964, Catania. Puoi contattarmi tramite Lichess o via mail : giu.fabiano64@gmail.com
playing_experience: Ho partecipato a Tornei Nazionali e Internazionali, con eccellenti classificazioni, entrando a far parte della Squadra Nazionale Italiana di Scacchi alla 14th Chess Mitropa Cup del 1991. Nel 1996, conquisto il IV¬∞ posto assoluto al Campionato Italiano individuale UISP e nel 1998
teaching_experience: Ho maturato esperienza di insegnamento presso diversi Circoli Scacchistici, realizzando Corsi di Scacchi nelle Scuole gi√† negli anni ‚Äò90.
other_experience: Promotore e organizzatore di manifestazioni sportive sia giovanili nel proprio territorio, che agonistiche di respiro internazionale. Ultimo il Taormina Etna Chess Festival, tenutosi nell'Aprile 2019,  con 43  giocatori, dagli over 60 sino agli 8 anni, provenienti da 7 nazioni estere (Belgio, Germania, Irlanda, Inghilterra, Malta, Romania e Ucraina) e da 5 regioni italiane.
best_skills: Il mio punto di forza come giocatore √® la capacit√† di avere una buona visione strategica e, conseguentemente, realizzare i tatticismi che ne derivano.
teaching_methodology: L'approccio √® personalizzato. Conseguentemente lo √® la metodologia applicata all'insegnamento. Nel rivolgermi ai neofiti, soprattutto se in tenera et√†, la mia scelta metodologica √® quella di un approccio "affabulatorio" ed un corretto bilanciamento tra tempi di teoria e di pratica in ciascuna sessione. Ovviamente, differente sar√† per gli adulti o i giocatori provetti, che vogliano perfezionarsi a livello intermedio o avanzato. Parto sempre da un'analisi del loro stile, per individuare i punti di forza e debolezza nelle varie fasi del gioco e modulare le sessioni di insegnamento per potenziarlo e colmarne le lacune, siano esse tattiche o strategiche. Gioco, esercizi, indicazioni su riferimenti bibliografici per approfondire la teoria sugli argomenti oggetto delle lezioni teorico-pratiche.

about: I am FM Suyog Wagh and I have been playing chess since I was about 11 Years Old. Also, I have been Common Wealth Under-20 Gold Medalist. I have gathered huge information regarding every aspect of chess in my 10 Years Journey and know quite a lot of chess tricks and how to improve your chess skills. Also because of this, I have been able to get official certification from FIDE for My FM title.  Now to share what I have learned I have started as a chess coach on lichess to help all of you to improve your game.
playing_experience: I have playing experience for more than 10 Years. In this year I have won various tournaments. Some of my achievements are.
teaching_experience: I have been teaching chess for more than 3 years. In these years I have produced many FIDE-rated players as well as improved many players' ratings by almost more than 500+ points. I have students from 7 years all the way to 49 years of age. Because of this experience, I know exactly where players should focus their attention to improve their game.
other_experience: I have been investing in the Stock Market since turned 18 and love analyzing different companies. Also, I am quite interested in Crypto Currency although in my free time love playing the Guitar and reading books.
best_skills: I do believe with proper guidance and proper training anyone can achieve amazing results in chess. One just has to know what he has to work on and where his weakness lies and what are his strength are.
teaching_methodology: I won't waste your time with the hard puzzles which all coaches give. During the lesson we will pay attention to the analysis of student's games in order to find out typical mistakes and avoid them in the future, also we'll study classical famous games, will work on the opening repertoire as well as positional skills and calculation abilities. Also after the class is over will give you a schedule to work on at home so even if we are not having a session you can work at home. Just like regular gym chess needs regular practice!

name: WFM Malina Aciu
headline: None
about: I am a player from Romania offering chess lessons for both beginners and intermediate players who find this sport interesting and want to improve their knowledge when it comes to the ins and outs of this game.
playing_experience: I have been a chess player for over 9 years now who has participated in numerous World and European championships. My biggest achievements include 3 times the European vice-champion (rapid, blitz, and problem-solving), 3rd place in World School Chess Championship, 2nd place in the International Sports Olympiad, as well as multiple times the national champion and vice-champion.
teaching_experience: I have been a chess coach for around five years.  Many of my students have won numerous prizes in national tournaments and chess has helped them develop discipline, critical thinking, and attentiveness. I find working with others incredibly rewarding, especially when I see them growing their chess knowledge under my eyes.
best_skills: I will evaluate you and plan the lesson according to your needs. I will answer any questions whenever you are facing difficulties. I strive to make our classes entertaining by adopting an easy-going attitude. My goal here is not to necessarily burden you with the overwhelming complexities of the game but to rather make you fall in love with it and stimulate your inquisitiveness, while also encouraging you to willingly discover and learn more.
teaching_methodology: All my lessons are carefully prepared in advance and I provide extra material for individual work as well. During the first lessons, by analyzing your games, I will spot your strengths and weaknesses which we will be focusing on together, whether those issues appear in the opening, middlegame, or endgame. I base my classes on communication and positive interaction. I want my students to be active and attentive, as I will ask questions throughout the lesson to make sure the information has been absorbed.

I have been head coach on MAPO KERAVNOS team (many years on 1st league) while I also had private lessons and school chess classes. Now I am head coach on a new team S.O. ARISTOTELIS and am mainly focus on online lessons. My gratest coaching achivement is Dimitrios Bozanis, with 4 months of weekly lessons he became a 2000 rated player grabing 200 rating points.
other_experience: I am graduated mathematician specilized in data sciense. Mathematics and chess have similar structure, each topic helps me on the other. Right now I am teaching robotics, STEM and every school lesson for young students.
best_skills: Deep analytical thinking and patience are my stronger skills both on playing and teaching
teaching_methodology: to my point of view endgames are significantly important for chess understanding and hence I focus there with structured methodology frome the gratest books like Dvorevsky endgame manual. After a stronge endgame knowledge established I focus on tactical skills. I do my best to provide exersizes for clear and deep calculation. Last but not least strategical concepts take place mainly from classical games. Then I teach the principals of chess opennings and specific lines. Openings are last because is the hardest part to understand but more importandly because I need to recognize my students style before providing specific repertuar. Every week I give a study in order to increase students fantasy and pattern recognition. Studies are usually related to the topic we discas. Of course the Teaching methodology depends on the student needs more than anything else.

name: CM Marc Balague
headline: None
about: Hello!
playing_experience: I started learning chess when I was 3 years old. My father sat me down in front of a chess board 5 minutes every day until I was tired. I started competing at the age of 9 and I'm still enjoying the game as the first day I saw a chess set. It's been 19 years of competitive chess and there is still a long way to go!
teaching_experience: I have one year experience teaching private and group lessons.
other_experience: Together with two more friends we organized an online tournament with money prices when the pandemic hit the world in 2020. We managed to get teams from 11 countries (India, Israel, Chile, Argentina, Spain, Peru...). There were plenty of GM, IM and other very strong titled players. I did the english commentary of the games during the whole event. In the final round we invited Baadur Jobava who joined me in the live commentary. All the benefits from the tournament where donated to hospital Josep Trueta in Girona to fight against coronavirus.
teaching_methodology: I am myself working on a specific training plan to get the Fide Master title soon. During this process, I have been collecting knowledge and material of high quality that will be very useful in our lessons.

name: FM Alex Terzi
headline: None
about: Hi chess lovers!
playing_experience: Chess is a game to which I have devoted 15 years of my life. Throughout these years, I have been the winner of a plethora of international chess tournaments and festivals, including the Belarusian Chess Championship. In fact, getting the FIDE Master title in 2017 was the proudest moment in my chess career; now my Elo is 2322.
teaching_experience: Immediately after this title, I decided to put my chess knowledge and training into work. So, I started giving online chess lessons to individuals in both English and Russian languages. Currently, I work with beginner and intermediate players from different parts in the world like Canada, the USA, Australia, Norway and Russia. Thanks to my 2 years of chess coaching experience in the kids club, I have learned the best coaching strategies and tactics on which I rely to train my students. As a professional chess coach, I have helped many students around the world to train their minds to be attentive and focused; many of whom have gone on to win important chess tournaments and competitions.
other_experience: You can check my WorkBook for Beginners where you will find many interesting puzzles!
best_skills: My boredom-free coaching philosophy as well as my professional, friendly and easy to work with nature is highly appreciated by my students from all levels, and they express that in words and in coming back over and over. So, what about you? Don‚Äôt you want to learn chess and win yourself a match or two?
teaching_methodology: My training program is global: it's about improving your attitude, discipline, technical skills, and work to better understand your mistakes (also "why" you make such mistakes) and how to "read" a position to give a better response to it. There are some little important rules for understanding any kind of position and answer to the question "What should I do in this position?".

I have won the danish team championship 13 times and has become 2nd, 3rd and 4th in the individual danish championship. I have also participated in the Chess Olympics and European Championship for teams. I have played in the Bundesliga and currently, I play in the second Bundesliga.
teaching_experience: As mentioned I have been teaching most of the danish talents during the last two decades and has been teaching on all levels and ages since the beginning.
other_experience: Last year and this year I will be one of the two main commentators during the Danish championship. This can be followed on Twitch from the 4th of April this year :)
teaching_methodology: My method of teaching will mainly be reviews of your own games and discuss theory and practical chess in the critical positions of your games and what plans would be possible.  I like to use dialog and humor :) as teaching methods where I use questions to raise your level of chess understanding.

teaching_methodology: During online sessions,I usually ask my students to sit with the board and coins so that I will narrate the game or any position so that they can play them over the board.I believe consistent training in this aspect would enable them to get 'over the board 'feel rather staring at Laptop/pc for long time.I give home works and keep asking about  the progress made.

about: Hi, I am a Dutch Fide master 28 years old, and have been enjoying playing and coaching chess for many years.
playing_experience: Since my youth, I am an active chess player who is competing frequently in chess tournaments in The Netherlands and abroad. My level of play improved over the last couple of years by using powerful training tools and methods, which are underestimated and not frequently used by other players. In the summer of 2018, I earned the FIDE master title and my ambition is to keep on improving.
teaching_experience: I am working as a full-time chess coach teaching about 25 hours per week to students ranging from beginner to 2000 level, which I enjoy a lot. name: FM Jack Puccini
headline: None
about: I'm FM Jack Puccini from Australia. I'm 23 years old and I'm currently the events manager at the Chess platform, Tornelo. My hobbies include sports such as football, sprinting and futsal as well as music composition and language learning. My teaching philosophy is grounded on the idea that chess development does not occur through collecting knowledge, but rather through acquiring skills. For coaching enquires please email me at jackpuccini99@gmail.com
playing_experience: I started playing chess when I was 8 years old, and have since represented my country in multiple international events including U16 Olympiads and Junior World Championships. More recently, I won the Australian blitz championship in 2020.
teaching_experience: I have taught hundreds of students ever since I started teaching chess over 8 years ago, in both 1-on-1 and group settings. I have experience working with students over long periods of time to foster their chess development, which has led to some winning state championship titles.
other_experience: I have previously given several chess lectures on topics ranging from attacking chess to psychology in chess, as well as more recently streaming instructive chess content on my twitch channel to many people. I also have experience as a chess commentator, commentating on events ranging from friendly matches to international tournaments.
best_skills: I believe that my biggest strength as a chess coach are the training methods that I have developed after years of thinking and experimenting that I would share with my students - from methods to more easily memorize opening lines and theoretical endgames, to improving your tactical vision. A sample of such methods can be seen on my YouTube channel - FM Jack Puccini Chess. I also have an abundance of chess resources, from opening files on various openings to self-collated endgame material to calculation-based training positions.
teaching_methodology: Improving at chess is hard, especially as one reaches a more advanced level. Hence, if one wishes to improve they most likely will have to devote a fair amount of time to studying individually. This is why I believe the primary role of a coach should be to help the student help themselves. This firstly involves analysing the student's games to determine weaknesses that the student themselves cannot perceive, followed by providing content during lessons and homework to address such weaknesses. Of course, working with the student to build a reliable and sustainable opening repertoire is also a key goal, with the time being devoted to this depending on the student's current chess ability and level of ambition.

best_skills: My main strength in chess are openings, analytical aspect as well as tactics and dynamical play.

I will do my best to improve your strategical understanding and endgame play by analyzing the games where I will explain the key ideas. I will also focus on analyzing your games so that we limit the number of mistakes you make.

name: NM Elijah Logozar
headline: None
about: Hi! I'm a 22-year old National Master with a 2242 USCF peak. Motivation is not an issue because I love chess as a mode of truth-seeking and appreciate chess aesthetics independent of results. This is why I was able to study chess during all of my free time during high school, even though I couldn't play many tournaments. Because the truth is important to me, I care about deeply understanding what I learn and the accuracy of my teaching methods. As I've read 100+ chess books and study empirical science and philosophy as a hobby, you can trust that I am qualified to help you improve at chess. My goal in chess is to become a GM and attempt to break records of adult improvement. I'm willing to study chess 80+ hrs per week to make it happen! As an extrovert, I deeply enjoy coaching and often go overtime during class without extra payment. I hope you enjoy working with me! Free sample lesson here:
playing_experience: 1st Place: 2018 Philidelphia International (U2100)
teaching_experience: 7 years of teaching experience. I love spreading my passion for chess! Lessons can be booked here:
best_skills: Opening preparation, classic games, analytic precision, effective calculation methods, and precise methodology for adult improvers. I also have a background in neurology and psychology. As an extrovert, I tend to easily connect with others - hopefully, I'll be able to inspire you too!
teaching_methodology: One of my main goals as a coach is to inspire and motivate you and enjoyment is very important for the process! I generally start with a personalized discussion of your chess history and goals in order to make a personalized study plan. After we have connected, I focus on whatever topics are most related to your weaknesses and personal interests. In the absence of other information, I focus on game analysis both for its own sake and as a diagnostic. While I specialize in adult improvement, children generally enjoy working with me and often get inspired to do independent study.

playing_experience: I have been playing chess since I was 7 years old, and in a very natural way, the sport ended up becoming a career that I continue today. I'm a National Master, olympic athlete and current Brazilian runner-up, and here are some of my best wins:
teaching_experience: As I had classes with many teachers and masters, in addition to the knowledge that I have accumulated in chess, I have experience with different teaching methodologies and ways to teach a class. I have already worked in schools, teaching children, and I am part of a volunteer job at a chess club that receives people from many places. So, I had and I have the opportunity to deal with new challenges that always encourage me to reinvent myself and to improve the teaching methods that I still use today.
teaching_methodology: According to the profile of the student, I direct my classes towards the objective proposed to me, always bearing in mind that, regardless of whether it is a hobby or a high-performance sport, the gains are immeasurable when studying "chess" (without being restricted to a specific area of the game). I am based on books that I have already studied and on bibliographic references that are recommended by great players, almost unanimously. The news also provides us with very valuable studies, since it is possible to follow tournaments and competitions that are taking place in several countries all the time. Chess is a wonderful game mainly for its complexity that always arouses curiosity in the human being. And each game brings a world of new ideas that are waiting to be explored in the best possible way.

name: WFM Valentina Verbin
headline: None
about: Hi ! My name is Valentina Verbin and I am 21 years old.  Currently living in Norway and part of the Offerspill Chessclub. I played on the first board for  Moldavian Women  Team at the Olympiad in Chennai  and represented my country at multiple European Youth and World Youth championships. I love playing chess and analyzing different parts of the game. I am also interested in psychology and started  studying it this year.
playing_experience: I started playing chess at the age of 7 in my hometown, Chisinau. I  won 4 times the National championship in different age categories and in 2020 I managed to win the National Women championship . My best place at the European Youth Championship was 8th place in 2016( G16) ,Prague and also 2nd place in the European Schools Chess championship in 2019 (G17) . I participated in European Women championship in 2021 ,scoring 5.5 points.  I played twice for  the National team in the Olympiad U16 and in 2022 ( Chennai) played for the first time in the Chess Olympiad for the women team.
teaching_experience: Started coaching in the last years,mostly focusing on individual trainings , but was also part of the Norwegian girls championship as a coach and helped kids analyze their games.  My students have showen great improvments in rating but also in understanding different part of the games.
best_skills: Strong in dynamics and calculation,good feeling for where pieces should go, but also liking positional chess and slowly limiting oponent threats .Trying to play and to teach unique positions to be able to develop a good intuition which helps us in unknown situations by pattern recognition. I also like working with the openings and finding new ideas to try . I am very responsible so I prepare well before the game and can help the student do the same.
teaching_methodology: I like to follow my students closely ,because I believe than analyzing your games and previous mistakes is one of the best ways to improve. I like showing instructive games ,which helps expalaining different principles in chess . I think solving puzzles is very important for remaining alert so I always ask some critical questions or prepare good puzzles at the beginning as a warm up. Keeping the training challenging it's what gives the best results. I also believe that having the good strategy for the game and finding the weak or strong points of your oponent is crucial. If the student wants , I can give good material as homework or advice with a good book which can help you improve.Would be happy to share  my knowledge in openings,middlegames and endgames. Contact me if it sounds interesting! Either on lichess or on my mail: valentinaverbin2@gmail.com

name: WGM Gabriela Antova
headline: None
about: Hey, everyone! My name is Gabriela Antova and I am a WGM/FM with a peak rating of 2335. Originally from Bulgaria, I currently live in the United States where I attend Saint Louis University. I am an experienced chess player, and more recently, a coach, so let's grow together! Ambitious and passionate, I seek to improve my game and ~yours~ should you choose to work with me!  New learners of the game and seasoned competitors are both welcome :)
playing_experience: I have been playing chess all my life, ever since I started at the age of 6. I have been consistently ranked among the top players of my age worldwide being a 5-time medalist from the European youth individual championships and a bronze medalist from the world youth championship. More recently, I am a member of the best collegiate team in the United States that won the 2022 Pan-American championship and the 2021 FIDE World University Online championship. I also represented my country Bulgaria at the 2022 FIDE Women's Chess Olympiad in Chennai where my team placed 9th with me scoring 8.5/10 on board 4. As of now, I hold 1 IM norm and I am currently trying to climb higher up on the women's world rank list.
teaching_experience: Fully individualized approach. The focus is on YOU and what YOU need to become a better chess player. We are going to review your games, see what you need to advance further and work to fix it. I am patient and dedicated and here to help you improve on any area of chess you need: be it openings, middlegames or endgames. Specific prep during tournaments? Yes, I can do that that for you as well! Additional exercises/ homework? Only if you are up for it!
teaching_methodology: Fully individualized approach. The focus is on YOU and what YOU need to become a better chess player. name: GM Evgeniy Solozhenkin
headline: None
about: Hi! I'm GM Evgeniy Solozhenkin from Saint Petersburg, Russia. Professional player in the past. Chief Trainer in the Grandmaster Chess School of Nord-West region of Russia at the current moment.
playing_experience: Twice champion of  Leningrad-Saint Petersburg, winner of club championships of Russia, France, Finland . Winner of tens international tournaments in Europe and Russia, among them Cappelle-la-Grande, Reggio Emilia. World Senior champion (2017) in the team of Saint Petersburg.
teaching_experience: World champion Alexander Khalifman recruited me in 1990th as a second. Having stopped active chess carrier in the beginning of 2000th, I started my carrier of professional chess teacher and coach in a chess club of my home city St.Petersburg where I worked  with children of all levels from beginners to advanced players. Last years I do train mainly advanced teenagers including members of Russian Youth team. In 2014 and 2015 I was nominated by Russian Chess Federation among three best youth coaches in Russia (3rd and 2nd awards). FIDE Senior Trainer since 2019.
other_experience: In 2000 I wrote CD for Chessbase "Opposite Colour Bishop Endgames"devoted to rare ratio of chess material. My book "The Main Spanish Road" on Ruy Lopez with Zaitsev System as a corner variation was published in 2016. Two other my books were published in 2018 (‚ÄúPlay Queen's Indian Defense‚Äù) and 2020 (‚ÄúChallenge 2020‚Äù).
best_skills: As if I was impressed by Nimzowitsch masterpiece "My System", games of Petrosian and Karpov in my youth, the positional way of playing was established  on subconscious level in my own creation. Opening repertoire was wide enough for both sides during my professional chess carrier and it was even increased when I became trainer.
teaching_methodology: Modern chess with its trend of reducing time control dictates the development of certain qualities: quick and correct evaluation of the position, quick and  precise calculation of short tactics, deep knoledge of your opening repertoire with clear understanding of up-coming plans for both sides in the middlegame. All is needed. From the other hand every student is unique, that's why flexibility and diversity based on particularity of the chessplayer is highly recommended in chess training. Common analyzing of played games is the way better to understand weaknesses and strong sides. We can also play on-line games of rapid or blitz time control and analyze them together right after.

name: WIM Marie Antoinette San Diego

about: I am Woman International Master Marie Antoinette San Diego from the Philippines. 24 years of age and a graduate of Bachelor of Arts Major in Psychology. I am a part of the National Chess Team of the Philippines and the 2022 Women's National Champion of the Philippines.
playing_experience: I became a WFM when I was 12 and I got my WIM title at 18. I played in many international tournaments like ASEAN Age Groups, Southeast-Asian Games, Asian Youth, Asian Games, World Youth, World Juniors, Zonals, and many more. I also represented the Philippines in the recent World Olympiad in Chennai, India.
teaching_experience: I've started coaching professionally year 2020 during the pandemic (Happy 3 years!), but I've been helping a lot of fellow players before. Starting from my younger siblings, voluntary chess teaching for children, to my university teammates, to a school, I just love sharing my knowledge and experiences to help other people grow in their respectful careers. Being able to help my students achieve their goals is my main objective.
other_experience: I also do exhibition matches like simultaneous games, attend tournaments as a guest speaker, I just love inspiring others in playing chess and promoting the sport for a bigger and better chess community. Some content-creation on the side, and other hobbies like playing other games or anything that challenges my mind, game!
best_skills: I am a positional player, I prefer positions that are more strategic than all-out aggressive. I am suited for calm positions where players' patience can be tested. I think my best skill my patience. Patience is very important in every part of a chess game and also in teaching. Aside from that, I believe that there is always a room for improvement and I always try to become better everyday. It is also significant to understand that when it comes to teaching and learning, there is no "one size fits all". Everyone is different in their own ways, and everybody has their own pace in progress.
teaching_methodology: I prepare lessons for each student differently and I base it on the assessment results. The first meeting with a student would be an assessment and there, I'll plan on what to do in the upcoming sessions.
