name: WFM Daria Visanescu
headline: None
about: Hi, My name is Daria Visanescu and I am 24 years old. I live in Romania and I hold WFM title, being an active chess player and teacher.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess since 5 years old. My experience includes random open tournaments, National Championships, European and World Championships. Among my biggest achievements I would mention:
teaching_experience: I have 2 years experience as a teacher on and off, both with kids and adults, ranging 3 years old - adults. I have worked in groups of kids and individually with adults. The biggest challenge was to be there for each and one of them as they were different personalities, levels and ages. I have worked either in schools or after schools, face to face, either online in case of the adults.
other_experience: I have gained a degree in Psychology which helped me a lot with my soft skills. Not the degree itself, but the journey I was on during my University :) I can easily understand people and their needs, and that is the reason why I prefer personalized training approaches.
teaching_methodology: I prefer personalized training approaches. First the student is evaluated and we establish together his level. Then we discuss his needs and targets, we talk about what he wants to obtain during our chess lessons. It is an important step as there are many reasons why someone would like to learn chess. Of course, I have my own philosophy: I want my student to become independent and my main focus is to help him gain the understanding of chess. My student should learn where to search information about chess, how to work with the main tools and how to train himself. I do not focus on memorizing moves. I focus on strategies and how I can help my student develop his own strategies, and at last to be able to conduct a logical thread without me. I emphasize the critical, abstract and logical thinking - and I shape my student thinking skills because that is what I love the most about being a teacher and I want to make changes at a more profound level than memorizing.

name: GM Girish Koushik

about: I am a 26-year-old Grandmaster from India, currently in the United Kingdom.

After that, I had to slow down my chess career in order to concentrate on academics. I secured the Grandmaster (GM) title in 2019 and have been active in chess once again.
teaching_experience: I have reached this level without any coaching from any external trainers and I have always trained myself in all aspects of the game. I have been training students for the past 6 years and I have a very deep understanding of the game. Some of my students have won various state championships and finished in the top 5 in national youth championships. I have also briefly worked with Prithu Gupta who went on to become the 64th GM of India.

name: IM Frank Zeller
headline: None
about: Hallo, ich bin Frank Zeller, Internationaler Meister, Schachtrainer und Autor. Ich lebe seit √ºber 30 Jahre in T√ºbingen. Geboren bin ich 1969, bin verheiratet und habe zwei mittlerweile erwachsene Kinder.
playing_experience: Turnierschach spiele ich seit √ºber vier Jahrzehnte. Vor knapp 30 Jahren spielte ich zum ersten Mal in der 1. Bundesliga, seither pendele ich zwischen der 1. und der 2. Liga, lange Zeit habe ich auch Oberliga 1. Brett gespielt. Mein aktueller Verein Zugzwang M√ºnchen (in Verbindung mit der M√ºnchner Schachakademie) ist gerade in die 1. Liga aufgestiegen.
teaching_experience: Erfahrungen als Schachtrainer habe ich seit knapp 30 Jahren, und das in allen m√∂glichen Trainingsformen, sei es in Vereinen mit Training, Simultanspiel oder Vortr√§gen, mit Kindern, Erwachsenen, Senioren, starken Spielern, Vereinsspielern oder Anf√§ngern. Mit Gruppen und mit Einzeltraining. Als Kommentator in Livestreams habe ich auch schon Erfahrungen.
other_experience: Die Schachgeschichte interessiert mich, auch als studierter Historiker, sehr! Ich lese gern alte Turnierb√ºcher und interessiere mich f√ºr die Zusammenh√§nge, f√ºr die Entwicklung im Verst√§ndnis von Schach. Ich sch√§tze die Errungenschaften der Altmeister, die ohne Computerhilfe und meist mit nur sehr wenig B√ºchern ihre Spielst√§rke entwickeln mussten. Nichtsdestotrotz ist das Niveau in den letzten Jahrzehnten enorm gestiegen. Es ist ausgezeichnet, wenn man sich mit der aktuellen Schachmode auskennt, aber genau so ist es von Nutzen, altes Wissen parat zu haben oder zu verstehen, wie sich das Verst√§ndnis einer Variante z.B. √ºber die letzten hundert Jahre entwickelt hat.
best_skills: Im Schach bin ich rundum gebildet, habe viele B√ºcher gelesen, in den letzten Jahren viele Livestreams gesehen und die Entwicklungen im Spielverst√§ndnis immer mit Interesse verfolgt und auch meinen Stil mehrfach umgestellt - notwendigerweise, wenn man up to date sein m√∂chte!
teaching_methodology: Um im Schach besser zu werden, braucht es vor allem Freude am Spiel, am Prozess, am Lernen. Begeisterung dabei, Neues herauszufinden, Varianten zu analysieren. Klar, wenn man GM werden oder an die Spitze der Schachwelt will, ist harte, t√§gliche, disziplinierte Arbeit unerl√§sslich. Aber bis zu einem gewissen Grad an beachtlicher Spielst√§rke ist vor allem die Leidenschaft gefragt! Es muss Spass machen!

name: WFM Maria Leks
headline: None
about: Hi! My name is Maria and I'm a Woman Fide Master and a certified chess coach. I'm here because I believe I can help you to improve your chess :)
playing_experience: I've been playing chess basically my whole life, for almost 20 years now. I'm a multimedalist of Polish Youth and University Championships, though I think my biggest achievements are silver medal at World University Championships (2018) and bronze medal at European Youth Championships (2009). I currently represent Dwie Wie≈ºe Krak√≥w in Polish Extraleague and TSV Schott Mainz in German Bundesleague.
teaching_experience: I've been teaching chess in schools and kindergartens since 2014. So as you can see I'm well experienced in getting along with children, don't worry if you're an adult though! I'm also an online teacher now and I have students in very diversified ages.
other_experience: Moreover, I'm a chess commentator of the biggest chess events in Poland. Recently not only have I played but also commented the Polish Extraleague in english.
teaching_methodology: Learn from your own mistakes! It means that the best way to get better is to analyze your games. Everyone knows it, but how many of you actually do it? I'll help you with that. Obviously, during that process I'm going to share with you all my insights on every individual stage of a game and that includes: opening, middle game and endgame. If there's any specific problem that you'd like to work on, I'm more than open to any suggestions.

name: NM Mark Biernacki
headline: None
about: I am a 26 year old National Master from Charlotte, North Carolina. I learned how to play chess at the age of 7 from my older brother and Dad, and I quickly fell in love with the game. I noticed from a young age that many players allow chess to fade out of their lives, so I made a point to stick with it. When I got to college in 2015, I was introduced to the online game and have been playing and working on my game ever since. I am currently a full-time student in Raleigh, NC, but I teach around 15 hours a week. I am young and passionate about the game, and I can guarantee that I will put forth the effort that is necessary for you to improve.
playing_experience: Most notable achievements:
teaching_experience: I have been teaching chess since I was 15, both in group environments and one-on-one.
teaching_methodology: Tactical understanding can be obtained on your own- but positional understanding cannot. I believe that an understanding of positional principles is a necessary foundation to become a successful chess player. My lessons will focus on learning from your games, whether they are your own or those that others have played, specifically focusing on knowledge which an engine or database may not be able to explain. Finding the correct plan in a position is where many players struggle, and this is what I focus on.

name: NM Abhishek Handigol
headline: None

I graduated two years ago from University of California, Davis with a Bachelor's in Computer Science. I recently achieved the NM title after a 10 year plateau, and am inspired to help others do the same! No matter your age or playing level, I'm confident that I can help you improve your game.
playing_experience: I learned chess when I was 5 and played my first tournament when I was 8. I've won multiple state championships for my age group and frequently placed in the top 50 in the nation for my age. I've played internationally in North America as well.
teaching_experience: I've taught over 30 students for 10+ years and have had great success with them.

teaching_methodology: I prepare lessons based on your games, and I'll assign homework after every class. I will also showcase games by chess masters to inspire you and teach you how to crush your opponents!

name: IM Mika Karttunen
headline: No compromises! I will teach the style of a winner. Welcome to join the winner‚Äôs team! I am also available for training games (with or without analysis).
about: My name is Mika Karttunen and I am from Finland. I am an international chess master with the peak elo rating 2485 and I have one GM-norm. I am 7-times Finnish chess champion and 12-times Finnish blitz chess champion. I have wrote two chess books (in Finnish) and made hundreds of chess videos for my pupils and students. I also have an academic background with master‚Äôs degree in Economics.
playing_experience: I have represented Finland in many international team events since 2000: Olympiad 2000-2018, European team championship 2003-2017, Euro Cup (13 times). Naturally I have also played other international tournaments. I have faced many +2700-elo grandmasters in those competitions and sometimes had very interesting battles against them.  In total there are 23 classical time control tournament games against these elite players, and I have had 9 draws against them.
teaching_experience: I have had many personal students and coaching groups during the years.  I have worked with adults and different aged children and youngsters. I have coached beginners, club players and already master level players to maximize their potential and get the best possible results in the tournaments.
other_experience: I have produced lots of material for chess lessons, courses and videos. My company has also an interactive chess site (Avainsiirto), where I have produced hundreds of tasks and puzzles.
best_skills: I know how to make good opening repertoire for the winning player, who likes to take evaluated risks to get his/her opponent out of the balance. I teach you how to choose and play good openings, and handle them with the dynamic way. I have also deep and wide understanding in different kind of positions. I know how to play endgames as well. I find typical and also original ideas in every position, which is very useful for adventurous and creative minded students.
teaching_methodology: I have different kind of coaching methods. The chosen method depends on how much time and effort the student can put on his/her chess. Usually my coaching program is focused on students own games, opening preferences, strengths and weaknesses and so on. In more closely, I give guidance and information, useful tips, opening files and homework.

name: NM Josh Sinanan
headline: None
about: NM Josh Sinanan
playing_experience: I discovered chess in high school and became WA State High School Champion in 2003, a National Master in 2007, and a Life Master in 2015.
teaching_experience: I chose to forgo a traditional career path in favor of following my passion.  I began teaching chess in 2007 and joined the Seattle Sluggers Team, Seattle‚Äôs professional chess team.  I became involved with chess organizing and joined the board of the Washington Chess Federation in 2008.  I currently teach after-school chess classes in about 10 different Seattle-area schools and works closely with IM Georgi Orlov at two chess academies in the Seattle area.
other_experience: I have been the President of the Washington Chess Federation since 2010 and am on the board of several other chess nonprofits including Chess Mates Foundation, Northwest Chess Foundation, and Chess Enrichment Association.
best_skills: Working as an educator and chess promoter is something I immensely enjoy and continue to learn from every day.  As a matter of fact, I admit that my students often end up teaching me more than I teach them!  I have found that chess is one of the few activities that teaches executive decision-making and empowers one to think clearly through difficult situations.  I believe that every time we play, learn, or teach chess, we become better human beings!
teaching_methodology: My teaching philosophy has always been to customize the material to suit the learning style and needs of the individual student.  I strive to create a fun and stimulating learning process, which I have found is the key to understanding new ideas.  To sharpen technique, I recommend learning by example from the games of strong players, playing out practice positions, and reading books or watching videos featuring the chess theme or topic of interest.

When I teach I try to put a focus on my students games and I personalize the lesson as much as possible according to my students needs. My goal when teaching is to help my students figure out things rather than just propagating knowledge.

name: GM Sasa Martinovic

about: I am Sasa Martinovic, a 32-year-old grandmaster from Croatia (peak FIDE rating 2604). I am also a FIDE trainer and have a master's degree in pedagogy. The knowledge of pedagogy helps me a lot in my work with students. In 2015 I became a licensed FIDE trainer. I was the official trainer of the Croatian chess federation in one U-20 World Championship (2012) and in two youth European Championships (2013 and 2015). Nowadays I'm active in coaching, but as my biggest strength are the openings, I also work as second for some very strong grandmasters.

best_skills: My best skill in playing chess would be the tactical part, and planning an attack. I do positional sometimes but I am more comfortable with open lines, because I believe that in this kind of playing style, I am able to improve my calculations and reflexes when the critical time and position arise. As per my teaching skills, I am more concern in my students rather than the lesson that they will learn from me, I believe that the most important thing to learn in chess is how we control ourselves and emotions during the game, and by doing that I try to teach with compassion and kindness, and make sure that my students will improve their playing skills.
teaching_methodology: I try to assess first the strength of my students base on their playing styles, and I will question their understanding to a certain positions. From there, I will do an interview with what lesson they want me to teach them, and do some of my inputs and assessment to them too and we'll decide on what lessons to take in our class. Depending on strength level of players that I mostly based my lessons (Beginner, Intermediate, Advance, and Master Level).

name: GM Federico Perez Ponsa
headline: None
about: Hi there!  My name is Federico Perez Ponsa.  I am from Argentina, and I have been a Grandmaster (GM) since 2011.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess for almost 20 years. I played 3 Chess Olympiads for Argentina.
teaching_experience: Over the past few years, I have been teaching many strong students.  The lessons were typically focused on specific opening preparations to help those students succeed during their tournaments.  However, since the beginning of 2019, I have opened up my lessons to chess players of all levels, and am willing to broaden the scope of the lessons to include any aspect of the game that a student would like to improve.   I can also check players' games and decide which teaching approach might be best for them.  In addition to the lessons themselves, I have access to a lot of chess books that I can provide and suggest to students, according to their particular needs.
teaching_methodology: I believe in delivering specific lessons for each student. I try to be more like a guide than a lecturer, so that the student can continue practicing and improving efficiently, even on his or her own. For example, I think chess players trying to improve can do tactics on their own and not spend lesson time doing it.  Also, when I help with openings, I try to explain how they are connected to middlegames and sometimes to endgames, so that a student isn‚Äôt merely memorizing engine suggestions.

name: FM Carsten Hansen
headline: None
about: I'm 48 years old, in my day job I work in the shipping industry (as in the containers that sail across the oceans and those that are loaded into aircrafts). I live Bayonne (NJ, USA) but originate in Denmark.
playing_experience: I played full-time in the early 1990 but have been playing less in recent years.
teaching_experience: I'm a FIDE Trainer since 2016 and have the online course "12 Weeks to Better Chess" that has had great results for the participants, several raising their ratings by as much as 200 points above their previous peak.
other_experience: I have written 33 books on chess, including several Amazon bestsellers. My books cover various openings such as the English Opening (1 c4), the Sicilian Dragon, the Accelerated Dragon, the Closed Sicilian, the Budapest Gambit and others. Additionally, I have four books out on Chess Tactics, one on Positional Chess, chess miniatures (games of 25 moves or fewer) and have books coming out on the endgame and several other topics. Additionally, I have a Chessable course available on Tactics and will have several other course coming out in the coming year.
best_skills: I will work with you in improving your overall understanding of the game, help you identify your weaknesses, and improve your skills in those areas (there are usually several problem areas).
teaching_methodology: We work together which means active participation from both of us. Without you doing an equal amount of work outside our lessons, you will not truly see improvement in your game. So you will analyze your games, together we will work on the critical moments of the game to eliminate your weaknesses in understanding, tactics, endgames etc. We will go through your opening repertoire, to tailor a repertoire that corresponds with your style of play as well as your current level of understanding. As you improve, we will finetune all areas.

best_skills: Soy un maestro empatico, me encanta ense√±ar, y espero que mis estudiantes logren sus metas, disfruten el ajedrez, y poder transmitir todo lo aprendido a trav√©s de la pr√°ctica y el estudio. El resto de los t√≠tulos profesionales quedan para cuando se necesite, pero es preferible hacer lo que realmente te apasiona.
teaching_methodology: Las clases son integrales es decir vemos en primera instancia partidas modelo que permitan ir avanzando en diversos temas muy r√°pidamente, pero a trav√©s de un aprendizaje significativo. Los estudiantes deben resolver ciertas tem√°ticas de acuerdo a su nivel para la siguiente sesi√≥n. Es importante el hecho de ver partidas propias de los estudiantes para vislumbrar su estilo y la posible preparaci√≥n te√≥rica que se haga necesaria, el estudio de las diversas facetas del juego apertura, medio juego, y finales permite ir equilibrando conocimientos adquiridos previamente o bien conocer desde lo b√°sico a lo m√°s avanzado. La duraci√≥n de las clases depender√° de la necesidad de cada estudiante desde un sub 8 hasta un adulto. La conversaci√≥n franca a trav√©s de las sesiones permite que exista un apoyo adem√°s en el desarrollo personal de cada uno, un feedback que permita avanzar m√°s efectivamente a lo que se pretenda. El ajedrez debe ser aprendido si bien profesionalmente, esto no exime de ser l√∫dico y cercano para potenciar cada una de las virtudes. "Dedicado a mis padres Leonidas y Amada".

name: CM Aparajita Gochhikar
headline: None
about: I am CM Aparajita Gochhikar, FIDE Instructor from India,  a seasoned chess enthusiast with a passion for strategic thinking and a track record that speaks volumes. I have won medals three times in Commonwealth Chess, Silver medal in World Amateur Chess Championship. Also I had been coach of Indian Cadets and Junior Chess Team Three times for World Cadets, Asian Youth and Junior Chess Championship.
playing_experience: As a player, I have won medals three times in Commonwealth Chess, Silver medal in World Amateur Chess Championship, Bronze medal in Asian Amateur Chess Championship.
teaching_experience: I had been coach of Indian Cadets and Junior Chess Team Three times for World Cadets, Asian Youth and Junior Chess Championship.
other_experience: I was also working as Fair Play Expert in FIDE Chess Olympiad 2022 at Chennai and World Youth Chess Championship 2023 at Italy.
teaching_methodology: My teaching methodology for chess revolves around a structured yet flexible approach. It starts with assessing individual skill levels and goals, ensuring a strong foundation in the basics. I emphasize openings, tactics, and endgame principles, guiding students through practical play and regular game analysis. By fostering a positive mindset and adaptability, I encourage students to learn through both success and losses, always with an eye on long-term progress. I aim to make learning enjoyable and inject creativity into their play, staying updated with the latest chess developments to provide a well-rounded education. Ultimately, my goal is to help students not only excel in chess but also develop a lifelong passion for this beautiful game.

name: CM Mark Josse
headline: None
about: I am 51 year old Candidate Master Mark Josse living in Surrey UK . I run Surrey Kings chess club based in Weybridge , Surrey  I have tutored chess for 20 years developing a number of players to 2200 + FIDE . Surrey Kings Chess club is a junior club that provides opportunities for children from all backgrounds to take part in chess and hopefully develop a lifelong love of the game .
playing_experience: I have played Chess for 42 years competing in the British Championships , London Chess Classic, London league and regularly played in Division one of the Four nations chess league ( 4NCL ) . I won the British Senior championships in 2019 . I have won numerous events as an adult and junior including Surrey Junior Championships. I regularly compete still in the UK chess scene online and over the board competitions.  I was tutored as a junior at the famous Richmond Junior Chess Club by Richard James at the time the most successful club in the UK for producing strong junior chess players .
teaching_experience: Some of the juniors I have coached have won British championships and currently hold FIDE Titles . As a player i have worked out what a player needs to do to improve to each level . I am able to provide bespoke training plans to help my school students and adults achieve their goals . Unlike a lot of chess coaches I am happy to work with beginners as it can be rewarding watching them develop their chess understanding . I run Surrey Kings Junior chess team which took part in Division 5 of the Junior 4NCL in 2020. I am on the ECF list of Accredited coaches, hold enhanced DBS status and can provide references on request .
other_experience: I have been involved in teaching other sports as well as chess for over 20 years  . I have coached semi professional Rugby football and cricket teams  . In 2019 I established and became director of Weybridge RFC Academy mentoring and providing sporting opportunities to over 100 boys aged 15-18 . For 32 years I held senior positions in Investigative law managing hundreds of staff . I have twenty years of management experience in roles where I was responsible for developing staff towards promotion and career development . Surrey Kings chess is a project that is offering chess to players from all different backgrounds and types of schools . Whilst I charge for my work I also sponsor a number of young chess players where finance prevents them from taking part in the game .
best_skills: I have had to work hard over many years to improve at chess . I have a good understanding of what type of work that is needed to improve at each level . I ensure that each student is given a programme that suits their style of play . I am content to work with strong players on opening preparation using PGN and database files . I also believe in teaching young players about the endgame and positional chess . I am happy to work with beginners as the rewards of watching a player progress are great .
teaching_methodology: Lessons are run in person ( before Coronavirus ) or Online . Lessons are run using Zoom and Lichess which i have found to have a good interactive board that both tutor and student can share . Each Lesson is uniquely locked to myself and the student with PGN files available after for the student to refresh the lesson .All students have the opportunity to play for Surrey Kings chess club if they are a junior . I have extensive chess contacts to point you in the right direction of adult chess clubs and tournaments. I am happy to provide one off lesson however i have found best results are achieved by working together over a period of time .

name: GM Borki Predojevic
headline: None
about: Chess grandmaster, born in Teslic (Bosnia and Herzegovina) and currently living in Sarajevo. I started to play chess in 1996.  I became the youngest grandmaster in history of Bosnia and Herzegovina in 2004 (17 years old). Current rating: FIDE 2601 (Peak 2655); USCF 2696.
playing_experience: European Champion U12 (1999) and U14 (2001); World Champion U16 (2003); Vice champion with CC "Bosna" Sarajevo on European Club Cup (2004); Silver medal on 5th baord on European Club Cup in Porto Carras (Greece) 2018; Friendly Rapid Match Magnus Carlsen - Borki Predojevic, Lillehammer 2013 - result 2,5-1,5 for Magnus Carlsen; Winner of many international chess tournaments like: ‚ÄûOpen Metalis‚Äú, Bizovac, Croatia‚Äì 2006, ‚ÄûOpen Zagreb‚Äú, Zagreb, Croatia - 2007, ‚ÄûHit Open‚Äú, Nova Gorica, Slovenia ‚Äì 2008, ‚ÄûAcropolis Open‚Äú, Halkida, Greece ‚Äì 2009, etc.
teaching_experience: I started to coach in beginning of 2014. I am proud that my 1st student (GM Johan Sebastian Christiansen) improved from 2200 to GM title and rating over 2600+! Also my former student GM Akshat Chandra became US Junior Champion & Us National K-12 Champion (both in 2015) while I was coaching him. Also I was/am working with talented players from Europe, USA & Australia.
other_experience: Official commentator of European Club Cup in Skopje 2015;
best_skills: Systematical approach to opening repertoire and making long term repertoire;
teaching_methodology: Most of my time I am helping to my students with repertoire (usually they are younger players who still did not developed structural repertoire and covered all move orders). Also important thing for young and ambitious student is to improve his understanding of game and here I am focused to pas my knowledge in strategical topics (Typical pawn structures, Modern pawn structures, How to handle positions with bishop pair (or play vs it), opposite colored bishops & similar topics).

about: My name is Andr√© and I am a 19 year-old Norwegian FIDE Master with 1 IM-norm as well as being a licensed National Arbiter and National Instructor. I started playing chess when I was 12 years old and after working excessively with my coach, I got to a level of 2000 rating in less than a year. My goal as a chess coach is to help others get to a high level efficiently. This is because like many other things, chess gets more fun the better you are at it!
playing_experience: My best chess result is my recent draw against super GM Praggnanandhaa as white in the Norwegian chess club elite series championship. If interested, here Is a link to the game:
teaching_experience: I have over the last 2 years been a teacher for my local chess club as well as teaching theory for some of the theme tournaments at Stavanger Chess Club. I have also had a private student whom within a couple months went from being completely new to the game to having a blitz rating on lichess of 1500.
other_experience: I have participated in multiple teaching and chess courses and have been tought by Ramachandran Ramesh, Jacob Aagard, Samuel Shankland and even Boris Gelfand at the Quality Chess Academy.
best_skills: My strong suit in chess is calculation and understanding. My goal is to help you get stronger at both of these in an efficient and fun way. That way you can have a better grasp about what chess is really about and hopefully motivate you to get even better! üòä
teaching_methodology: Efficiency is key. Our lessons will be spent analyzing and me explaining different ideas, thought methods, openings etc. that way you will get the most out of our time in lessons. I will also guide you on how to pinpoint your strengths and weaknesses and help you improve them both.

teaching_methodology: We were lucky to live in a unique time of Transition into a new era of Humanity. Everything that does not work gradually leaves our life. This applies to different areas of life. Including attitudes towards different segments of the population. A person changes and mutates even physiology. New children who come to our world show the imperfection of the system of society. The education system, which was built on the principles of survival and education of "slaves" can no longer exist. It is being replaced by new alternative forms of education. Acceptance of the uniqueness of each person and the creation of conditions for the disclosure of this uniqueness lies at the heart of the ‚ÄúTerritory of Freedom of Choice‚Äù.

headline: None
about: Hello Everyone!, My name is Levan Pantsulaia, I'm a Georgian Chess Grandmaster. Current member of the Georgian National Olympic team
playing_experience: My chess career already counts 20 years of experience. I have become a chess grandmaster at the age of 19. Since then I'm a member of the National Georgian chess Olympic team. teaching_experience: During my chess career, I used to work with many chess players starting from the age of 12 to 70. most of my students managed to achieve their goals. I'm here to help not only professional chess players as well as amateurs and players who want to enhance their understanding of the game of chess.
best_skills: As an experienced chess player. I can evaluate the needs of my students, and provide the relevant information properly. As a person, I'm communicative friendly always opened to any questions (even not chess-related). for me, it is important to have a friendly relationship with my students.
teaching_methodology: My teaching methodology is individual, it depends on my student's level of play and understanding of the game. every different level chess player requires a different approach. As for myself, I'm ready to share my experience and provide essential knowledge for my students.

headline: None

teaching_experience: I'm new to teaching chess, but I'm excited to start this journey and can't wait to see how I can improve your understanding of the game!

best_skills: I first work on building a solid strategical foundation, then improve your tactical awareness and in the end build an opening repertoire that can last you a lifetime and that you enjoy playing!

name: Indeedio
headline: None
about: I come from the chess loving country of Iceland, where I started playing the royal game at the age of eleven. I've been playing it ever since, and  I now teach chess full time. I have other hobbies, such as movies, tennis, and long distance running, but chess remains my passion.
playing_experience: I started playing in junior and adult tournaments in my home town in Iceland in the late 1980s, and I would also regularly travel to the capital Reykjav√≠k where bigger tournaments were held. I was the champion of my chess club in 1993 (Akureyri Chess Club), and came second in the open division of the Icelandic Chess Congress 1995. I've travelled to other countries for chess, such as Spain, Czech Republic, Croatia etc. My peak FIDE rating from a few years back was 2113, and I also have a rapid FIDE which is 2083. I've played against David Bronstein, Alexei Shirov and Robert Hubner, to name a few.
teaching_experience: I've worked full time as a chess coach in Melbourne and Sydney in Australia. Before that, over a long period I taught many students in Iceland, several of which became national champions in their categories under my guidance. I am a FIDE Trainer (FT). In total, I've taught chess for about eighteen years. I am also a certified teacher, and I've worked as such for many years also. With me, you then get an actual teacher, plus someone who has a lot of experience with chess.
other_experience: As a teacher, I've taught many other subjects beside chess, such as mathematics, grammar, literature, geography, English and more.
best_skills: I normally connect well with my chess students, making it fun and interesting for them to learn the game. I think my passion for the game shows when I teach (or so people have told me) which in turn can motivate  further the already eager students.  I've been told that my lessons are structured yet interesting, and I put in the work to make that happen.
teaching_methodology: I would like to offer Skype lessons to students ranging from beginner up to about 1700 elo. I believe in getting the basics right before moving on to more complicated things, because the more advanced things are always based on a combination of the basics. I have gathered and created a large amount of lesson material which my students have been privileged to, and that material is constantly being updated and improved because I'm constantly using it and getting feedback from students. The private student will  need to play games before the lesson that we will analyze together and there will also be homework in the form of puzzles.

name: GM Andrei Istratescu
headline: Ready to help students at any level have a fast and pleasant chess improvement. I appreciate a lot quick-mindedness and free thinking.
about: I obtained the GM title in 1994 at the age of 18, I worked as a coach in France for 3 years and many of my students became IMs or GMs. I also coached there at federal level.Regarding my playing strength, my peak rating was 2677 and for many years I have been in Top 100. I managed to win many international events,mainly in France where I lived for about 14 years. I am professional from the age of 18 and I spent most of my career training and preparing myself for strong events. Now I am 45 years old, but I think I can still play and coach decently.
playing_experience: Probably the strongest event I won was Neckar Open in 2012, shared first in Dubai Open 2015, I managed to win against 3 World Champions ( Karpov, Khalifman and Kasimdzhanov), but also against players like Mamedjarov, Akopian, Movsesian, Bologan twice etc...I was generally dangerous in open tournaments where I managed to win many of them by high performances.
teaching_experience: 2004-2007 coach at Belfort Echecs ( France), from 2006 to 2008 coach for the French youth team participating at European Championships.
other_experience: I commented live the French Championships in Belfort 2010 and it was a very challenging, but also a fascinating experience for me.
best_skills: My best skills in chess were a quick eye for tactics and a good technique in middlegames and endgames which I try to instill to my students from the first lesson. A good understanding of any type of position helps a lot in finding the right answer even in the most challenging situations. So, I try to help students to be quick-minded and alert in any situation.
teaching_methodology: I prefer an open approach towards chess, so lessons must be vivid and lively. Every lesson must follow a pattern and have a target, so the student must learn and fix the information received. I stress the importance of the basics in chess as Capablanca once mastered, the student must be equally good in all parts of the game ( opening, middlegame,endgame). Once this is achieved, the improvement is guaranteed and will continue step by step.

Entre mis mejores logros en lo personal fue obtener mi primera norma de Maestro Internacional en el Torneo Capablanca in Memorian, celebrado en la Habana, Cuba en el a√±o 2015.
teaching_experience: Soy maestro y entrenador de ajedrez desde hace 25 a√±os, comenc√© a dar clases en la academia de ajedrez de mi municipio C√°rdenas de la provincia Matanzas,  he trabajado con ni√±os, j√≥venes y adultos de diferentes niveles, obteniendo grandes resultados fuera y dentro de mi pa√≠s, fui entrenador de las Grandes Maestras Cubanas Yanira Vigoa y Zirka Frometa, ambas entre las mejores jugadoras cubanas por mucho tiempo y representantes en Olimpiadas de ajedrez. Actualmente doy clases en una escuela en M√©xico a ni√±os de primaria, secundaria y bachillerato.

En ellos abarco todo el contenido posible para una mejor comprensi√≥n, priorizando siempre el estudio independiente de los alumnos.

La mayor√≠a de mis alumnos han visto un gran resultado y han mejorado significativamente su rating online ya que todav√≠a no se puede jugar presencial,pero cuando comiencen estoy segura que lograr√°n sus metas
teaching_methodology: Me enfoco mucho en la teor√≠a y la t√°ctica para m√≠ es lo m√°s importante,igual trabajamos tu repertorio de apertura a tu estilo de juego y lo que mejor se te acotege, en torneos puedes contactarme para dudas de aperturas, preparaciones contra adversarios o motivaci√≥n. En cada clase tomaremos 5 min para un final basico,y en la pr√≥xima clase tomaremos 5 min sin contar la hora para jugarlo. Dejo algunas tareas y trabajo en casa que es muy importante para alcanzar tus objetivos m√°s r√°pidos. Lo importante es ayudarte a mejorar como jugador y repasar en los errores para no repetirlos,es mejor enfocarse en la calidad de la partida que el resultado ,el elo y el nivel despu√©s vienen solos. Es importante no adquirir conocimiento in√∫til con lo necesario bien aprendido tienes m√°s que suficiente para llegar a tu meta y m√°s.Cuando est√©s en un torneo te doy ejercicios de concertaci√≥n respiraci√≥n y los alimentos que debes comer para rendir bien en la partida. Tambi√©n hacemos ejercicios de motivaci√≥n y autoestima la psicolog√≠a juega un papel muy importante en una partida,siempre tienes que enfocarte que vas a ganar tengas a un mejor jugador delante,todos los grandes comenzaron como t√∫ .

teaching_methodology: The first "lesson" is usually a "get to know you" session where we explore some of the games of the student, his/her perception of the major strengths and weaknesses, and both ask any/all questions. We then form an initial plan for the next few sessions, so where we go very much depends on our findings.

about: Hello, I am Zhemba Jemusse of Zimbabwe, Harare. I am 27 years old. I fall in love with the game of chess at the age of 15 and I was addicted to the game till now. Through chess, I have met many wonderful people that have allowed my passion for the game to remain strong. I am looking forward to sharing my passion with students, sharing the secrets and the fundamentals of the game hoping to pursue their goals through chess.
playing_experience: I began in this beautiful sport at the age of 15.after two years of playing the game and studying I found myself qualify for a slot in the national team. I was the gold medalist in school events and other international tournaments. I came third place in the Africa junior championship where I managed to draw and beat the top-rated players of 2400 Fide ratings. I compete in one international event where I drew a grandmaster in ten moves, beating two international masters in less than 15 moves. I was one of the best over archivers in the 43rd Olympiad in Chennai, India and I got my Fide master title and international master norms, I got 7/5 out of ten games in the world event in 2022.two times national champion. most top players have difficulties meeting my style of play because I'm comfortable playing any opening in chess .i enjoy playing endgames too.
teaching_experience: I have started my journey of teaching chess professionally for 6 years, helping many students achieve their goals and improving their chess skills, and assisting them in increasing their rating by training together. I have helped different chess players from a rating of 1300 up to 2000.
best_skills: -do not hesitate to contact me if you have difficulties with openings and endgames.
teaching_methodology: -analyzing games and tactical training.

teaching_methodology: The methodology for teaching chess typically involves introducing the rules of the game and the movement of each piece, followed by strategy and tactics training through practice games and problem-solving exercises. Some teachers may also use interactive lessons, videos, or computer programs to supplement their instruction. As students progress, they may be taught more advanced concepts and participate in more challenging games and tournaments. It is important for teachers to adapt their teaching methods to the individual needs and abilities of their students.

name: NM Nikolas Theiss
headline: None
about: None
playing_experience: I learned the rules of chess as a child but didn't begin playing tournaments until I was in 7th grade. My first official rating was only 834; it's safe to say I didn't have the talent of a prodigy. What I did have was an instant fascination with the game, and simply playing a lot was enough for me to rise to 1800 by the time I finished high school. Along the way I managed to win a few class sections at large tournaments and also the K-12 section of the 2006 National Youth Action Blitz Tournament with a perfect 12/12 score. College marked the start of an extended break from chess for me. For the next six years I played tournaments only sporadically, and in my mid-twenties I was still rated 1800.
teaching_experience: I've taught chess for over a decade and worked with hundreds of students. I can confidently assert 90% of chess players have the potential to reach National Master and become a titled player. In my experience, two factors hold them back:
teaching_methodology: I apply a structured, professional approach to my coaching clients. During your first lesson we'll discuss your goals and analyze your games to create a training plan.

name: FM Charlie Galofre
headline: Unlock your potential with personalized chess coaching. Take your game to the next level with expert guidance. Transform your chess skills and dominate your opponent.
about: Hey there, I'm Charlie Galofre, a passionate chess coach who's dedicated to helping others improve their game. I was born in Queens, New York, but I've lived most of my life in South Florida, and I've had the chance to visit many countries in Central and South America. I even lived in Bogota, Colombia for a few years.
playing_experience: I've played in 126 tournaments so far, and I'm always looking for new opportunities to compete and improve my game. One of my most memorable moments was in 2007, when I won a tournament in Las Vegas with a score of 5.5 out of 6, essentially becoming a master after that tournament. Later that same year, I played in the U2400 section of the World Open tournament in Philadelphia and got second place with a score of 6.5 out of 9, earning the title of FIDE Master (FM).
teaching_experience: I've been coaching chess since 2001, and I'm proud to have helped many students improve their game and achieve their goals. I am in the process of getting accreditations from the USCF and FIDE. However nothing replaces my experience, my accomplishments, and titles which took a considerable amount of time to achieve.
best_skills: I possess fluency in both English and Spanish, allowing me to effectively communicate, read, and write in both languages. This linguistic proficiency enables me to connect with students from diverse backgrounds and cater to their individual needs.
teaching_methodology: Within my teaching methodology, I engage in comprehensive game analysis, actively pose thought-provoking questions, and offer valuable recommendations to my students. To facilitate their learning process, I encourage all my students to record our lessons via Skype. This recording serves as a valuable resource, allowing them to revisit the material covered in our previous session, solidify their understanding, and assimilate the concepts more effectively before our next class.

name: FM Mario Gavil√°n D√≠az
headline: None
about: I'm Spanish FM Mario Gavil√°n D√≠az, aged 29, currently 2300 fide rated. I've been playing chess since I was a kid,  but most of the time not as my main activity. However, in recent times I'm devoting most of my energy to both make progress myself and help other people to reach their goals. Chess is so beatiful, that I'd like to share my knowledge and experience with you.
playing_experience: My main goal now is to become IM in the near future. My rating has increased considerably in the past year, being very close to score my first IM norm. Along my career I've had some successes, like winning the Andalusian championship (the region where I live), finishing among the 20 best players in Spain and beating and drawing several +2600 players. And I've noticed the following: the more I work, the better results I get. It's simple.
teaching_experience: i've been a chess coach for about ten years now. I've taught all kind of students, from a very basic level to 2100-2200, including all ages as well. I like to see chess as a whole, and therefore I pay attention to different aspects of the game: work must be done on openings, middlegame and endings. I love chess classics, as in order to understand chess today we need to know what happened before, studying the games of great chess players of the past. Another crucial aspect is to analyse your own games, trying to find the mistakes that are repeating in order to eliminate them. As many GMs and chess coaches have concluded, the bigger progress is made from analysing your own games.
best_skills: My best skill is my devotion to chess. I really love the game, so transmitting my knowledge is something that I really enjoy. On top of that, I'm very hard working and take chess seriously, as work is the key to success.
teaching_methodology: Luckily, I've been trained myself by very strong GMS and IMs, and thanks to that I've picked up the best methodology of all of them. As described before, my goal is to work on all different aspects of the game, paying special attention to game analysis to develop your skills to the maximum. Memory is important of course, but understanding what's happening on the board is far more relevant. And all that without forgetting the heritage of the classics. One cannot understand the play of Magnus Carlsen if he doesn't know the games of Botvinnik.

name: FM Nenad Ravic
headline: I have years of experience in teaching chess. I developed a training program that I used to become a FM. I will do my best to help you to improve your chess skills.
about: I am 36 years old FM from Belgrade, Serbia. I am a professional chess coach and Associate Professor at Faculty of Business Economics and Entrepreneurship in Belgrade. Chess is my passion and teaching is my job that I like the most. As Faculty Professor with 12 years of experience in teaching I perfected my didactic skills of imparting knowledge and I use those skills in teaching chess. I developed chess training program that I used to become a FM. I do my best to help my chess students to achieve their goal and become a title players like me.
playing_experience: I am playing chess since I was a kid. I played a lot of tournaments and won a lot of trophies and medals. I will put the photos of them to my profile to prove it. I beat GM Milos Pavlovic. His peak was 2537 FIDE rating for standard chess. Receintly, had a draw against GM Nikola Sedlak in classic chess. His peak was 2608 FIDE rating for standard chess. You can find these games in Chessbase. I am a coach who still plays tournaments. I am an active competitor trying to increase my FIDE elo for classic chess. So, I can give you fresh informations from latest tournaments about trends in chess, for example, if we speak about the openings.
teaching_experience: I am a chess teacher for many years. I had students from US, Great Britain, Brasil, Hungary, India, South Africa and Serbia.
other_experience: I am a  faculty professor in the last 12 years and I have a lot of experience in teaching metodology. Not just about chess, but management, marketing and entrepreneurship.
best_skills: My specialties are tactics, offensive chess style, combinatorics, developing an attack on the oponent's king, openings theory.
teaching_methodology: I communicate with my students using Skype. I apply an individual approach to each student. Before lessons starting, I analyse the games of my student to identify his/her strenghts and weaknesses in chess and than I adapt my training program to that student specially. In some case focus is on middlegames, in other case focus is on endgames etc, depands on student's current knowledge. I, also, can do training games with you for a lower price or help you prepare for tournaments. Always find the right coaches for you, not the best coaches. GM coaches are not always the best for you to get better in chess. It depands on their motivation to show you everything they know and it's about how they teach.

name: GM Cristian Chirila
headline: Coach of world's #2 Fabiano Caruana since the '18 World Championship cycle. Head coach at the University of Missouri. Looking for motivated students!
about: Hello everybody, my name is Cristian Chirila. Below are some of my accomplishments as a player, coach, and commentator.
playing_experience: 25 years of playing experience
teaching_experience: Head Coach Bay Area Chess Elite Team (2015-2018)
other_experience: Chess Commentator for the St. Louis Chess Club & Grand Chess Tour broadcasts.
teaching_methodology: None

name: IM Andrei Cioara
headline: None
about: My name is Andrei CioarƒÉ, I am International Master, rating 2417, with 2 GM norms, and I can say I spent my whole life in chess, in all aspects of it, player, trainer, organizer, commentator and arbiter.
playing_experience: I started to play chess at the age of 8. I earned IM and 2 GM norms. I was 2 times Romanian Junior runner-up, I played for top teams in Romania and abroad, for Trier in German Bundesliga and for Manx in 4NCL.
teaching_experience: I am FIDE Instructor and for several years I was the Federal National Trainer of Romanian Chess Federation. Many of my pupils became international title holders and medalists of the Romanian National Championships.
other_experience: I got a Master Degree from National University of Physical Education and Sport and I published a book for chess beginners. I am also an International FIDE Organizer with dozens of competitions organized, among them Predeal Chess Festival, National Championships, World Amateur Chess Championship 2007, European Blitz and Rapid Championships for Women 2007, other open tournaments, youth competitions. I was official commentator for the match Topalov - Nisipeanu 2006.
teaching_methodology: I like to start with some kind of test for each student to see how good you are. I will make some test and give you some time to solve in different areas such as openings, middle games and endgames of course. This will help me a lot to see how strong player you are. Also I need to see some of your games played on longer time control (no less than 15 minutes per player) and also hear your comments on them, on some interesting moments during the game to see and hear how you think.

name: CM Slobodan Kuzmanoviƒá
headline: None
about: Dear students, my name is Slobodan Kuzmanoviƒá. I come from Tesliƒá, Republika Srpska. I was born in 1971, so I am 49 years old. I was the champion of Republika Srpska in standard and rapid. I won second place at the Paraƒáin B Open. I successfully run the chess club "Mladost" from Tesliƒá. My students from the club are multiple champions at the cadet and junior national championships and state ones. They won three medals at the European Championships in rapid and blitz. My highest rating was 2202. As a coach, my main goal is to transfer knowledge to the student. One hour with me, 45 minutes, is 10 euros. A match of 6 games with me costs 15 euros. Payment with me is made in advance before training. I will organize simultaneous ones in which you will have the right to participate.
playing_experience: He played a lot of successful leagues and quite successfully on the territory of the Republic of Srpska and Serbia. I have participated in many Open tournaments both in Bosnia and Herzegovina and abroad, where I have achieved notable results. Either I won regular prizes (even first places) or I won special prizes as the best player in certain categories. At the weekend blitz and rally tournaments, I won numerous awards (memorial tournaments, international tournaments, Open tournament, etc ...) Certainly one of the most significant results is winning first place in the standard and rapid championship of the Chess Federation of Republika Srpska.
teaching_experience: I am the head of the chess club "Mladost" Tesliƒá, and I am also the coach of that club. A large number of children went through my chess club, and it should certainly be emphasized that with my club and my students who play for the club, I strengthened my position in the first league of Republika Srpska. At the same time, my students are multiple champions at the cadet and junior championships of the Republika Srpska and the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, after which they gained the right to participate in the European and World Championships. One of the more significant results of my students that I coached was winning three medals at European blitz and rapid championships. My students have won awards in their city as sporting hopes. I had several online lectures with students who after that achieved great results both in the game and in the rating!
other_experience: Chess has allowed me to travel to different places, both in the cities of the country I come from and outside it. By coming to different places, I had the opportunity to experience a lot of different things: the ambience of the space, the prizes in the tournament, the players participating in the tournament, and the place where I played. These are the reasons why I like to play tournaments, because every tournament brings me something new. Chess in itself is beautiful as a game and as a sport. The following information speaks about the beauty of chess and the surprises that happen in chess - there are different possibilities in the first ten moves in the trillions. Chess is a struggle of minds, and concentration is one of the key factors. As a chess coach, I have a lot of experience working with students and I know what they need to progress!
best_skills: In chess, when I play a game, the most common victories I achieved were thanks to combination motives, tactics and better knowledge in endgames. As a coach I have a huge experience. Now, I can't specify one area in particular, as a coach, in which I am good, since I have been working with students for more than 15 years, so one huge coaching experience is behind me. I can easily recognize the flaws in the student, the mistakes he makes, the good sides, the breakdown of his analyzes that I have written down, I can clarify some things.
teaching_methodology: I start working on chess endgames with a beginner so that he can understand the basic principles in chess. I own the original Chess Base 13 chess program with its bases. I also own some videos from Andrew Martin and Elisabeth Pahtz that I send to students to study and I own about 500 books in PDF format. I have Skype, I get in touch with students through it and share a screen from where they can follow what I teach them from the lessons. I have everything ready in advance from start to finish, because as I have already stated, I am a coach with a lot of experience.

name: NM Algol Jorajuria
headline: None
about: Hello! My name is Algol. I'm a 19 year old national master from Mexico. I'm currently studying physics. I'm looking for students who are interested in improving, fide 1500 and above.
playing_experience: I have recently played the World U20 and the Continental Championship. I have been playing chess since I was 6 y.o. Last year I won my first international open tournament. I have already acquired a couple GM scalps.
teaching_experience: I have experience teaching both the traditional way (general principles, pawn structures, typical plans & theoretical endgames) and the disruptive way (awareness of positional details, practical play, postional sacrifices, synergetic work with engines and opening novelties).
best_skills: Playable sidelines. Understanding niche positions. Drawing inferior endgames.
teaching_methodology: I like to focus on the middle game but in all aspects of the game the method is the same. I like to analyze my students' games and see what they did wrong and focus on the positions that they didn't understand. The class often goes into tangents but I don't mind that because the most important thing to do in your training is to be curious and to sit down and think. Often times we don't undestand the position because we focus on the wrong things, and when we look at the engine's move, we are confused but that's because we aren't paying attention to a specific detail in the position.

name: IM Marcos Paolozzi
headline: None
about: I fell in love with chess at the age of 11. Even though I was knocked out of my first tournament in the first round, the passion remained and I eventually traveled the path from chess beginner to National Champion of Brazil.
playing_experience: I was born in Brazil, and at the time international tournaments were very, very rare. At 17 I visited the US for the first time, achieving the US Master title in my first attempt, and Senior Master the following year.
teaching_experience: Here¬¥s what some of my students had to say:
other_experience: After achieving my goal, the IM title, I left competitive chess.  The skills I learned were invaluable in enabling me to launch a career in the financial markets, eventually becoming a portfolio manager for banks and pension funds ‚Äì trading in stocks, bonds and currencies.
best_skills: I have traveled the path from chess beginner to National Champion. As your coach, I will be your guide and ally so that your full chess potential may bloom.
teaching_methodology: Know thyself: that is a good place to start. Since classes will be customized for you, I would like to know about yourself and some of your games. From there we will be able to learn about your strengths and areas where improvement is possible. I love to analyze games from the great champions, and we will go over some chess masterpieces to illustrate concepts and strategical and tactical themes.

name: IM Brian Escalante
headline: None
about: Hello everyone!/ Hola a todos!
playing_experience: I have participated in various Pan-Americans and World Championships, these are some of my accomplishments:
teaching_experience: I have coached more than 30 people ranging from the ages of 6-70. Helping each student achieve their chess goals has been a rewarding journey and I hope to be able to do it for even more players. from local club champions to Pan American medalists, each student has their own motivations and playing style and my job is to help them enhance their strengths and reduce their weaknesses.
teaching_methodology: I will create a personalized training plan suited to your needs in which we will reinforce your strengths and reduce your weaknesses. We will look at different aspects of chess, such as tactics, positional play, strategy, openings, endgames, etc. Also, we will go through your most recent games played in a tournament in order to correct the mistakes made, so you don't make them again in future games.

best_skills: I teach all the concepts of chess equally. All the parts of chess game are important. The opening is important, because chess player needs to get a solid position after it. Middle game is important, because  chess player needs to know what plan to choose and is it correct or not.
teaching_methodology: I analyze openings very deeply and explain them to my students. For me it is important that my students don't just memorize all the variations, but they really do understand what is happening on the board.

name: GM Matthias Wahls
headline: Success in Chess is a result of collecting a multitude of optical patterns and firmly combine it with a well organized system of principles.
about: I was born in Hamburg, where I live again after many years abroad.
playing_experience: I am a grandmaster since 1989. My best place in the world was number 50.
teaching_experience: I am a chess teacher for more than 30 years, now.
other_experience: I wrote two conventional opening books on the Scandinavian Defense and one pgn-book on the Four Knights Sicilian.
best_skills: Generally, I have a very analytical approach and a good positional understanding. This helps me to quickly grasp the logic of an opening or a specific line. Consequently, I always enjoyed doing opening research. As a teacher, I am able to convey this logical approach to my students.
teaching_methodology: Chess is a fundamentally logical game. Hence, every concrete line or optical pattern has an abstract equivalent. In order to thrive as a chess player, we should know why we are doing certain things, opposed to simply learning lines by heart. We should always try to detect the logical principles behind the moves. Only if we firmly connect abstract and concrete thinking, we will rise to our full potential.

name: FM Carl Boor
headline: None
about: It is critical for a coach to not only have a strong knowledge base, but also to inspire and build confidence. I pride myself on being able to balance these elements in my teaching while at the same time create a fun, yet structured, learning experience.
playing_experience: I learned chess from my father at the age of 3 but I was something of a late boomer. However through much hard work I achieved the National Master Title in 1998, Fide Master in 2009 and Senior Master (USCF 2400+) in 2012. I am a 3 time Champion of Ohio. In July of I became the 2012 World Open co champion and Midwest Class co champion for a combined win of over $10,000 in prizes. I have great experience in the US class sections and coaching players as they move up the ranks.
teaching_experience: Technology has opened up access to innovation in chess learning like never before. Online chess training using Skype and sharing screens is an excellent and streamlined way to receive chess knowledge. I want to emphasize the strength of this platform; if you are new to Skype have no worries I will walk you through the set up process and make it a smooth and fun learning experience.
teaching_methodology: Technology has opened up access to innovation in chess learning like never before. Online chess training using Skype and sharing screens is an excellent and streamlined way to receive chess knowledge. name: WFM Lorita Mwango
headline: None
about: I am a 25 year old Zambian female,currently residing in south Africa. I am a qualified high school teacher of Mathematics and attained my Degree in 2016 from the copperbelt university in kitwe,Zambia. I am a WIM elect, working to get my fide rating to 2000 so that my WIM title can start showing as it is a conditional title.
playing_experience: I have been a professional chess player for about 10 years now.I am currently the highest fide rated female in Zambia. I first qualified into the national team in 2010 and represented my country to a national team friendly between Botswana team and the Zambian National team,this was in fact my first international tournament .From that one, I went on to  also play for the Zambia Junior team in Botswana  in the Africa youth chess championships.. I have gone on to represent my country in 4 Olympiads;Russia,Turkey,Norway and Azerbaijan.I have also played a number of other tournaments,Africa youths, Zonals,Africa individuals and alot  of local tournaments with good performance .I have gotten a chance to play in the commonwealth games in India,and recently got a silver medal at the All Africa games in Morocco. I have also attained a conditional WIM title after coming out 2nd  at the 2017 africa individual in Livingstone,Zambia that will only show when my fide rating gets to 2000. Apart from that,I have been a national sportswoman of the year nominee twice,2018 and 2019 and hopeful that indeed I will one day scoop that award. These are among the great achievements I have in this great game of Chess.
teaching_experience: I taught  maths to over 89 boys for 3 months and gained  a good amount of teaching experience in that period of time.I have been working as a coach for goforchess academy here in southAfrica  from the beginning of the this year.I believe I am well equipped and can help you reach your goals as a chess player
other_experience: Other experiences include coaching a school team for there interschool chess competitions that so the senior team come 2nd and the junior team come first in there respective categories.
best_skills: I believe the best skill in teaching is good communication, it's the coach getting the message across to the student in a  simple and precise way,a way that's easy to understand and apply. It's the coach/teacher being able to  listen to the learning needs of there student.
teaching_methodology: The lessons are prepared according to the students needs,thereafter the lessons are done on zoom and using various other platforms like Lichess,the lesson is carried out.homework is sometimes given at the end of the lesson.I then need that homework submitted and it is then discussed in the next lesson as a follow up

name: FM Liviu  Cerbulenco
headline: None
about: My name is Liviu Cerbulenco. I am from Moldova. I study at the State University of Moldova at the faculty of Foreign Languages (applied English and applied German) and I am Fide Master, currently my official rating being - 2300. I play chess for many years and have a lot of experience of playing against fide masters, international masters and grandmasters. I won many serious national tournaments and I show  good results at international ones.
playing_experience: I have many excellent results, among which the 1st place at the National Chess Championship of Moldova in 2014 (I am still the youngest national chess champion of our country) , becoming the absolute champion of Moldova (I became the youngest national chess champion of our country in the history). After that I became a part of our national team to participate at the World Chess Olympiad which took place in Tromso, Norway also in 2014. Another great result was taking the 3rd place at the European Team Chess Championship U18 when our team showed a great play against more rated teams.
teaching_experience: I have  a wide coach experience. I  have been training via Skype many years, and I train face-to-face as well. I can teach anyone the important aspects of chess, as well as more deep ones which will bring any player to the wishfull development of his chess skill. I can help players of any level to excell their strategy, tactics, endings. I also have a very big database of chess openings analysis which I would be glad to send to my "chess pupils".
teaching_methodology: I use Chessbase, where I can show you different aspects of strategy, tactics, ending, etc. I have a lot of great books and analyse the games from that books with my students (I choose the books depending on student level). We study typical positions, pawn structures, typical plans and manoeuvres. We analyse together the student's games, find the mistakes and the students take great lessons from that. I have Very Deep Opening Analysis which I share with my students of any level (from beginner to grandmaster). I develop the teaching programm according to the individual characteristics of my students.
